original: bag chags nus pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: bag chags nus pa nyid yin nam /
translated: Are the latent potentialities themselves the cause of the arising of the mental continuum in another body?

original: 'dus byas pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Or are they the cause of the arising of a mental continuum that is a different kind of thing from the latent potentialities?

original: khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference between these two positions.🔽Therefore, the conclusion is this:

original: de'i phyir mjug sdud ba ni bag chags sad ba'i rkyen de sna tshogs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mjug sdud ba ni bag chags sad ba'i rkyen de sna tshogs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the conditions that awaken the latent potentialities are various,

original: bag chags sad pa sna tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: bag chags sad pa sna tshogs pa yin la /
translated: the awakening of the latent potentialities is various.

original: de'i phyir shi ba'i lus la sems ldog pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir shi ba'i lus la sems ldog pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the mind returns to the body after death.

original: / gal te lus tsam rgyu yin yang sems ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te lus tsam rgyu yin yang sems ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the body alone is the cause, then the mind would return to the body even though it has been destroyed.

original: lus tsam rgyu yin pa la yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lus tsam rgyu yin pa la yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: But it is not the case that the body alone is the cause.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “alone” is supplied.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba yang rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The word “return” is supplied.

original: gzhan gyis lan phran tshogs ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis lan phran tshogs ni /
translated: The opponent’s response to this is:

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because it is seen that the body and mind are similar.”

original: spong ba ni 'di ga las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba ni 'di ga las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “How is this known?”

original: rgyu nyid du tshad ma las ma grub pa dang // gnod pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du tshad ma las ma grub pa dang // gnod pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not established by a valid cognition that the body is the cause, and it is contradicted.

original: rang gi 'dod pas sdud pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas sdud pa ni /
translated: The summary of the opponent’s position is:

original: sems kyi bag chags sna tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyi bag chags sna tshogs pa ni /
translated: The various latent impressions of the mind

original: mthong ba ste tshad mas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ste tshad mas nges pa yin no //
translated: are seen, i.e., ascertained by means of a valid cognition.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de lta min na rmi lam du shes pa sna tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta min na rmi lam du shes pa sna tshogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the various cognitions in a dream would not be tenable.

original: yang na gal te sems rgyu yin pa bzhin du lus tsam rgyu yin pa yang mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na gal te sems rgyu yin pa bzhin du lus tsam rgyu yin pa yang mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Or else, if the mere body were the cause, just like the mind, it would be seen as the cause.

original: des na de log pas kyang ldog par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des na de log pas kyang ldog par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that it would also cease when that ceases.

original: lus tsam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus tsam zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mere body is stated.

original: sems tsam rgyu yin pa ltar lus tsam na sems kyi rgyu yin par ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems tsam rgyu yin pa ltar lus tsam na sems kyi rgyu yin par ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mere body is not seen as the cause of the mind, just as the mind alone is the cause.

original: gzhan gyis 'di ga las shes bras ta /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'di ga las shes bras ta /
translated: How is this known by others?

original: lus tsam rgyur ma grub pa ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽lan ni sna tshogs pa'i sems ni lus tsam gyi rgyu tsam du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus tsam rgyur ma grub pa ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // lan ni sna tshogs pa'i sems ni lus tsam gyi rgyu tsam du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is: why is the mere body not established as the cause?🔽The answer is: because the various minds are not tenable as the mere cause of the body.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i @77a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i @77a * //
translated: The various minds are not the cause of the mere body.

original: bag chags mthong ba ste nges pa na shes pa thams cad bag chags sad pa'i rgyu can yin no //🔽gang gis de la gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ba /🔽gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i shes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bag chags mthong ba ste nges pa na shes pa thams cad bag chags sad pa'i rgyu can yin no // gang gis de la gzhan yang de ltar 'gyur ba / gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i shes pa'i phyir na /
translated: When the latent impressions are seen, that is, ascertained, all consciousnesses are caused by the activation of latent impressions.🔽How is it ascertained that the diversity of consciousness does not occur without the diversity of latent impressions?🔽Because it is ascertained that consciousness does not occur in any other way.

original: bag chags kyi sna tshogs pa med par mi 'byung bar nges pa'i shes pa de gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: bag chags kyi sna tshogs pa med par mi 'byung bar nges pa'i shes pa de gang yin snyam na /
translated: What is that ascertaining consciousness?

original: rmi lam shes pa zhes gsungs so //🔽dper na rmi lam gyis shes pa sna tshogs pa lus kyi rgyu can du mi 'thad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rmi lam shes pa zhes gsungs so // dper na rmi lam gyis shes pa sna tshogs pa lus kyi rgyu can du mi 'thad pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is the consciousness of dreams.

original: bag chags sna tshogs pa rgyu yin par nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bag chags sna tshogs pa rgyu yin par nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is ascertained that the diversity of consciousness in dreams is caused by the diversity of latent impressions because it is untenable that it is caused by the body.

original: nges pa de'i phyir na /🔽sna tshogs pa'i shes pa gzhan pa gzhan gyi rgyu yang bag chags sna tshogs pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa de'i phyir na / sna tshogs pa'i shes pa gzhan pa gzhan gyi rgyu yang bag chags sna tshogs pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: For that very reason,

original: lus tsam la sogs pa ni ma yin par nges pa yin no //🔽de la re zhig dpe nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: lus tsam la sogs pa ni ma yin par nges pa yin no // de la re zhig dpe nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: it is ascertained that the diversity of consciousness in the waking state is also caused by the diversity of latent impressions and not by the body alone.

original: gal te lus dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te lus dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example itself is explained in the line “If the body and so on are not diverse, then consciousness will not be diverse.”

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung ste thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung ste thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: At that time is drawn out from within and is applied to all.

original: shes pa sna tshogs ba lus la sogs pa'i rgyu can du me 'thad pa na bag chags pa nyid gsal bar byed nus pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa sna tshogs ba lus la sogs pa'i rgyu can du me 'thad pa na bag chags pa nyid gsal bar byed nus pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: When it is not tenable that the various consciousnesses are caused by the body, etc., it is clarified that they are caused by latent impressions.

original: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by by some.

original: dpe bshad nas lhag ma mjug sdud pas rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: dpe bshad nas lhag ma mjug sdud pas rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Having explained the example, the remainder is summarized and commented upon.

original: de'i phyir sems thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, all minds and so on.

original: bag chags sad pas byas te /
analyzed: bag chags sad pas byas te /
translated: They are produced by the activation of latent impressions.

original: nges par gnas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are definitely present

original: pa na tshun spangs nas gnas te /
analyzed: pa na tshun spangs nas gnas te /
translated: and they are present in mutual exclusion.

original: gcig gi rmi lam gyi shes pa ci lta ba de ltar gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi rmi lam gyi shes pa ci lta ba de ltar gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as one's dream consciousness is, so are the others, but not in the same way.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na snang ba'i shes pa rnams ni bag chags tsam las skyes pa'i phyir mi bden pa nyid do snyam du bsams ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam na snang ba'i shes pa rnams ni bag chags tsam las skyes pa'i phyir mi bden pa nyid do snyam du bsams ba'o //
translated: But if means that it is thought that the consciousnesses appearing in dreams are not real because they are produced from mere latent impressions.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin yang mi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni bag chags kyis bskyed pa yin yang mi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Although they are produced by latent impressions, they are not unreal.

original: mi bden par bsgrub pa la bag chags las skyes pa nyid ma nges par brjod ba ni /
analyzed: mi bden par bsgrub pa la bag chags las skyes pa nyid ma nges par brjod ba ni /
translated: To prove that they are unreal, he says that it is not certain that they are produced from latent impressions.

original: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, “That is also unreal.”

original: rang don ni bde ba dang yid dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang don ni bde ba dang yid dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One’s own purpose is happiness, joy, and so on.

original: de lta yin mod /
analyzed: de lta yin mod /
translated: Although that is so,

original: de lta na yang ci ltar bden pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar bden pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: how can they be real?

original: yod nyid don byed pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod nyid don byed pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Real is that which exists and performs a function.”

original: 'chad pa ni don byed pa las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni don byed pa las kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Explaining” is the verse that begins, “That which performs a function . . .”

original: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba gang yin pa @77b de byed pa la 'debs par te /
analyzed: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba gang yin pa @77b de byed pa la 'debs par te /
translated: That which performs a function, such as cooking, burning, and so on, which is a desired activity, is “that which is engaged in activity.”

original: gze bar 'jug pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: gze bar 'jug pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Those that are engaged in activity are called “that which performs a function.”

original: mi bden pa nyid yin te des bden pa'i bdag nyid 'dor ba gang yin pa de dag ni de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid yin te des bden pa'i bdag nyid 'dor ba gang yin pa de dag ni de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are not real. That which abandons the nature of reality is called “unreal.”

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If” is the opponent’s position.

original: lan ni skye ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni skye ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The answer is “birth, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba bden pa'i lus dang 'brel par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba bden pa'i lus dang 'brel par ro //
translated: “Thus” refers to the connection with the body of reality.

original: mtshungs pa nyid brjod pa ni /🔽de dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid brjod pa ni / de dag kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression of similarity is🔽“Those also”

original: tha snyad dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad dag kyang ngo //
translated: “are conventional designations.”

original: der zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa 'chi ba dang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa 'chi ba dang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “There” refers to the desired death and birth.

original: bden pa'i lus phan tshun khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag len pa dang / len pa tha snyad gang la yong pa de rnams ni de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i lus phan tshun khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag len pa dang / len pa tha snyad gang la yong pa de rnams ni de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those who have a different body of reality, because of the mutual difference of the bodies of reality, and those conventional designations that occur in the taking up of that body of reality are called that.

original: de la 'chi pa'i sems ni bden pa'i lus dang 'brel par mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la 'chi pa'i sems ni bden pa'i lus dang 'brel par mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: In that regard, the mind of death is seen to be connected with the body of reality.

original: skye ba'i sems la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i sems la brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the mind of birth is

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thus.”

original: 'jug pa'i tha snyad 'dogs ba'am mngal nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tha snyad 'dogs ba'am mngal nas byung ba'o //
translated: The conventional designation of entry is the womb or the birth canal.

original: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The expression of the latent impressions is the dispute.

original: dmigs pa med par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Without an object” means

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: that it is not perceived.

original: rgan po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lan to //
analyzed: rgan po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lan to //
translated: “Old age, etc.” is the reply.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If” and so on is the opponent’s rejoinder.

original: rgan po la sogs pa'i lus la su 'pho ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ni'o //
analyzed: rgan po la sogs pa'i lus la su 'pho ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ni'o //
translated: “What sort of transference is there from the body of an old man, etc.?”

original: lan ni de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is “Even so,”

original: gal te yang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su khu khrag gcig las byung ba nyid yod pa de lta na yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te yang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su khu khrag gcig las byung ba nyid yod pa de lta na yang ngo //
translated: “Even if there is a single origin from semen and blood in the states of childhood, etc., still

original: ldog pa ste med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ste med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: there is no transference, no nonexistence.”

original: 'ga' zhig ce na lus gzhan nyid de //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ce na lus gzhan nyid de //
translated: “Of what?” “Of another body.”

original: re zhig tha dad pa nyid ni bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: re zhig tha dad pa nyid ni bzlog par dka'o //
translated: “For it is hard to reverse the fact that they are different.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gnyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gnyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Because they have different characteristics.”

original: byis pa'i 'og rol bag ma blangs kyi bar ni gzhon du ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i 'og rol bag ma blangs kyi bar ni gzhon du ste /
translated: “From childhood up to the time of taking a wife is youth.”

original: de nyid kyi lus kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun par gsal ba'i phyir na thad dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lus kyang mtshan nyid mi mthun par gsal ba'i phyir na thad dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Because that very body is clearly seen to be dissimilar, it is only different.

original: tha dad par 'pho ba yang mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: tha dad par 'pho ba yang mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: And because it is seen to be transferred to a different place,

original: khu khrag gzhan gyis bskyed pa la yang 'gal ba ci yod snyam du bsams ba'o //
analyzed: khu khrag gzhan gyis bskyed pa la yang 'gal ba ci yod snyam du bsams ba'o //
translated: what contradiction is there in its being generated by other semen and blood?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But” is another’s opinion.

original: rigs mi 'dra ba ni shin tu rigs mi mtshungs ba la 'dod do //
analyzed: rigs mi 'dra ba ni shin tu rigs mi mtshungs ba la 'dod do //
translated: “Very dissimilar” means extremely dissimilar.

original: lan ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “In a dream . . .”

original: shin tu rigs mi 'dra ba'i lus @78a * //
analyzed: shin tu rigs mi 'dra ba'i lus @78a * //
translated: “A body very dissimilar”

original: gzhan du 'pho ba ma mthong ba de yang ngo //🔽rgas pa pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'pho ba ma mthong ba de yang ngo // rgas pa pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “is not seen to be transferred to another place.”

original: rmi lam gyi lus de'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus de'o //
translated: “That” refers to the body in a dream.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //🔽mthong ba ni zhes bya ba mngon sum du snang ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o // mthong ba ni zhes bya ba mngon sum du snang ba ste /
translated: The answer is “No, it is not.”🔽“Seen” means directly appearing.

original: mngon sum gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “having the nature of direct perception.”

original: gang las mi bden par 'gyur ba de la gnod pa yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang las mi bden par 'gyur ba de la gnod pa yang ci zhig yod /
translated: What harm is there in that, if it is not true?

original: mngon sum la gnod pa 'jug na ni gzhan la yang yid brtan du ci yod /
analyzed: mngon sum la gnod pa 'jug na ni gzhan la yang yid brtan du ci yod /
translated: If you can refute perception, what else can you rely on?

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of two moons

original: zla ba'i rnam pa can gyi blo nyid snang ba yin la /
analyzed: zla ba'i rnam pa can gyi blo nyid snang ba yin la /
translated: is the appearance of a cognition that has the form of a moon.

original: de la gnod pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnod pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no refutation of that.

original: gnod pa ni brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa ni brtags pa'i phyi rol gyi zla ba gnyis nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The refutation is of the external object, the two moons that are imagined.

original: de ni snang ba ma yin no zhes spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni snang ba ma yin no zhes spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not the appearance.

original: lhag pa brjod pa'i don du lan 'di la nges pa ma skyes pas rtsod pa brjod ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa brjod pa'i don du lan 'di la nges pa ma skyes pas rtsod pa brjod ba ni /
translated: In order to express the remainder, he raises the question, “How is it known that the appearance of the two moons is not real?”

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //🔽rmi lam gyi lus de'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o // rmi lam gyi lus de'o //
translated: The meaning of “How?”🔽is the body in a dream.

original: der ni rmi lam gyi lus su'o //🔽lhag pa nyid brjod pa'i don dri ba ni /
analyzed: der ni rmi lam gyi lus su'o // lhag pa nyid brjod pa'i don dri ba ni /
translated: “There” means in the dream body.🔽The question, “What is it?”

original: ci zhig ces bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
translated: is for the purpose of expressing the remainder.

original: mi bden pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: mi bden pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: What is it that is called “unreal”?

original: gnod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gnod pa nyid dam /
translated: Is it the harm itself?

original: yun ring du mi gnas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: yun ring du mi gnas pa nyid dam /
translated: Is it the fact that it does not last long?

original: thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is it the fact that it is perceived in a way that is not common to all?

original: de la dang po gsal pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po gsal pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first of these is the objection that the dream example is not analogous to the case of waking experience because the object is not perceived:

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “When” refers to the time of sleep.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su'o //🔽de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su'o // de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “At another time” refers to the time of waking.🔽“At that time” refers to the time of sleep.

original: gnyid log pa'i des kyang ngo //
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i des kyang ngo //
translated: “By that” refers to the sleep.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhin gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhin gyi'o //
translated: “If” refers to the waking state.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa sad nam dmigs so zhes rtogs par byas so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa sad nam dmigs so zhes rtogs par byas so //
translated: “The consciousness of the dream” refers to the consciousness of the waking state.

original: sad pa dang ma sad pa dag ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: sad pa dang ma sad pa dag ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “The waking and the not waking” is the reply.

original: gzhan dag tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni /
translated: The other party states the reason for the difference:🔽“I.”

original: nga zhes bya ba'o //🔽grub pa'i mtha' 'di ma nges so zhes brjod pa ni bzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba'o // grub pa'i mtha' 'di ma nges so zhes brjod pa ni bzhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “No!”

original: nga sad do snyam pa'i shes pa de las so //
analyzed: nga sad do snyam pa'i shes pa de las so //
translated: “The consciousness that thinks ‘I am waking up’” refers to the consciousness of the waking state.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: “Therefore” concludes the argument.

original: sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid dmigs par mtshungs pa la'o //
analyzed: sad pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid dmigs par mtshungs pa la'o //
translated: in the case of the cognition of the waking state and the cognition in a dream, which are similar in being objects.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin med ba'am zla ba ltar mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin med ba'am zla ba ltar mi bden pa'o //
translated: It is like the horn of a rabbit, or it is not real, like the moon.

original: zla ba gnyis mi bden pa mi snang yang gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lugs ngan gyi gzhung la @78b ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis mi bden pa mi snang yang gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lugs ngan gyi gzhung la @78b ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement, “Even though the two moons are not real, they are not non-existent because they are perceived,” is made in reliance on the bad system of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: dngos po la ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las phung po gsum pa med do zhes byis pa yang chad la grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las phung po gsum pa med do zhes byis pa yang chad la grags pa yin no //
translated: Even the foolish know that in the case of an entity, there is no third alternative apart from being an entity and being a non-entity.

original: des na gal te gsal ba nyid kyis med pa la ltos nas ni /
analyzed: des na gal te gsal ba nyid kyis med pa la ltos nas ni /
translated: So if non-existence relies on existence,

original: de'i tshe dngos po nyid yin par phung po gsum ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po nyid yin par phung po gsum ga la yod /
translated: then how could there be a third alternative in the case of an entity?

original: gsal bzhin pa la ni gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: gsal bzhin pa la ni gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: And we have already explained that there is no refutation of that which is in the process of becoming manifest.

original: rnam par rtog pa lhag ma gnyis kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lhag ma gnyis kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the remaining two alternatives, he says,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ste dang zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ste dang zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
translated: “Or, if you think that . . .” The word “or” indicates a summary.

original: de'i don mi 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don mi 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bag chags stobs chung bas byas pa shes pa stobs chung ba'i ming can ring du mi gnas pa dang thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa de rmi lam gyi shes pa'i mi bden pa nyid yin gyi med pa'am brdzun ba ma yin te rigs pa
analyzed: bag chags stobs chung bas byas pa shes pa stobs chung ba'i ming can ring du mi gnas pa dang thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa de rmi lam gyi shes pa'i mi bden pa nyid yin gyi med pa'am brdzun ba ma yin te rigs pa
translated: The dream consciousness is not false or nonexistent, but is simply a case of misperception.🔽

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The dream consciousness is not unreal because of nonexistence or falsity, but because of the weakness of the latent impressions, the name “weak consciousness” is given, and it does not last long, and it is not commonly perceived.

original: lan bu'o na gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan bu'o na gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “What is that?”

original: bag chags brtan pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags brtan pas byas pa'i ring du gnas pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags brtan pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags brtan pas byas pa'i ring du gnas pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: “Stable latent impressions” means that it is intended to express the long duration produced by stable latent impressions.

original: bzlog pa ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni bden pa'o //
translated: The opposite is true.

original: chos 'pho ba nyid ni chos can bden pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'pho ba nyid ni chos can bden pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The transference of the property is because the property possessor is true.

original: thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Common perception” means

original: yang gang la bag chags brtan pa yod pa der bzlog pa'i phyir 'pho ba nyid do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang gang la bag chags brtan pa yod pa der bzlog pa'i phyir 'pho ba nyid do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: that where there are stable latent impressions, there is transference because of the opposite.

original: thun mong du dmigs ba ni /
analyzed: thun mong du dmigs ba ni /
translated: Common perception is

original: gzhan gyis sa dang ri la sogs pa ci ltar dmigs ba de ltar de ring skyes pas kyang dmigs ba rmi lam ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sa dang ri la sogs pa ci ltar dmigs ba de ltar de ring skyes pas kyang dmigs ba rmi lam ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as others perceive earth, mountains, and so on, so too does one born today perceive them. But dreams are not like that.

original: de dag sdud pa ni nga 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag sdud pa ni nga 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of “I” is the collection of the aggregates.

original: mi bden pa'i tha snyad skye ba ni bden min skye ba ste 'di las skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i tha snyad skye ba ni bden min skye ba ste 'di las skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of unreal conventions is the arising of the unreal.

original: thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i bya ba yod pa ste 'bru mang bo pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la thun mong ma yin par dmigs pa'i bya ba yod pa ste 'bru mang bo pa'o //
translated: The shared object is the object of the shared perception.

original: skabs su bab pa skye ba dang po'i gnas skabs can yang sad pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa skye ba dang po'i gnas skabs can yang sad pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
translated: The arising that is relevant is the arising that has the nature of the waking consciousness.

original: bden pa la 'da' ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa la 'da' ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that it transcends the truth.

original: des na 'pho ba grub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'pho ba grub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the proof of transference is established.

original: 'on rmi lam gyis shes pa ji ltar mi bden zhes na /
analyzed: 'on rmi lam gyis shes pa ji ltar mi bden zhes na /
translated: But how is dream consciousness unreal?

original: bstan pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “The absence of teaching.”

original: de tsam gyis rmi lam mi bden par tha snyad byed kyang skabs nyams pa ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro //🔽rmi lam yang @79a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyis rmi lam mi bden par tha snyad byed kyang skabs nyams pa ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro // rmi lam yang @79a * //
translated: Although one uses the expression “dream is not true” in that way, it is not the case that the context is lost, because that is not so.

original: mi bden par nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mi bden par nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And it is not the case that the dream is not ascertained as not true.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ste rmi lam du'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ste rmi lam du'o //
translated: The expression “in that way” refers to the dream.

original: gnyig la yang thun mong du de ltar snang ba de nye bar bstan pa'i sman la sogs pa zos pas nad zhi ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyig la yang thun mong du de ltar snang ba de nye bar bstan pa'i sman la sogs pa zos pas nad zhi ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In both cases, the appearance of that sort is taught to be the experience of the pacification of illness, etc., by the ingestion of medicine, etc., that is similar to it.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyun la ltos nas yun ring du rjes su 'brel ba yang yin pa'i phyir der ci ltar mi bden pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyun la ltos nas yun ring du rjes su 'brel ba yang yin pa'i phyir der ci ltar mi bden pa yin /
translated: And it is also the case that it is related to a long-lasting continuum of effects, so how could it be untrue?

original: 'on te de'i tshe bden pa nyid do zhes bya ba gnyis la rmi lam du mthong ba snang ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe bden pa nyid do zhes bya ba gnyis la rmi lam du mthong ba snang ba'i dus na'o //
translated: But if it is true at that time, then the two, the time of seeing the dream and the time of waking up, are the same.

original: de ltar bag chags brtan ba dang bcad pa'i rmi lam du rigs mi mthun pa'i lus su 'pho ba ni bden pas khyab par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bag chags brtan ba dang bcad pa'i rmi lam du rigs mi mthun pa'i lus su 'pho ba ni bden pas khyab par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught that the transformation into a body of a different type in a dream, which is stabilized by latent potentialities and cut off, is necessarily true.

original: des na gang 'pho ba'i sems bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa de ni bden pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gang 'pho ba'i sems bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa de ni bden pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind that transfers, together with its stable predispositions, is true.

original: dper na byis pa nas gzhon nu'i lus 'pho ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byis pa nas gzhon nu'i lus 'pho ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the transfer of the body from childhood to youth.

original: 'jig rten gzhan nas 'jig rten 'di'i lus 'pho ba'i sems 'di yang bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan nas 'jig rten 'di'i lus 'pho ba'i sems 'di yang bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: And this mind that transfers from another world to this world's body is also together with stable predispositions. This is the nature.

original: 'dir 'pho ba nyid yod kyang snga ma dran pa'i phyir gzhon nu'i lus 'pho ba nyid bden pa yin no zhes sun 'byin ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'pho ba nyid yod kyang snga ma dran pa'i phyir gzhon nu'i lus 'pho ba nyid bden pa yin no zhes sun 'byin ba'o //
translated: Here, although there is just the transfer, the transfer of the body from youth is true because of remembering the former. This is the refutation.

original: dogs pa bsu nas de ltar yin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas de ltar yin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating a doubt, he says, If it were so...

original: 'pho ba zhes bya ba 'pho ba tsam bden pas khyab par rab tu grub bas na'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba zhes bya ba 'pho ba tsam bden pas khyab par rab tu grub bas na'o //
translated: Because it is well established that what is called transfer is just transfer, and it is true.

original: khyad par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Because of conceiving a distinction means because of having memory.

original: rnam rtogs dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin chos mthun pa yin yang khyad par brjod pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtogs dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin chos mthun pa yin yang khyad par brjod pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “similar to conceptualization” is similar to the previous example.

original: yang na sbyor pa ni bshad ma thag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na sbyor pa ni bshad ma thag pa nyid yin la /
translated: Or, the application is just what was explained,

original: dpe ni dper na bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa'i rmi lam gyi lus su 'pho pa bzhin no zhes gzhan du bya'o //
analyzed: dpe ni dper na bag chags brtan pa dang bcas pa'i rmi lam gyi lus su 'pho pa bzhin no zhes gzhan du bya'o //
translated: and the example is like the transference of the body in a dream that is accompanied by stable latent propensities.🔽If it is asked, “Why is it not like that?”

original: gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su byung ba'i phyir na /
translated: it is because it arises in the context of a dream.

original: de 'dra ba'i rmi lam gyi lus 'pho ba bden bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rmi lam gyi lus 'pho ba bden bar 'gyur mod /
translated: It is true that such a transference of the body in a dream occurs,

original: skye ba dang por ni ma yin te /🔽bzlog pa'i phyir zhes sun 'byin pa'i dogs ba bsu nas /
analyzed: skye ba dang por ni ma yin te / bzlog pa'i phyir zhes sun 'byin pa'i dogs ba bsu nas /
translated: but it does not occur in the first birth.🔽In response to the objection, “If that is so, then the dream body is not real,”

original: de lta yin na rmi lam gyi don thams cad mi bden ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na rmi lam gyi don thams cad mi bden ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “In that case, not all objects in a dream are unreal.”

original: khyad par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “because of the thorough investigation of the distinction”

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su rtog ba'i phyir @79b ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i khyad par yongs su rtog ba'i phyir @79b ro //
translated: means that because the distinction of a dream and so on is thoroughly investigated,

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin bshad pa bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin bshad pa bya'o //
translated: The rest is to be explained as before.

original: 'pho ba grub pa la 'thad pa gzhan pa brjod na /
analyzed: 'pho ba grub pa la 'thad pa gzhan pa brjod na /
translated: If one states another reason for the establishment of the transference,

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, “alternatively.”

original: goms las khyad par gang 'gyur te //
analyzed: goms las khyad par gang 'gyur te //
translated: What is the difference from practice?

original: skye ba dang por de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: skye ba dang por de bzhin gnas //
translated: It is just as it was at the beginning.

original: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pas rtogs zin mod kyi de nyid 'grel pa'i tshul du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bshad pas rtogs zin mod kyi de nyid 'grel pa'i tshul du gyur pa yin no //
translated: This is understood from the explanation, but it is also a way of commenting on it.

original: khyad par yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par yang brjod pa ni /
translated: The difference is stated:

original: 'on te 'pho ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'pho ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Or, if it is transference.”

original: ci ltar skyon med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar skyon med ce na /
translated: How is there no fault?

original: rjes dpag g-yul ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes dpag g-yul ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “The battle of inference.”

original: mngon sum gyis yul gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis yul gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: That which is the domain of direct perception is not the domain of inference,

original: phan tshun yul spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: phan tshun yul spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they are mutually exclusive.

original: /'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: /'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated:

original: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Direct perception and inference.”

original: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa de nyid do //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa de nyid do //
translated: They are mutually exclusive.

original: lus sam gzhan go sa la sogs pa'i la yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus sam gzhan go sa la sogs pa'i la yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is the body or another, such as a position,

original: kun du 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa ni /
translated: grasping is

original: goms pa nyid dmigs so //
analyzed: goms pa nyid dmigs so //
translated: The prior habituation is observed.

original: des na sngon goms pa bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas phyogs la yong pa ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir skye ba dang po kun du 'dzin pa mthong ba de nyid las /
analyzed: des na sngon goms pa bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas phyogs la yong pa ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir skye ba dang po kun du 'dzin pa mthong ba de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the establishment of prior habituation, the first birth is not accepted, because there is no purpose in seeing the prior birth.

original: skye ba dang por 'pho ba ci ste rjes su mi dpog //
analyzed: skye ba dang por 'pho ba ci ste rjes su mi dpog //
translated: Why is the first birth not inferred?

original: brjod zin pa'i rtsod ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i rtsod ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The previously stated objection is clarified.

original: ci skad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci skad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is said?

original: skyon de yang med de bya ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de la lan 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon de yang med de bya ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de la lan 'di yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That fault also does not exist, because the clarification of the very activity is this response.

original: tshig le 'ur byas pa 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: tshig le 'ur byas pa 'grel ba ni /
translated: The commentary on the verse is

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” means:🔽

original: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the grasping, etc.

original: des na kun du 'dzin pa 'di'i sngon goms par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i sngon gyi sems las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na kun du 'dzin pa 'di'i sngon goms par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid 'di'i sngon gyi sems las byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever prior habituation there is of this grasping is just the prior mental factor of this.

original: 'pho ba'i don 'di kho na yin te dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i don 'di kho na yin te dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: This is the meaning of transference, just like the middle state.

original: des na 'pho ba'i sems mngon sum du byas pa nyid ni mkho ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'pho ba'i sems mngon sum du byas pa nyid ni mkho ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the direct realization of the mind of transmigration is not necessary.

original: kun du 'dzin pa'i goms pa sngon du song ba can ni bdag nyid las mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa'i goms pa sngon du song ba can ni bdag nyid las mthong ba nyid do //
translated: The one who has previously practiced the grasping of the self sees the self.

original: de ltar 'pho ba spyir rjes su dpog ba bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba spyir rjes su dpog ba bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established the inference of transmigration in general,

original: khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan 'pho ba'i dpe bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan 'pho ba'i dpe bshad pa ni /
translated: in order to establish it in particular, he explains the example of the transmigration of another world.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ci ltar med pa'i khyad par las 'di ni 'dra ba zhig nas 'ongs so zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i rgyu'i nye bar mkho ba la dga' bas na /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // ci ltar med pa'i khyad par las 'di ni 'dra ba zhig nas 'ongs so zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i rgyu'i nye bar mkho ba la dga' bas na /
translated: For example, etc.

original: spyod pa'i khyad par @80a * //
analyzed: spyod pa'i khyad par @80a * //
translated: Just as one infers from the particular of non-existence that this one has come from such and such a place, in the same way, from the particular of the practice of the cause of pleasure and purity,

original: las 'di ni 'di 'dra ba zhig gi 'jig rten nas skyes so zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: las 'di ni 'di 'dra ba zhig gi 'jig rten nas skyes so zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: one infers from the particular of the practice that this one has been born in such and such a world.

original: gal te lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba nas gzhan du 'ongs pa ma mthong yang khyad par 'di ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba nas gzhan du 'ongs pa ma mthong yang khyad par 'di ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one does not see the coming from another world of gods, etc., how is this particular?

original: grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa la zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word other refers to a person who has come from another village.

original: 'dis dpe dran par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis dpe dran par byed pa'o //
translated: This is a reminder of the example.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni rgyu'i khyad par med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni rgyu'i khyad par med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: Since the difference in the effect cannot occur without a difference in the cause,

original: shugs nyid la khyad par 'grub bo //🔽de nyid ston ba ni /
analyzed: shugs nyid la khyad par 'grub bo // de nyid ston ba ni /
translated: the difference is established by implication.

analyzed: nyes pas zhes bya ba ni rlung mkhris pa la sogs pas so //
