original: mnyam gyur tshe zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba'i tshogs pas mnyam por byas pa ni stong cha snyoms par gyur pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam gyur tshe zhes bya ba ni 'ching ba'i tshogs pas mnyam por byas pa ni stong cha snyoms par gyur pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “When they become equal” means when the collection of bonds becomes equal, that is, when the empty and full parts become equal.

original: nyes pa rnams mnyam pa nad med pa yin no zhes gang las rtogs she na /🔽de dag mnyam pa nad med pa //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams mnyam pa nad med pa yin no zhes gang las rtogs she na / de dag mnyam pa nad med pa //
translated: From what is it understood that the equality of faults is health?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: “The equality of those is health.”

original: bzlog pa ni med pa ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sman dbyangs kyi bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni med pa ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sman dbyangs kyi bstan bcos las so //
translated: The opposite is not non-existence, because it is expressed. This is from the treatise of Bhela.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan du rims la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan du rims la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Or” refers to the opponent’s response, “fever, etc.”

original: thams cad kyi tshe ni 'chi ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe ni 'chi ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Death is not always due to that,

original: des ni rims la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa kho na 'chi ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: des ni rims la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa kho na 'chi ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: because fever, etc. are the cause of death only when they are unchanging.

original: rims la sogs pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa med kyang log pas na sems skyes pas nal la gegs yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rims la sogs pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa med kyang log pas na sems skyes pas nal la gegs yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even when there is no incompatibility due to the characteristic of change of fever, etc., it is not the case that there is no obstruction to life due to the arising of the mind that turns away from them.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni lus mi mthun pa med kyang sems mi 'byung na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni lus mi mthun pa med kyang sems mi 'byung na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if the mind did not arise even when there is no physical obstruction,

original: sems rgyu yin pa la nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: sems rgyu yin pa la nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: if you think that this fault does not arise when the mind is the cause,

original: sems kyi rgyu ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The cause of the mind is not the body.”

original: lus rgyu yin na ni nyes pa de nyid do zhes brjod pa ni lus rgyu yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus rgyu yin na ni nyes pa de nyid do zhes brjod pa ni lus rgyu yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the body were the cause, that very fault would be stated, i.e., “If the body were the cause,

original: mi mthun pa de ni tshabs che ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa de ni tshabs che ste /
translated: that obstruction would be very strong.

original: des na sems phyir skye ba ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des na sems phyir skye ba ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
translated: Therefore, the mind would not arise again.”

original: de 'dra'i lus nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dra'i lus nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you suspect that, he says, “That very body is not seen.”

original: ma mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni gal te yongs su grub pa'i khyad par de ltar mi rung na rtogs pa de ci ltar zhes bya ba der bsal zin to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni gal te yongs su grub pa'i khyad par de ltar mi rung na rtogs pa de ci ltar zhes bya ba der bsal zin to //
translated: The distinction of non-seeing is understood. If that distinction of the perfected is not so, how is that understanding? That has been explained there.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni lus rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni lus rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second verse is explained as follows: If the body were the cause,

original: don gyis 'bangs pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: don gyis 'bangs pa brjod pa ni /
translated: the meaning is expressed by implication.

original: mi mthun pa de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The obstruction would be just like that.

original: tshig le 'ur byas pa dang por 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le 'ur byas pa dang por 'chad pa ni /
translated: The first verse of the chapter is stated to explain the first of these.🔽If the mind is the cause,

original: sems rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there is no

original: mi mthun pa @82a * //🔽med gson pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa @82a * // med gson pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: non-concordant🔽activity.

original: 'ga' zhig nyes pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nyes pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, “It is said that some are at fault,”

original: 'bras bu 'chi ba dang gson pa rang gi rgyu la nges pa'i rnam par gnas pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'chi ba dang gson pa rang gi rgyu la nges pa'i rnam par gnas pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: refers to the fact that the effect, whether it is death or life, would not be determined in relation to its cause.🔽If you think that the effect would be indeterminate, then the statement, “The effect . . . ,”

original: rnam par mi gnas kyang 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na 'bras bu ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi gnas kyang 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na 'bras bu ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: is made.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnam par phye ba med pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni / rnam par phye ba med pas so //
translated: The statement, “Therefore . . . ,”

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni //
translated: refers to the fact that there is no distinction.

original: lus kyi 'bras bu yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'bras bu yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, “If the body were the effect . . . ,”

original: rnam par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: clarifies this.🔽The statement, “Death . . . ,”

original: 'chi ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: refers to transformation.

original: bzlog tu yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog tu yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those that have determinate and indeterminate transformation are called that.

original: gsod pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni lan yang yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa'i sbyor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni lan yang yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of non-existence of the preparation for killing.

original: 'gyur ba pa dang po ni chung yang zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba pa dang po ni chung yang zhes 'brel to //
translated: The first transformation is small, as the text continues.

original: ldog pa min pa ni phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa min pa ni phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Non-return means not returning again.

original: slar ldog rung ba ni mi mthun pa thob nas phyir log pa'o //
analyzed: slar ldog rung ba ni mi mthun pa thob nas phyir log pa'o //
translated: Return means returning again after obtaining a dissimilar state.

original: byas gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis sam gang las byas pa de /
analyzed: byas gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis sam gang las byas pa de /
translated: What is done is that by which or that from which it is done.

original: de la zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: That is what is seen.

original: der nges bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der nges bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba yod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to ascertain that, it means that if there is transformation.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin de ni slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur te gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin de ni slar yang 'byung bar 'gyur te gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: The previous nature arises again, like the hardness of gold.

original: gal te de lta na yang slar 'tsho bar ci ltar thal te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang slar 'tsho bar ci ltar thal te /
translated: Even if it is so, how can it be concluded that it returns again?

original: de srid par ni 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de srid par ni 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it will be like that,

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis slar 'tsho bar bsgrub pa'i phyir de la 'grub par rnam par 'gyur bar de bzlog pa nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis slar 'tsho bar bsgrub pa'i phyir de la 'grub par rnam par 'gyur bar de bzlog pa nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar gnyis kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to prove that the other’s system is revived, it is shown that the refutation of that is itself established by two verses.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa sems kyi rgyu lus yin par bsgrub pa'i don du sems ba skyes pa'i lus mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid nye bar brtags pa ma yin par sems pa grub pa yin zhing /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa sems kyi rgyu lus yin par bsgrub pa'i don du sems ba skyes pa'i lus mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid nye bar brtags pa ma yin par sems pa grub pa yin zhing /
translated: In order to prove that the cause of the mind is the body, the establishment of the mind that has arisen is not imagined to be established by the direct perception of the body.

original: sems pa ma grub pa'i lus grub pa yang sems pa med pa grub pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sems pa ma grub pa'i lus grub pa yang sems pa med pa grub pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: The establishment of the body without the establishment of the mind is the establishment of the body without the mind.

original: des na gal te gnyid ma thug po'i gnas skabs na de chad pa rang gis ma rtogs su chud pa de ltar na yang sems pa ma skyes pa'i lus kyis ni gzhan dag mngon sum gyis nges par byed pa'am /
analyzed: des na gal te gnyid ma thug po'i gnas skabs na de chad pa rang gis ma rtogs su chud pa de ltar na yang sems pa ma skyes pa'i lus kyis ni gzhan dag mngon sum gyis nges par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if in the state of deep sleep one does not realize the cessation of the mind, then the body without the arising of the mind is ascertained by others through direct perception,

original: sad pa las rang nyid nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sad pa las rang nyid nges pa yin no //
translated: or one ascertains it oneself through waking.

original: des na sems pa dang dral ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: des na sems pa dang dral ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the transformation of the body without the mind🔽is not established.

original: gnyid la sogs pa med par sdig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyid la sogs pa med par sdig pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement “it is sinful to be without sleep, etc.” is made in reference to the systems of other schools.

original: de'i gnas skabs na ni @82b bdag nyid la sems pa med par grub pa ni tshad ma ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na ni @82b bdag nyid la sems pa med par grub pa ni tshad ma ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But at that time, there is no valid cognition whatsoever that establishes the absence of mind.

original: yod na sems pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod na sems pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were, then mind would not be a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma ni sems pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni sems pa'i khyad par nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a valid cognition is a special kind of mind.

original: sems chad pa bdag nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems chad pa bdag nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A mind that is severed is not a proving cognition,

original: dngos po med pa ni 'ga'i yang rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'ga'i yang rtogs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because it is not the case that a nonentity is the apprehender of anything.

original: sad pa'i gnas su yang bdag la sngar shes pa ma byung ngo zhes rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas su yang bdag la sngar shes pa ma byung ngo zhes rtogs pa yin te /
translated: In the state of being awake, one thinks, “I did not have a previous cognition.”

original: rtogs pa med pa yin nam ci /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa yin nam ci /
translated: Is it that there was no cognition?

original: 'o na te yid kyang rjed par gyur ces rang nyid kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na te yid kyang rjed par gyur ces rang nyid kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But you yourself have said, “The mind also is forgotten.”

original: tshad ma las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i tha snyad las de grub na ni 'jig rten pha rol yang 'grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma las phyi rol tu gyur pa'i tha snyad las de grub na ni 'jig rten pha rol yang 'grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established by a convention that is external to valid cognition, then the existence of a world beyond would be established.

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang de'i tshad ma rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang de'i tshad ma rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it established by its own nature,

original: gzhan gyis rgyud ni snang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rgyud ni snang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum of another is not perceptible.

original: shes pa'i 'bras bu dbyung ba la sogs pa med pa las kyang de 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras bu dbyung ba la sogs pa med pa las kyang de 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it established by the absence of the effect of consciousness, such as the production of an effect,

original: rgyu rnams ni gnod mi za bar 'bras bu ldan bsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gnod mi za bar 'bras bu ldan bsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that causes possess an effect.

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su yang rang ngam gzhan gyi sems rnam par chad pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su yang rang ngam gzhan gyi sems rnam par chad pas mi rtogs so //
translated: In the same way, at the time of death, it is not perceived by one’s own mind or by the mind of another, because the mind is interrupted.

original: 'o na ci ltar gnyid log pa ltar shi ba bcom pa las srog gcod pa la sogs par mi bzhag ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gnyid log pa ltar shi ba bcom pa las srog gcod pa la sogs par mi bzhag ce na ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked, “Well then, how is it that one is not considered to have committed the transgression of killing by killing someone who is asleep or dead?”

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni lung ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang lung yang de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni lung ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang lung yang de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: The answer is that it is not so, because worldly convention is just as it is stated in the scriptures, and the scriptures are just as they are.

original: nad la sogs pas bcom pas g-yo ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la shi'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nad la sogs pas bcom pas g-yo ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la shi'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: When one is overcome by illness and so on, one is said to die because one is deprived of movement and so on.

original: des na 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i lugs la ltos nas brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i lugs la ltos nas brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as a statement made in terms of the system of the Lokayatas.

original: des na gnyid la sogs pa byas pa sems pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ldog pa ltar 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba yang ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir slar 'tsho bar thal lo //
analyzed: des na gnyid la sogs pa byas pa sems pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ldog pa ltar 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba yang ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir slar 'tsho bar thal lo //
translated: Thus, just as the transformation characterized by sleep and so on is reversible, since it is characterized by consciousness, so too the transformation characterized by death would be reversible, and it would follow that one would live again.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'dis bred pas ci zhig ltar rnam par mchad par khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'dis bred pas ci zhig ltar rnam par mchad par khas len na /
translated: But if one accepts the cessation of consciousness in some way out of fear of this fault,

original: de'i tshe yang brjod pa'i thal ba mi ldog go zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang brjod pa'i thal ba mi ldog go zhes ston pa ni /
translated: then the absurd consequence stated previously is not averted, as is demonstrated in the following:

original: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ste gnyid kyi gnas der ro //
analyzed: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ste gnyid kyi gnas der ro //
translated: Or, if one says that consciousness does not cease in sleep,

original: ldog pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni shes pa zhes bya bar blta ste /
analyzed: ldog pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni shes pa zhes bya bar blta ste /
translated: then it is not the case that it is not reversible, that is, it is conscious.

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir 'grel par rig pa med kyang nus pa'i rang bzhin @83a * //
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir 'grel par rig pa med kyang nus pa'i rang bzhin @83a * //
translated: because it exists in the nature of potentiality.

original: du yin na zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du yin na zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the commentary, it says, “Even though there is no awareness, it is in the nature of potentiality.🔽”

original: des na gnyid log pa la ni sad pa'i gnas skabs yod par 'gyur gyi shi ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na gnyid log pa la ni sad pa'i gnas skabs yod par 'gyur gyi shi ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the implicit meaning is that one who is asleep has a state of being awake, but one who is dead does not.

original: de ltar gzhan gyis brjod pa de nyid kyi lugs la brten nas sel ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis brjod pa de nyid kyi lugs la brten nas sel ba ni /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the system of the opponent, the refutation is

original: de la smras pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de la smras pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: stated in the line, “To that we reply.🔽”

original: / ci ltar zhe na /🔽rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin ci //
analyzed: / ci ltar zhe na / rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin ci //
translated: How is that?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is stated in the line, “How can that which is not of the nature of awareness.🔽”

original: rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni rig par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni rig par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not of the nature of awareness is not asserted to be awareness.

original: des na nus pa'i rang bzhin yang rig pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir na rig pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la khyod rig par 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na nus pa'i rang bzhin yang rig pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir na rig pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la khyod rig par 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since potentiality is also different from awareness, you should not assert that that which is not of the nature of awareness is awareness.

original: des na sems pa'i nus pa ni lus nyid yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na sems pa'i nus pa ni lus nyid yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the capacity of intention is the body itself, because there is no other.

original: des na sems pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na sems pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention of the opponent that the body is without intention.

original: de lta yin na ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of accepting that?

original: de lta'ang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta'ang zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is “Even so . . .”

original: rig pa med pa de ltar na yang ngo //
analyzed: rig pa med pa de ltar na yang ngo //
translated: Even though there is no awareness,

original: gal te gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na de yod na'o ;
analyzed: gal te gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na de yod na'o ;
translated: if it exists in the state of deep sleep,

original: / de'i tshe shi ba la yang yod par 'gyur bas slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i tshe shi ba la yang yod par 'gyur bas slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would exist in death as well, and so the dead would come back to life.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: shing dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shing dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “from the tree . . .”

original: 'on te dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa'i khyad par yod do snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is a difference in the way the breath is inhaled,

original: dbugs rngub ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dbugs rngub ces gsungs so //
translated: the text says, “inhaling . . .”

original: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang sngar de mdun du'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyang sngar de mdun du'o //
translated: All of the inhalations and so on are already refuted by the earlier statement, “In the presence of that . . .”

original: sems pa'i nus pas byas pa'i khyad par ni /🔽rnam shes nus pa dang 'brel phyir //
analyzed: sems pa'i nus pas byas pa'i khyad par ni / rnam shes nus pa dang 'brel phyir //
translated: The difference that is made by the capacity of intention

original: zhes bya ba de 'chad pa'i skabs su sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de 'chad pa'i skabs su sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will be refuted in the section that explains the line “because consciousness is related to the capacity.”

original: bshad pa ni ci rigs su bsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni ci rigs su bsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The explanation is only the removal of what is appropriate.

original: des na te khyad par med pa na'o //
analyzed: des na te khyad par med pa na'o //
translated: Therefore, when there is no distinction,

original: de ni rig pa med na'o //
analyzed: de ni rig pa med na'o //
translated: that is when there is no awareness.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rig pa'o //
translated: That refers to awareness.

original: 'o na de lus nyid yin pas zhes bya bas na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de lus nyid yin pas zhes bya bas na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the body itself, there is no other, he thinks.

original: sems pa der mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems pa der mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: That is the non-return of thought.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, he says, is from another's point of view.

original: lan ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de zhes bya ba'i rig pa dang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de zhes bya ba'i rig pa dang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is, That which is not a producer, he says. Awareness is the doubt.

original: gnyid log pa la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gnyid log pa la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: In sleep is the answer.

original: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa la'o //
analyzed: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa la'o //
translated: If, he says, in that, is in sleep.

original: de yongs su gyur pa ni rig pa med pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa ni rig pa med pa yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Its transformation is the transformation of non-awareness.

original: de ltar lus lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pa sel pa brjod nas nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dgag par yang ston pa ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa thams cad sngar zhes @83b bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa
analyzed: de ltar lus lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pa sel pa brjod nas nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid dgag par yang ston pa ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa thams cad sngar zhes @83b bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa ni dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa
translated: “All exhalation and so on are prior” is explained as follows:

original: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Exhalation and so on are not the substantial cause of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de gang yin yang gnyid log pa ltar shi ba la yang rtog pa yod pa'i phyir slar 'tsho bar thal lo zhes bya ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gang yin yang gnyid log pa ltar shi ba la yang rtog pa yod pa'i phyir slar 'tsho bar thal lo zhes bya ba'i gnas so //
translated: Therefore, just as when one falls asleep, since conceptualization exists even in death, it follows that one would revive. This is the point.

original: de ltar lus rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa de brjod nas lus de ni rgyu nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //🔽'dir 'das nas yun ring du lon pa'i shes pa'i 'du byed nyid smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar lus rgyu nyid du khas blangs nas sun 'byin pa de brjod nas lus de ni rgyu nyid du 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o // 'dir 'das nas yun ring du lon pa'i shes pa'i 'du byed nyid smra ba yin te /
translated: Having thus stated the refutation by accepting the body as the cause, he says that it is also not tenable for the body to be the cause:🔽Moreover, it is not tenable for the body to be the substantial cause of consciousness.

original: tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established by valid cognition.

original: gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su byung ba 'das ma thag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su byung ba 'das ma thag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the immediately past state that occurs in the state of sleep,

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt.

original: the tshom za ba ni rgyu'am rgyu ma yin par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba ni rgyu'am rgyu ma yin par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: Doubt cannot be established as a cause or non-cause,

original: du ba la sha za ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba la sha za ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: like smoke in regard to a fire-possessor, i.e., a kitchen.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems pa chad par grub pa 'bar ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems pa chad par grub pa 'bar ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the burning of the established volition is not accompanied by a result,

original: de med kyang 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it does not exist, it is easy to establish that the past is a cause, even though a long time has elapsed.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i 'dod pa la ltos nas ni shin tu yang lus kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i 'dod pa la ltos nas ni shin tu yang lus kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: With reference to the assertion of the Lokayatas, it is thought that the mental continuum is not seen to follow the bodily formation, even though it is very close.

original: lus mtshungs par yod pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lus mtshungs par yod pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa gnyis so //
translated: Even though the body is similar, i.e., even though the two are asleep,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni des sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug kyang lus rgyu yin pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni des sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug kyang lus rgyu yin pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, the meaning of “or” is that it is not contradictory that the body is the cause even though it follows the prior formative forces.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni la sogs pa bzhin du med pa dang cig shos dag lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni la sogs pa bzhin du med pa dang cig shos dag lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The intended meaning of the conclusion is that the non-existent and the other are not co-existent, just like “la” etc.

original: gnyid mthug pa la sogs pa sems dang bral ba'i skyes bu la sad pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni sad pa las mngon du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gnyid mthug pa la sogs pa sems dang bral ba'i skyes bu la sad pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni sad pa las mngon du phyogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The person who is devoid of mind in a state of deep sleep etc. is like the body in the waking state, i.e. in the state that is manifest from the waking state.

original: lus bzhin du sngon gyi sems kyang ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus bzhin du sngon gyi sems kyang ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The prior mind does not exist, just like the body.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te dus gzhan na yod par lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te dus gzhan na yod par lhan cig byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But how can it be so? The meaning is: if it does not exist at another time, it is not a co-operating cause.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of the conclusion is as follows:

original: rgya skyegs kyi khu bas 'dus byas pa'i ras bal gyi sa bon dang me tog dag la gcig med na /
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi khu bas 'dus byas pa'i ras bal gyi sa bon dang me tog dag la gcig med na /
translated: The cotton seed and the flower which are impregnated with lac are not co-existent, since one does not exist at another time.

original: ras bal gyi dmar po bzhin du med par bskyed bya rnam pa thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ras bal gyi dmar po bzhin du med par bskyed bya rnam pa thams cad du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: It is not like the redness of cotton, which is produced without changing its nature.

original: 'di'i lhan cig byed ba'i sa bon bskyed do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di'i lhan cig byed ba'i sa bon bskyed do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: At that time, the seed of its co-originator would be produced.

original: de ltar na 'dir ma yin te /🔽rtog pa med kyang sad pa tsam yod @84a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir ma yin te / rtog pa med kyang sad pa tsam yod @84a * //
translated: But it is not like that here.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is mere awakening, even without conceptualization.

original: khyad par can la lhan cig byed pa yin pa ni lus la yang bzlog tu med do //
analyzed: khyad par can la lhan cig byed pa yin pa ni lus la yang bzlog tu med do //
translated: The co-originator of the special is also undeniable in the body.

original: de tsam gyis ni skabs dang 'gal ba ma ngam yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni skabs dang 'gal ba ma ngam yin no //
translated: But that alone does not contradict the context.

original: yang med pa lhan cig byed pa mi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir gal te sad ma thag tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang med pa lhan cig byed pa mi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir gal te sad ma thag tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: Again, to eliminate the denial of the non-existent co-originator, it is said: If immediately upon awakening...

original: sad ma thag ni mthong ma thag go //
analyzed: sad ma thag ni mthong ma thag go //
translated: Immediately upon awakening means immediately upon seeing.

original: mthong ba dang sngon gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang cig shos dag go //
analyzed: mthong ba dang sngon gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa dang cig shos dag go //
translated: Seeing and the existence of previous consciousness are the other two.

original: lan ni de yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i nye bar gnas pa la sad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni de yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i nye bar gnas pa la sad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “awakened” is not ascertained.

original: mthong ba'i lus yin pas na nye ba nyid kyis don gang zhig mthong ba de nyid la sngon mthong bar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lus yin pas na nye ba nyid kyis don gang zhig mthong ba de nyid la sngon mthong bar rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the proximity of the body that is seen, whatever object is seen is understood to have the characteristic of being seen before.

original: de dang mthun pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis 'di ltar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag gis 'di ltar bya'o zhes so //
translated: “In accordance with that” means “I will do this.”

original: bag chags sad pa ni bag chags sad pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa ni bag chags sad pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The awakening of latent impressions is the arising of conceptual thoughts from the awakening of latent impressions.

original: sad pa na zhes bya ba ni gnyid sad pa na'o //
analyzed: sad pa na zhes bya ba ni gnyid sad pa na'o //
translated: “When awakened” means when one awakens from sleep.

original: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: “Conceptual thought” has the nature of conceptualization.

original: gal te mthong ba la mi ltos par rnam par rtog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba la mi ltos par rnam par rtog par 'gyur na /
translated: If conceptual thought arises without depending on seeing,

original: ci ste thams cad la thams cad mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad la thams cad mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: why doesn’t everything arise for everyone?

original: bdag gis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes gsungs te /
translated: “By me” is stated.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs dag tu'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs dag tu'o //
translated: “How?” means in certain circumstances.

original: der 'gyur gyis thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der 'gyur gyis thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all of them are.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rtogs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Only those that are of that nature are understood, not the others.

original: gal te ci rnam par rtog ba kho na sad pa yin gyi ci gzhan ma yin nam snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te ci rnam par rtog ba kho na sad pa yin gyi ci gzhan ma yin nam snyam pa la /
translated: If one thinks: Is it only imagination that is awakened, or is it something else?

original: sad pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sad pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: “Awakening is...”.

original: gnyi ga yang sad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sad pa yin te /
translated: Both are awakened.

original: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de la gnyid kyis bza' btung zhu bar gang gi tshe dbang po skyon med dang bcas pa'i lus kyis skad cig byed ba can 'das nas ring du lon pa'i shes pa snga mas phyi'am nang gi don ci ltar nye bar gnas pa la bde ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de la gnyid kyis bza' btung zhu bar gang gi tshe dbang po skyon med dang bcas pa'i lus kyis skad cig byed ba can 'das nas ring du lon pa'i shes pa snga mas phyi'am nang gi don ci ltar nye bar gnas pa la bde ba dang /
translated: The meaning is that there is no certainty as to a single mode.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang por skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sad pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang por skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sad pa yin no //
translated: Therein, when one who is hungry and thirsty, with a body whose faculties are unimpaired, having passed a moment of activity, a long time after the prior cognition has elapsed, experiences the pleasure or pain that was first generated by an external or internal object that is present, at that time it is awakened without imagination.

original: gang gis gnyid log pa brdebs  pa tshar nas mi bzad bas 'jigs pa la sogs pa goms pa las /
analyzed: gang gis gnyid log pa brdebs  pa tshar nas mi bzad bas 'jigs pa la sogs pa goms pa las /
translated: It is like the case of someone who has been beaten while asleep and then, on waking, is terrified by the memory of it.

original: lus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par lhan cig byed pa can gyi shes ba snga mas 'di bya'i snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa de'i tshe ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid sad pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par lhan cig byed pa can gyi shes ba snga mas 'di bya'i snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa de'i tshe ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid sad pa yin la /
translated: When one who is asleep is awakened by a blow, for example, a consciousness that has as its special condition the state of the body generates the conception, “I am being struck by an unbearable blow.” At that time, the conceptual consciousness is awakened.

original: de'i 'og tu ni rnam par rtog pa dang @84b bcas pa'am rtog pa med par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni rnam par rtog pa dang @84b bcas pa'am rtog pa med par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: After that, it may or may not be accompanied by conception.

original: gang gi tshe tshogs pa yin pas gnyi ga gcig par skye ba de'i tshe na gnyi ga yang sad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshogs pa yin pas gnyi ga gcig par skye ba de'i tshe na gnyi ga yang sad pa yin no //
translated: When it is a combination of the two, both are produced together. At that time, both are awakened.

original: sad pa goms par byas pa nyid ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sad pa goms par byas pa nyid ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The verse “When one is accustomed to being awakened” teaches the cultivation of awakening.

original: brtan sogs zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod par bya ba'i bud med gzung ngo //
analyzed: brtan sogs zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod par bya ba'i bud med gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “steadiness, etc.” includes the desired woman.

original: 'du byed ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni goms pa'o //
translated: “Formation” means cultivation.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rig ba dang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rig ba dang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
translated: The nature of the cognition of pleasure, etc. arises.

original: de la 'das nas yun ring du yin pa'i 'jigs pa goms pa las 'brel pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'das nas yun ring du yin pa'i 'jigs pa goms pa las 'brel pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the cognition of pleasure, etc. arises from the repeated practice of fear, etc.

original: ma bros na ni sdug bsngal du rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bros na ni sdug bsngal du rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not flee, one recognizes suffering.

original: kho na pa goms par byas pa la ni mtshon 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin dad bde ba rig pa nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho na pa goms par byas pa la ni mtshon 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin dad bde ba rig pa nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the repeated practice of anger, etc. the nature of the cognition of pleasure, etc. arises.

original: 'chad pa ni 'jigs pa goms pa'i khyim du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni 'jigs pa goms pa'i khyim du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is: “in the house of the repeated practice of fear, etc.”

original: 'bros pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'bros pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa'o //
translated: The nature of the cognition of pleasure, etc. arises from the repeated practice of fear, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par rtog pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam par rtog pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the conceptual differentiation.

original: de dag nyid kyis rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i sad pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i sad pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That sleep which has that nature is called “sleep” in that it has that nature.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bros mi nus na'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bros mi nus na'o //
translated: “Otherwise” means if one is unable to flee.

original: gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu yang de yin la mtshon la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa yang de yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i rgyu yang de yin la mtshon la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa yang de yin pa ste /
translated: It is also the cause of harming others, and it is also the grasping of weapons, etc.

original: rang bzhin de nyid rtogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid rtogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: One who has the realization of that very nature is called that.

original: des na 'bru mang po kho na yod pa las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'bru mang po kho na yod pa las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the collection of grasping is from the mere existence of many grains.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam las 'das pa dang cig shos dag lhan cig byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir rnam par rig pa tsam las 'das pa dang cig shos dag lhan cig byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that what is beyond mere awareness and its other conditions are co-producing conditions, therefore, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa spyi'i lhan cig byed ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa spyi'i lhan cig byed ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It is not the co-producing condition of consciousness in general.

original: 'dis ni 'du byed pa dang lhan cig yang nas skye ba'i zhes gang brjod pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du byed pa dang lhan cig yang nas skye ba'i zhes gang brjod pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This refutes what was said, namely, that it arises together with formations again and again.

original: 'o na rnam par shes ba'i rgyu ci yin snyam na rnam par shes ba snga ma nyid rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes ba'i rgyu ci yin snyam na rnam par shes ba snga ma nyid rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: If one thinks, “Well then, what is the cause of consciousness?,” it is said that previous consciousness itself is the cause.

original: nye bar sim pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar sim pa yin no //
translated: It is the satisfaction.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma de ji ltar rang gi rgyus dus nges par bskyed pa de bzhin du bar du chad ba'i dus dang / 'brel pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa des sang gi dus kyi de ma thag tu 'bras bu mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma de ji ltar rang gi rgyus dus nges par bskyed pa de bzhin du bar du chad ba'i dus dang / 'brel pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa des sang gi dus kyi de ma thag tu 'bras bu mi skyed pa dang /
translated: But just as the previous consciousness is definitely generated at a certain time by its cause, in the same way, it is not the case that it generates a result that is related to a time that is interrupted and not related to a time that is not interrupted.🔽Therefore, it is not the case that it generates a result immediately after the next day.

original: dus gzhan dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ba tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: dus gzhan dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'gyur ba tsam du zad pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: It is merely the case that it generates a result related to another time.

original: @85a * // rgya skyegs kyi khu bas 'dus byas pa'i sa bon ni 'das pa'i yin yang /
analyzed: @85a * // rgya skyegs kyi khu bas 'dus byas pa'i sa bon ni 'das pa'i yin yang /
translated: The seed that is impregnated with lac dye is past,

original: gzhan gyi tshe 'bras bu ni yod par thal ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe 'bras bu ni yod par thal ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: but it is not the case that the error of the effect existing earlier is entailed.

original: ma ldog pa la ltos nas rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ldog pa la ltos nas rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates a result of that kind in reliance on the noncessation of the seed.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang sngar gyi dus su yod pa la ltos pa kho nas sna zhom pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang sngar gyi dus su yod pa la ltos pa kho nas sna zhom pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the future also generates the result of the shrunken nose and so on in reliance on the existence of the cause in the past.

original: 'di gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin yang gcig med na 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir na don bya ba gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin yang gcig med na 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir na don bya ba gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Although these two do not occur simultaneously, since the effect does not arise in the absence of either, they are co-operating causes that have the characteristic of performing the same function.

original: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba med kyang lhan cig byed pa yin na 'du byed pa yang lus kyis lhan cig byed par 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba med kyang lhan cig byed pa yin na 'du byed pa yang lus kyis lhan cig byed par 'gyur ba des na /
translated: If, although they do not occur simultaneously, they are co-operating causes, then the body would be a co-operating cause of the formation of the body.

original: 'du byed de yi tshe med na //
analyzed: 'du byed de yi tshe med na //
translated: If the formation does not exist at that time,

original: lhan cig byed 'gyur phyir 'thad dka' //
analyzed: lhan cig byed 'gyur phyir 'thad dka' //
translated: how can it be a co-operating cause?

original: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can this be said?

original: brjod pa / gal te gcig med par 'bras bu rtogs pa tsam gyis skye na ni /
analyzed: brjod pa / gal te gcig med par 'bras bu rtogs pa tsam gyis skye na ni /
translated: If the effect arises merely through the realization of the absence of one,

original: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: then this would be the case.

original: lus de lus med na mi skye ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: lus de lus med na mi skye ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If the body does not exist, the body would not arise.

original: 'di gang gis nges par zin te /
analyzed: 'di gang gis nges par zin te /
translated: How is this ascertained?

original: rang ngam gzhan gyis nges par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gyis nges par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not ascertained by itself or by another.

original: des na gang gi phyir 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i 'grub tu re ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i 'grub tu re ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, because of that, the hope for the result of the worldly Lokāyata’s desire is pointless.

original: 'di gnyis kyi lhan cig la 'di yang tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi lhan cig la 'di yang tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these two are not realized by valid knowledge.

original: gal te lus nyid nye bar len pa yin na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te lus nyid nye bar len pa yin na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam pa'i dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: If the body itself is the appropriator, what is the problem?

original: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa nyid grags par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba yin te shes pa spyi'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa nyid grags par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba yin te shes pa spyi'o //
translated: To dispel that doubt, the previously explained reasoning is made well known: “That” refers to the general consciousness.

original: lhag ma yang brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yang brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is stated: “In the same way.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If” refers to the opponent.

original: mi mthun pa med na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa med na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “If there is no incompatibility” is the response.

original: 'on te mi mthun pa tshabs chen po sems dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi rgyu log kyang mi rtog pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te mi mthun pa tshabs chen po sems dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi rgyu log kyang mi rtog pa'i phyir na /
translated: If there is no great incompatibility, the characteristic of being separated from the mind, then because its own cause is reversed, it is not conceived.

original: sngar gyi rang bzhin yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi rang bzhin yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the previous nature does not arise.

original: sel ba log nas rang bzhin gyi gnas 'byung ba ni nam yang med do //
analyzed: sel ba log nas rang bzhin gyi gnas 'byung ba ni nam yang med do //
translated: But it is never the case that the elements return to their natural state when the exclusion is reversed.

original: des na mi mthun pa med na slar lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no ci ste brjod ces dogs na phyir mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa med na slar lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no ci ste brjod ces dogs na phyir mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you ask, “If there is no incompatibility, then why does the body not again become the cause of consciousness?,” he says, “It does not arise again in a different form.”

original: gang zhig rang gi rgyun yod na skyes pa dang / de med na ldog par @85b yang 'gyur zhing yang yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni re zhig byung ba de zhes brjod de gser gyi rnam par 'gyur ba zhu ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi rgyun yod na skyes pa dang / de med na ldog par @85b yang 'gyur zhing yang yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni re zhig byung ba de zhes brjod de gser gyi rnam par 'gyur ba zhu ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: That which arises when its cause exists and ceases when that does not exist and arises again when it exists is said to be “that which has arisen,” like the transformation of gold.

original: gang zhig de ltar mi 'gyur ba de ni yang mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar mi 'gyur ba de ni yang mi 'byung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: That which does not act in this way is said to be “that which does not arise again in a different form.”

original: dper na bud shing gi rnam pas 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bud shing gi rnam pas 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the transformation of fuel.

original: nyes pa rnams so de rtsom par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na ni chen po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi chung ngu yang bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams so de rtsom par byed pa nyid yin par khas len na ni chen po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi chung ngu yang bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that it is the cause of the arising of faults, then not only the great elements but also the subtle elements would be unstoppable.

original: des byas pas zhes bya ba ni lus de byas pa'o //
analyzed: des byas pas zhes bya ba ni lus de byas pa'o //
translated: “Because of that” refers to the body that is made.

original: rnam par shes pa zhan pa yang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid bzlog chu med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhan pa yang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid bzlog chu med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: “Consciousness” is also weak, and the characteristics of engagement are reversed, as is the case with water.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba gzhan yang bzlog tu med par thal ba nyid du ston pa ni brgyal ba la sogs pa ste gnyid stug pos log pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis rnam par ni rnam par shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de rang
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba gzhan yang bzlog tu med par thal ba nyid du ston pa ni brgyal ba la sogs pa ste gnyid stug pos log pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis rnam par ni rnam par shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de rang
translated: The other transformations are also shown to be inevitably reversed, such as fainting and so on. Those who are asleep and so on have a transformation that is characterized by the absence of consciousness.

original: bzhin de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin de nyid gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That very nature exists in that person, and that is what is meant by “that.”

original: de dag ni bzlog tu med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni bzlog tu med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Those are not inevitable.

original: des na nyes pa rnam bzlog tu rung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rtsom par byed pa khas blangs pa bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na nyes pa rnam bzlog tu rung ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rtsom par byed pa khas blangs pa bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that the transformations that are capable of reversing those faults are initiated.

original: de ltar khas blangs pa ni yang 'dod pa 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs pa ni yang 'dod pa 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that, it is said that the desired result is achieved.

original: phyir ldog par rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ldog par rung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is meant by “capable of reversing.”

original: gang zhes bya ba ni lus gang la byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni lus gang la byas pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the body.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: “That” refers to the nature of the body,

original: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the hardness of gold.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If” refers to the other.

original: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig rgyu yin no //
translated: Consciousness alone is the cause.

original: bsgrub tu med pa nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub tu med pa nyid med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that the impossibility of establishing would not exist.

original: gso bya min pa ni bzlog tu med pa ste /
analyzed: gso bya min pa ni bzlog tu med pa ste /
translated: The incurable is the irremediable.

original: skabs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i cung zad ces bya ba thams cad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i cung zad ces bya ba thams cad ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the context, “a little” means not all.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i phyogs khas len na ni nyes pa 'ba' zhig mi mthun pa'i byed pa yin par khas blangs pas na /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i phyogs khas len na ni nyes pa 'ba' zhig mi mthun pa'i byed pa yin par khas blangs pas na /
translated: If one accepts the Vaiśeṣika position, only the fault is accepted as the activity of the dissimilar.

original: mi mthun pa bsgrub tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa bsgrub tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dissimilar is not established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “The impossibility of establishing” is explained.

original: bsgrub par byar med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ste sprul dang nye ba gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: bsgrub par byar med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ste sprul dang nye ba gang yin pa dag go //
translated: The impossibility of establishing is the impossibility of establishing, which are the two: the emanation and the near.

original: de dag kyang yin la sprul dang nye bar yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang yin la sprul dang nye bar yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: They are not even close to being emanations.

original: de dag gis byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni sems ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten grags pa de sel bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni sems ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten grags pa de sel bar nus pa'o //
translated: The transformation that they produce is the characteristic of the reversal of the mind, which is known in the world.

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i @86a * //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i @86a * //
translated: Because it is difficult to obtain,

original: med pa'i nye bar mtshon par byed ba yin pa'i phyir na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa'i nye bar mtshon par byed ba yin pa'i phyir na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said to be non-existent because it is indicated as non-existent.

original: gzhan gyi lugs la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni sems pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs la yang de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni sems pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it would be the same in the other system, which is called intention.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan ba'i lugs la ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan ba'i lugs la ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the Lokayata system, there is no disagreement that is not to be established. This is the meaning.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste /
translated: Now, is of the other,

original: nged kyi phyogs la zhes 'thad do //
analyzed: nged kyi phyogs la zhes 'thad do //
translated: in our position is correct.

original: de ni med do zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni med do zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: That is non-existent is the answer.

original: don ni gal te rnam par 'gyur ba bzlog bar bya ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'chos byed rnyed par dka' ba nyid slar 'tsho ba'i rgyu min par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: don ni gal te rnam par 'gyur ba bzlog bar bya ba ma yin na de'i tshe 'chos byed rnyed par dka' ba nyid slar 'tsho ba'i rgyu min par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning is: if the transformation is not to be stopped, then the one who is to be healed would not be the cause of living again, since it would be difficult to find.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba log na yang 'chos byed nyid don med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba log na yang 'chos byed nyid don med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And if the transformation is stopped, then the one who is to be healed is pointless.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol smra ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol smra ba la'o //
translated: With regard to the other, it is said that the one who advocates the existence of other worlds.

original: gal te tshu rol mdzes pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa yod na skyon ci yod /
analyzed: gal te tshu rol mdzes pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa yod na skyon ci yod /
translated: If the one who advocates the beauty of this shore also has something that is not to be established, what is the fault?

original: de ltar ma yin na khyed la yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na khyed la yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not so, then what is the case for you? This is the meaning of the opponent's argument.

original: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa la ni sngon gyi las kyi bdag po nyid med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa la ni sngon gyi las kyi bdag po nyid med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is thought that the one who advocates the beauty of this shore does not have the ownership of past karma.

original: 'dir nad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir nad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa ni /
translated: Here, what is not to be established

original: nye bar mtshon pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: is not an illustration.

original: de bdag por gyur bas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba thams cad gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bdag por gyur bas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba thams cad gzung ngo //
translated: All the changes that are made by the one who has become the owner are perceived.

original: de ltar rang gi lugs legs par bstan nas slar 'tsho ba thal ba 'di ni gzhan kho na las yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi lugs legs par bstan nas slar 'tsho ba thal ba 'di ni gzhan kho na las yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having thus presented his own system well, he shows by way of a conclusion that this consequence of life is from another alone, saying “Therefore.”

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni lus kyis rgyu can ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni lus kyis rgyu can ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, since consciousness is not caused by the body, the cause of consciousness is only the previous moment of consciousness.

original: de bas ni lus log pas ni rnam par shes pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas ni lus log pas ni rnam par shes pa ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the cessation of consciousness is not due to the cessation of the body.

original: yang na lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can yin yang de tsam gyis ni de log pas ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can yin yang de tsam gyis ni de log pas ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the body is the cause of consciousness, the cessation of consciousness is not due to the cessation of that alone.

original: rgyu tsam log pas 'bras bu thams cad mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu tsam log pas 'bras bu thams cad mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The point of this is to show that the cessation of all effects is not due to the cessation of the cause alone.

original: 'o na lus nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i rgyu yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na lus nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i rgyu yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the body is the cause that illustrates this,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: lus kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The body also, he says.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gal te yin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te yin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it were, he says.

original: lus de rnam par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus de rnam par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The body would not transform.

original: rnam par mi 'gyur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs @86b kyis rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs @86b kyis rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It would not transform, he says, by implication.

original: gal te de lta na lus nyid rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na lus nyid rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If that were so, the body itself would be the cause of the appropriation of consciousness.

original: lus ni rgyu nyid yin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni rgyu nyid yin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The body is the cause, he says.

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why?

original: de ma gyur kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma gyur kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: If it were not, he says.

original: des na lus ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body is not the cause of appropriation.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, what about consciousness?

original: de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: If it were, it would necessarily be.

original: de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don pa de ni lus rgyu yin pa 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don yin no //
analyzed: de 'gyur na yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don pa de ni lus rgyu yin pa 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don yin no //
translated: If it were, it would not necessarily be. This is the meaning of the reason that refutes the body as the cause.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o//
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o//
translated: The opponent’s response is “If, etc.”

original: 'dis ni ha cang khyab ches pa'i nyes pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ha cang khyab ches pa'i nyes pa brjod do //
translated: This states the error of over-pervasion.

original: de la mtshan nyid gzhan bsgrubs pas re zhig de dgag pa brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gzhan bsgrubs pas re zhig de dgag pa brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to that, the reply is not that the refutation is stated first, in order to establish another characteristic.

original: rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i rgyun gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i rgyun gyi rgyu'o //
translated: “ By a continuum” means the cause of a continuum of rice.

original: gal te chu nyid rgyun gyi rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chu nyid rgyun gyi rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t water itself the cause of the continuum?

original: des na ha cang khyab ba'i nyes pa ji ltar spong snyam na /
analyzed: des na ha cang khyab ba'i nyes pa ji ltar spong snyam na /
translated: So how can the error of over-pervasion be avoided?

original: rgyun gyi rgyu yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyu yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The reply is “The cause of the continuum is also . . . ”

original: de ltar na ni 'o na rgyu ma yin pa'i chu la ci ltos snyam pa la chu'i ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na rgyu ma yin pa'i chu la ci ltos snyam pa la chu'i ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: ba men ba lang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba men ba lang gi zhes bya ba'o //

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //

analyzed: skyon yon du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa ni 'di'i bar gyis ni nyes gcig go //

original: @87b nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: @87b nye bar len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: dang po la ni lan lus dang sems kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: ba lang dang men ltar 'di gnyis ni nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa las byung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that these two are not appropriation and the result of appropriation, like the cow and the ox.

original: gnyis pa'i lan ni rkang pa lhag ma gsum yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i lan ni rkang pa lhag ma gsum yin no //

original: lus dang sems kyi mtshan nyid skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi mtshan nyid skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas pa yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus dang sems 'dris pa de gnyis kyi rgyu nur nur po la sogs pa dang / lhan cig pa'i sems de lhan cig byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang sems 'dris pa de gnyis kyi rgyu nur nur po la sogs pa dang / lhan cig pa'i sems de lhan cig byed pa'i phyir te /

original: phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the mind that accompanies it is a co-originating cause.

original: dpe brjod pa ni med dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa ni med dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: The example is “like a lump of copper and the mold for making earrings.

analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i dang nye bar len pa las byung ba nyid ma yin pa yang lhan cig gnas par 'thad do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that that which is not derived from the primary elements and that which is derived from the primary elements coexist.”

original: de ltar yang sngar gyi rtsod pa las ci ltar 'das snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar yang sngar gyi rtsod pa las ci ltar 'das snyam pa la /

original: 'dir  zhes bya ba'o //🔽skabs sdud pa ni gnas skabs rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir  zhes bya ba'o // skabs sdud pa ni gnas skabs rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here he says:🔽The summary is “The state of being a cause is.

original: dngos po ni lus so //
analyzed: dngos po ni lus so //
translated: The state of being a cause is the state of being a thing.

original: gal te de lta yin na'o na de log na zhig ldog snyam na gnas skabs byed pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na'o na de log na zhig ldog snyam na gnas skabs byed pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, then when that ceases, it ceases.

original: ni'i sgra ni gsal lo zhe bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gsal lo zhe bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word “ni” is a clarifier.

analyzed: de lta na 'o na nye bar len pa'i rgyu gang yin snyam du dgongs na /
