original: rang gi brjod pa'i nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dran par byed pas /
analyzed: rang gi brjod pa'i nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid dran par byed pas /
translated: , it is the characteristic of appropriation that is expressed by me.

original: de log pa nyid na rgyu ldog pa'o zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de log pa nyid na rgyu ldog pa'o zhes ston pa ni /
translated: When that is reversed, the cause is reversed.

original: rgyun gyi rgyu gang yin pa de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rgyu gang yin pa de zhes gsungs so //
translated: The cause of the continuum is what is said.

original: 'on te gnas skabs kyi rgyu log pas kyang rgyu ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnas skabs kyi rgyu log pas kyang rgyu ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the cause of the state is reversed, the cause is also reversed.

original: des na de yang nye bar len par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: des na de yang nye bar len par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Therefore, that is also appropriation.

original: me log pas ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: me log pas ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: When fire is reversed,

original: de bzhin du me log na tsandan gyi du ba'i gnas skabs nyid log par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du me log na tsandan gyi du ba'i gnas skabs nyid log par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the state of sandalwood smoke is reversed.

original: gnas skabs kyi rgyu log pas ni rgyun ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi rgyu log pas ni rgyun ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cause of the state is not reversed by the reversal of the continuum.

original: lan gnyis pa sdud pa ni sems ni lus dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis pa sdud pa ni sems ni lus dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The second response is “The mind and the body together.

original: lus dang sems 'dres pa de gnyis kyis 'bras bu ma yin na /
analyzed: lus dang sems 'dres pa de gnyis kyis 'bras bu ma yin na /
translated: If the body and mind are mixed, those two are not the result.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'am lus gzhan dang lhan cig yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'am lus gzhan dang lhan cig yang rung ste /
translated: It is either alone or together with another body.

original: rgyun du 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems lus med kyang gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyun du 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi sems lus med kyang gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The mind, which is by nature continuous, exists even without a body.

original: dper na me dang gser gnyis kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gser ni me med kyang gnas pa bzhin @88a * //
analyzed: dper na me dang gser gnyis kyi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i gser ni me med kyang gnas pa bzhin @88a * //
translated: For example, gold, which is not the effect of fire, exists even without fire.

original: no ; / bshad zin pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'di skad brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: no ; / bshad zin pa'i don nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'di skad brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to clarify the meaning that has been explained, it is said:

original: lus dang sems kyi mtshan nyid can 'bras bu gnyis ni'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi mtshan nyid can 'bras bu gnyis ni'o //
translated: The two effects, which have the nature of body and mind,🔽If those two causes were not effects, etc.

original: rgyu de gnyis 'bras bu min na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis 'bras bu min na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary is:

original: lus log na ni zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: lus log na ni zhes bya ba'o//
translated: When the body is destroyed,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But, on the other hand,

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: That is, the distinction.

original: gang gi cho chu log na ldog pa ma yin no zhes 'don pa de'i tshe ni de zhes bya ba rgyun la bya ste rgyun de ni chu log kyang mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi cho chu log na ldog pa ma yin no zhes 'don pa de'i tshe ni de zhes bya ba rgyun la bya ste rgyun de ni chu log kyang mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But when the text reads, “When the flood is reversed, it is not reversed,” then the “it” refers to the continuum, and the meaning is that the continuum is not reversed even when the flood is reversed.

original: yang ci ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa'i skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni rgyun no //
analyzed: yang ci ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa'i skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni rgyun no //
translated: “ Again, how?” is the second objection. “ It would arise” means that consciousness is a continuum.

original: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus nye bar len par thal lo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus nye bar len par thal lo zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because the continuum of consciousness is the cause of the continuum of consciousness, it follows that the body would be appropriated by it. This is the opponent’s opinion.

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang po spangs nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang po spangs nas /
translated: Here, having rejected the first,

original: gnyis pa sel bar byed pa ni dang por rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba'i sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pas thams cad la grub pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sel bar byed pa ni dang por rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba'i sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pas thams cad la grub pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: he refutes the second. The idea is that because the first, “consciousness,” is a continuation of the prior formative forces, it is established in all cases.

original: yang na rang ngam gzhan gyis ma mthong ba des na nye bar len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na rang ngam gzhan gyis ma mthong ba des na nye bar len pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, it is not appropriated because it is not seen by oneself or another.

original: gal te gnod pas byas pa med kyang rgyun ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pas byas pa med kyang rgyun ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it is not destroyed, will the continuum not be interrupted?🔽The appropriator is destroyed

original: nyer len gnod par byed pa ni //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyer len gnod par byed pa ni // zhes gsungs so //
translated: by the destruction of the body.

original: 'chad par ni 'bru'i rgyun gyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chad par ni 'bru'i rgyun gyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The continuum is explained as the continuum of the seed.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe brjod pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe brjod pa'o //
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: gang la gnod pa med par rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa yin snyam na rnam par shes ba'i nye bar len pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang la gnod pa med par rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa yin snyam na rnam par shes ba'i nye bar len pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: If you think that consciousness is the appropriator because it is not destroyed, he says, “The appropriator is consciousness, not the body.”

original: nyid yin gyi lus ni ma yin te nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid yin gyi lus ni ma yin te nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the body, because it does not have the two characteristics of appropriating.

original: 'on te 'di la yang gnod pa srid do snyam na de la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la yang gnod pa srid do snyam na de la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the body can be destroyed, he says, “Even if the body is destroyed, consciousness is not destroyed.”

original: 'di tsam gyis ni tshig le'ur byas pa dang po bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni tshig le'ur byas pa dang po bshad pa yin no //
translated: This much explains the first verse.

original: gnyis la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'di'i dang lag la yin no //
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'di'i dang lag la yin no //
translated: The phrase “two or more” refers to the present explanation.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brgyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brgyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to fainting and so on.

original: dus de tsam du gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: dus de tsam du gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How do you know that the harm lasts only that long?

original: gang gi phyir snga ma rnam pa thams cad du nyams pa na phyis lus las snga na med pa'i sems nyid skye ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma rnam pa thams cad du nyams pa na phyis lus las snga na med pa'i sems nyid skye ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because when the previous state is completely destroyed, the mind that did not exist previously arises again in the body.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed la ltos pa can zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed la ltos pa can zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “It depends on previous formative factors.”

original: 'di ni tshig le'ur @88b byas pa'i don yang bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig le'ur @88b byas pa'i don yang bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is also the meaning of the verse.

original: rnam chad min te rnam pa thams cad du med ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam chad min te rnam pa thams cad du med ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not completely destroyed, because it is not completely nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam shes rnam tshad zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam shes rnam tshad zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “because consciousness is limited by the body.”

original: gal te dmigs pa'i phyir na rmi lam du rnam par shes pa rnam par chad kyang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i phyir na rmi lam du rnam par shes pa rnam par chad kyang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If consciousness is limited by the body, then even though consciousness is interrupted in dreams, it arises again.

original: gzhan du go ji ltar snyam na /🔽shi dang gnyid log pa dag la //
analyzed: gzhan du go ji ltar snyam na / shi dang gnyid log pa dag la //
translated: How is that?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “In death and sleep.”

original: des na gang zhig rnam par chad pa de ni sad pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: des na gang zhig rnam par chad pa de ni sad pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which is interrupted is connected with awakening,

original: dper na gnyid mthug pa'i tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnyid mthug pa'i tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: just as one who is deeply asleep is connected with the waking state.

original: 'chi ba yang rnam par 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang rnam par 'chad pa yin no //
translated: And death is also an interruption.

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no other world.

original: gnyid la sogs pa'i dpe la 'khrul pa dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid la sogs pa'i dpe la 'khrul pa dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt about the error in the example of sleep, etc. is stated in the words, “But if it is claimed.

original: kho nar zhes bya ba ni phyis mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: kho nar zhes bya ba ni phyis mi skye ba'o //
translated: . . . only. . . . ” means that there is no subsequent arising.

original: des na rnam par chad par ni yang 'byung bas ma khyab po snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par chad par ni yang 'byung bas ma khyab po snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that everything that is interrupted does not arise again.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is stated in the words, “That is not so. . . . ”🔽The idea is that this doubt is based on the assumption that sometimes there is only an interruption.

original: res 'ga' rnam par chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'di 'dra ba 'di de ga las yin 'di skad brjod par 'gyur de 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'i dngos po ni de nyid du 'gyur gyi rnam par chad pa ni rang ngam gzhan 'ga'
analyzed: res 'ga' rnam par chad pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'di 'dra ba 'di de ga las yin 'di skad brjod par 'gyur de 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'i dngos po ni de nyid du 'gyur gyi rnam par chad pa ni rang ngam gzhan 'ga'
translated: From where does this idea come? It is stated in the words, “It might be said. . . . ”

original: zhig gis rtogs par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhig gis rtogs par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not possible to understand it.

original: re zhig rang gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig rang gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Having made this statement from his own point of view, he says, “If you say that the world is finite, etc.”

original: kun te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o mi dmigs pa tsam gyis rnam par 'chad par dgag pa ga las yin te /
analyzed: kun te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o mi dmigs pa tsam gyis rnam par 'chad par dgag pa ga las yin te /
translated: “All” refers to the views of others. How can the negation of the existence of another world be established by mere nonapprehension?

original: gal te rnam par chad pa rtag tu rang nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa de lta na yang mtha' gcig tu bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir na res 'ga' gtan du rnam par chad bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par chad pa rtag tu rang nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa de lta na yang mtha' gcig tu bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir na res 'ga' gtan du rnam par chad bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If nonapprehension is always nonapprehension of itself, then it cannot be done in one place, and so sometimes it will be nonapprehension of another.

original: de lta yin te rnam par chad pa med par ma nges pa nyid 'jig rten pha rol yod pa'i tha snyad med par grub pa snyam du 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal bas brgal bar bya'i phyir brgal dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin te rnam par chad pa med par ma nges pa nyid 'jig rten pha rol yod pa'i tha snyad med par grub pa snyam du 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal bas brgal bar bya'i phyir brgal dka' ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the nonapprehension of another is not ascertained, and the existence of another world is not established. This is a difficult objection, and it is difficult to respond to it.

original: de sun 'byin pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is, “This is not so.”

original: de lta na yang snga na med pa skye ba 'thad par dka' ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang snga na med pa skye ba 'thad par dka' ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is difficult to accept that what did not exist previously arises.

original: des na rnam par chad pa tsam khas blangs kyang srid pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rnam par chad pa tsam khas blangs kyang srid pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that although mere discontinuity is accepted, it is not contradictory to existence.

original: sngon dang phyi ma dag gi mtha' rnam par chad pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa de ni sngon gyi 'du byed med par ma yin la de bzhin du 'du byed snga ma snga ma yang ngo //🔽des na ji ltar sngon byung ba'i mtha' rnam par @89a * //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma dag gi mtha' rnam par chad pa dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pa de ni sngon gyi 'du byed med par ma yin la de bzhin du 'du byed snga ma snga ma yang ngo // des na ji ltar sngon byung ba'i mtha' rnam par @89a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement “The prior and subsequent limits of the past and future are not observed to be discontinuous” is that the prior limit of the past is not without prior formative factors, and similarly, prior formative factors are not without subsequent formative factors.

original: ma dmigs pa de bzhin du phyi mar gyur pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa de bzhin du phyi mar gyur pa yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, just as the prior limit of the past is not observed, the subsequent limit of the future is also not observed.

original: 'di ltar dper na 'du byed snga ma snga ma rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshams ma sbyar ba gnas la mi dbang ba de bzhin du phyi ma phyi ma yang mtshams mi sbyar ba ci ltar nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na 'du byed snga ma snga ma rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshams ma sbyar ba gnas la mi dbang ba de bzhin du phyi ma phyi ma yang mtshams mi sbyar ba ci ltar nus te /
translated: For example, just as prior formative factors are not able to connect with consciousness that is not compatible with them, in the same way, subsequent formative factors are also not able to connect with prior consciousness.

original: tshogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in being collections.

original: khyad par yod na yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang brjod dgos so //
translated: If there is a difference, it must be stated.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa thun mong nyid na bshad pa des na snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis la rnam par dbye ba med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa thun mong nyid na bshad pa des na snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis la rnam par dbye ba med do //
translated: If there is a commonality, such as being associated with afflictions, then the previous and subsequent statements are not differentiated.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i 'dus byas nas brjod pa ni gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i 'dus byas nas brjod pa ni gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the conditioned in the second conception is “by another.”

original: dmigs ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems gzhan la'o //
analyzed: dmigs ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems gzhan la'o //
translated: Because there is no characteristic of the object of observation, the mind of another is in another.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams la ni gzhan gyi shes pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams la ni gzhan gyi shes pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: For yogins, the mind of another is only the characteristic of the object of observation.

original: 'on kyang de dgag pa 'jug pa de yang ring ba kho na'o //🔽des na shes pa rnam par chad pa ni rang ngam gzhan gyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dgag pa 'jug pa de yang ring ba kho na'o // des na shes pa rnam par chad pa ni rang ngam gzhan gyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the engagement of the negation of that is only distant.🔽Therefore, the interrupted consciousness is not observed by itself or another.

original: des na rnam par shes pa rnam par chad par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa rnam par chad par rtog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no conception of the interrupted consciousness.

original: 'on te yang 'dod chags dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bral ba'i phyir na sems kyi rgyun gnas pa la nyams pa srid pa'i phyir rnam par chad par 'gyur ro snyam na 'dod chags dang bral bas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te yang 'dod chags dang bral ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa bral ba'i phyir na sems kyi rgyun gnas pa la nyams pa srid pa'i phyir rnam par chad par 'gyur ro snyam na 'dod chags dang bral bas gsungs so //
translated: But if one is free from attachment, then the continuum of mind is interrupted, because one is free from all afflictions, and it is possible that one will fall away from abiding in the continuum.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi don la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi don la zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “because of one’s own aim.”

original: nyes pa dang bral ba yang gzhan don la mi dga' ba ni bral ba ma yin zhing gzhan gyi don la mi dga' na yang nyes pa med ba nyid kyang 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bral ba yang gzhan don la mi dga' ba ni bral ba ma yin zhing gzhan gyi don la mi dga' na yang nyes pa med ba nyid kyang 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And if one is free from faults, one is not free from disliking the aims of others. And if one dislikes the aims of others, one is not free from faults. The meaning is that one does not have the connection.🔽Therefore,

original: des na / gang dag brtse ba chen po can //
analyzed: des na / gang dag brtse ba chen po can //
translated: those who have great compassion

original: gzhan gyi dor ni bzhugs pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dor ni bzhugs pa yin //
translated: abide for the sake of others.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la nyams dmas pa srid pas rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la nyams dmas pa srid pas rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible that one who is free from attachment will fall away and so interrupt the continuum.

original: 'dis ni theg pa gcig pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni theg pa gcig pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the position of the one vehicle.🔽The position of the three vehicles is also taught, “Or else.

original: theg pa gsum gyi phyogs kyang gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //🔽skabs la brten nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi phyogs kyang gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o // skabs la brten nas brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the three vehicles is also said to be “or” .🔽🔽The statement based on the occasion is as follows:

original: nyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “It is not a fault” is based on the context.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na ni 'bras bu skyed mi nus pa'i skad cig 'jog pas rgyun chad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na ni 'bras bu skyed mi nus pa'i skad cig 'jog pas rgyun chad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: In the state of freedom from attachment, the continuum is interrupted because the moment that is unable to produce a result is posited.

original: des na mtha' med pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas @89b 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mtha' med pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas @89b 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The context is summarized in the phrase “for that reason.🔽”

analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa ltar rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa nyams pas ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that consciousness ceases due to the loss of appropriation, as in the case of seeds, etc.

analyzed: gal te lus kyang nye bar len pa yin la /
translated: If the body is also an appropriation,

analyzed: lus ni nye bar len pa ma yin te mtshan nyid gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na sems gnod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Even though it is like that, the mind is not the appropriator.🔽The meaning is that even though the mind is the appropriator, it is not the object to be harmed.

analyzed: sems kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even though it is like that, the mind is not the appropriator.🔽The meaning is that even though the mind is the appropriator, it is not the object to be harmed.🔽Even though it is like that, the mind is not the appropriator.

analyzed: sems ni nye bar len pa yin yang gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ci ltar zhe na gang gang gi phyir dang po'i skye bar skye ba gzhan gyi lus dang lhan cig spyod pa'i 'du byed pa gang yin pa de dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / rmi lam gyi de ma thag tu sad pa'i gnas skabs su 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas rmi lam gyi 'du byed gang yin pa de dang rjes su 'brel par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'i rten so sor nges pa ma yin mod
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gang gang gi phyir dang po'i skye bar skye ba gzhan gyi lus dang lhan cig spyod pa'i 'du byed pa gang yin pa de dang rjes su 'brel pa dang / rmi lam gyi de ma thag tu sad pa'i gnas skabs su 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas rmi lam gyi 'du byed gang yin pa de dang rjes su 'brel par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'i rten so sor nges pa ma yin mod
translated: Although the basis of the latter is not individually certain,

original: / de lta na yang de zhig pas ci ste mi 'jig ce na /
analyzed: / de lta na yang de zhig pas ci ste mi 'jig ce na /
translated: why would it not cease when that ceases?

original: rten so sor nges pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rten so sor nges pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The basis is individually certain.

original: rang gis spangs nas da ni rten nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pas rnam 'grel la 'grel pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis spangs nas da ni rten nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pas rnam 'grel la 'grel pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the Pramii(laviirttikam) says that the basis itself does not exist, having been abandoned by itself.

original: 'o na ji ltar ri mo la sogs pa 'jig snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ri mo la sogs pa 'jig snyam pa la /
translated: But how can a painting, etc., be destroyed?

original: ri mo la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: A painting, etc., is not destroyed by the destruction of its basis.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because they are not different.

original: de'i rgyu nyid ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The cause of that is the cause of destruction.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu des ni gzhag bar bya ba'i dngos po ci zhig byas kyang ci ltar med pa la rgyu nyid kyi don ma yin /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu des ni gzhag bar bya ba'i dngos po ci zhig byas kyang ci ltar med pa la rgyu nyid kyi don ma yin /
translated: What is the state of affairs that the cause of endurance is supposed to bring about? How can it be that a cause has no meaning with respect to what does not exist?

original: med pa la ni rgyu dang 'brel pa yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa la ni rgyu dang 'brel pa yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that what does not exist is related to a cause,

original: 'brel ba ni gnyis kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni gnyis kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a relation is a property of two things.

original: med pa la ni rgyus ci yang byed pa ma yin no //🔽de lta na yang byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhing rten ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bden te /
analyzed: med pa la ni rgyus ci yang byed pa ma yin no // de lta na yang byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhing rten ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bden te /
translated: A cause does not do anything to what does not exist.

original: de kho nar ni med pa la gnyi gar yang med do //
analyzed: de kho nar ni med pa la gnyi gar yang med do //
translated: Even so, what is the meaning of “it does not do anything”? And how could it not be a basis? It is true that in reality, neither of these two is possible with respect to what does not exist.

original: kun rdzob tu yang sngar ma dmigs ba las 'ga' zhig nye na ni nye bar 'gyur ba'i @90a * //🔽yod pa la med pa skye'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang sngar ma dmigs ba las 'ga' zhig nye na ni nye bar 'gyur ba'i @90a * // yod pa la med pa skye'o //
translated: But conventionally, if something is not observed previously, it is possible that it exists later when it is observed.🔽Thus, it is said that what does not exist is produced.

original: ji ltar zhes rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du med pa la rgyu yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du med pa la rgyu yod do //
translated: Just as one posits that which is not existent as existent, in the same way, one should posit that a cause exists with respect to what does not exist.

original: med pa rgyu la ltos so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa rgyu la ltos so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the nonexistent depends on a cause.

original: de bzhin brten ba ni rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin brten ba ni rnam par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, that which is dependent is not stable.

original: de'i tshe ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, it would be the nature of cause and effect.

original: yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin no zhes tha snyad kyang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin no zhes tha snyad kyang byed pa yin no //
translated: It is also conventionally said that the existent depends on something.

original: des na med pa la ni rten par rigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na med pa la ni rten par rigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the nonexistent depends on something.

original: 'o na yod pa nyid la 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa nyid la 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it would be the existent.

original: yod pa la yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa la yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the existent also.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnas par bya ba'o //
translated: That very same is what is to be made stable.

original: de ltar na de nyid byas mod ce na skyon ci yod zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid byas mod ce na skyon ci yod zhe na /
translated: In that case, what is the fault if it is made stable?

original: yod pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the existent also.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having stated the fault in the position of nondifference, in order to refute the position of difference, the objection is anticipated:🔽But if the existent depends on something,

original: cung zad yod pas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: cung zad yod pas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: it is said that because of the slightest existence, that is, the nature of stability,

original: rten la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni phan 'dogs pa la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: rten la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni phan 'dogs pa la sogs ba'o //
translated: The words “etc.” in “basis, etc.” include benefit, etc.

original: gal te gnas pa gnas par bya ba las tha mi dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa gnas par bya ba las tha mi dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If endurance is not just something that is not different from what is to be endured,

original: des na de byas na dngos po ma byas pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na de byas na dngos po ma byas pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could an entity be unendured if it is endured?

original: gnas pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Endurance is . . .”

original: rang gi dang ba'i zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis gnas par bya ba las so //
analyzed: rang gi dang ba'i zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis gnas par bya ba las so //
translated: “Its own” refers to what is to be endured in the context.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ltung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “It would fall . . .”

original: tha mi dad na gzhan nyid la nyes pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad na gzhan nyid la nyes pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not different, the fault of being different is stated. He says, “If . . .”

original: gnas par bya ba de'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba de'o //
translated: It is what is to be endured.

original: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma phyed po rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'i dngos po zhes pa ni gnas gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma phyed po rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'i dngos po zhes pa ni gnas gang yin pa'o //
translated: The remainder of the half-verse of the Commentary is explained by the Commentary: “That” refers to the entity that is endured.

original: 'dir tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs dag la ni nyes pa brjod zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs dag la ni nyes pa brjod zin pa kho na'o //
translated: Here, the faults of the positions of difference and non-difference have already been stated.

original: 'on kyang nyes pa lhag pa brjod pa'i don du ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa lhag pa brjod pa'i don du ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But in order to state the additional fault, he says, “Why?”

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa na'o //
translated: “Otherwise” means if it is not arisen.

original: de la de ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs ba ni skyes pa'i sngon rol du ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnas pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de la de ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs ba ni skyes pa'i sngon rol du ni dngos po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnas pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: With regard to that, in consideration of the conception of immediacy, he says, “Prior to arising, it is not a thing,” which is connected with “enduring.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skabs kyis gnas pa med ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs kyis gnas pa med ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no endurance in the interval.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po sel bar byed pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po sel bar byed pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first conception is eliminated by “different.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang zhes gsungs so //🔽'brel pa med ba ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang zhes gsungs so // 'brel pa med ba ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: He says, “because of its identity.”

original: de dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to anticipate the argument that “non-difference is not established,” he says, “mixed with it.”

original: sun 'byin pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is “That is not so.”

original: gnas par bya ba der ro //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba der ro //
translated: “There” refers to endurance.

original: nyes pa gzhan @90b yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan @90b yang brjod pa ni /
translated: He states another fault:

original: gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'phrod pa 'du pas ni dngos po'i rang bzhin sel ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni 'phrod pa 'du pas ni dngos po'i rang bzhin sel ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The response to the doubt, “If it is different,” is that the nature of a thing is not excluded by the contact of the other.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par ro //
translated: “ In another way” means not as non-different.

original: de'i tshe gnas bar bya ba las gnas pa gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs las so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas bar bya ba las gnas pa gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs las so //
translated: “ At that time, the abiding is not different from that which is to be abided in,” is understood from the context.

original: de lta na yang sngar gyi skyon nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang sngar gyi skyon nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: “ Even so, the former error remains,” is the thought.

original: gzhan du khyad par dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du khyad par dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The doubt about the difference in another way is

original: so so ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so so ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ in the individual.”

original: so so bar grub na ni ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: so so bar grub na ni ldan pa yin la /
translated: If it is established as individual, then it is possessed.

original: so so ba ma yin par grub na ni 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: so so ba ma yin par grub na ni 'du ba yin no //
translated: If it is established as non-individual, then it is combined.

original: so so ba ma yin par grub na ni so sor mi rtog pa'am so sor ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: so so ba ma yin par grub na ni so sor mi rtog pa'am so sor ma skyes pa'o //
translated: If it is established as non-individual, then it is non-differentiated or non-produced.

original: de la re zhig phyogs gnyis pa nyid sel ba ni shing la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs gnyis pa nyid sel ba ni shing la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: First, the exclusion of the second alternative is stated in “the tree, etc.”

original: yal ga so sor skyes pa gnyis 'dres pa ni ma yin gyis 'on kyang lhan cig kho nar skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: yal ga so sor skyes pa gnyis 'dres pa ni ma yin gyis 'on kyang lhan cig kho nar skyes pa yin no //
translated: The two branches do not grow separately and then join together. Rather, they grow together at the same time.

original: 'di la'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste yal ga 'di la yang 'di zhes mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste yal ga 'di la yang 'di zhes mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition “in this” refers to the other, the branch, because it does not conceive of “this,”

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: we reply: No, because🔽the cognition “in this” is not a cognition of the branch.

original: ; ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ; ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: ldan pa nyid la gnyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa nyid la gnyis mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of “this” is seen to occur in the case of possession.

original: 'du ba la ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba la ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not occur in the case of mere aggregation, because that is the opposite of possession.

original: thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'brel pa ste de'i phyir ro //🔽'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu ni gnyis mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'brel pa ste de'i phyir ro // 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu ni gnyis mthong ba yin la /
translated: The cognition “in this” is the cause of the cognition “this.”

original: de la yang ldan pa'i yul la yin no //
analyzed: de la yang ldan pa'i yul la yin no //
translated: The cognition “this” occurs in the case of the object of possession.

original: des na de nyid du 'di lta bu'o snyam pa'i blo 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de nyid du 'di lta bu'o snyam pa'i blo 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition “this” is related to the cognition “in this.”

original: 'du ba'i yul la ni de med pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: 'du ba'i yul la ni de med pa'i phyir med do //
translated: But it does not occur in the case of the object of mere aggregation, because that is the opposite of possession.

original: des na der ni ba lang 'di la rigs zhes bya ba 'di rang gi rtog pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: des na der ni ba lang 'di la rigs zhes bya ba 'di rang gi rtog pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement “This is the class of cow” is merely one’s own idea.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mgo la gnyis mthong ba las 'gyur de yi //
analyzed: mgo la gnyis mthong ba las 'gyur de yi //
translated: Because of seeing two heads,

original: yul las 'gar yang gnyis mthong med des na //
analyzed: yul las 'gar yang gnyis mthong med des na //
translated: there is no seeing two objects anywhere.

original: rang gi rtog pa tsam zhig thabs su 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa tsam zhig thabs su 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it is merely one’s own idea.

original: zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po slong ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po slong ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first conception is “But if . . . ”

original: 'du ba can gyi yan lag gang yin pa dag ste gang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i rdzas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi yan lag gang yin pa dag ste gang du 'du bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu'i rdzas skyes pa'o //
translated: Those that are the parts that are assembled are the substance of the effect that is produced where they are assembled.

original: 'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is also an illustration.

original: rdzas gang la yon tan la sogs 'dus par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rdzas gang la yon tan la sogs 'dus par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is the substance in which qualities and so on are assembled,

original: gang du spyi la sogs pa 'du bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang du spyi la sogs pa 'du bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or it is where universals and so on are assembled,

original: yang na gang la rdzas la sogs pa la ltos pa'i 'dus pa nyid yod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang la rdzas la sogs pa la ltos pa'i 'dus pa nyid yod pa ste /
translated: or it is that which has the assembly that depends on substance and so on.

original: de dang so sor ma rtogs pa nyid ni dang po ma yin par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang so sor ma rtogs pa nyid ni dang po ma yin par grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But the non-apprehension of them as distinct is not established as the first.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'du ba can rnams 'dus pa nyid yin @91a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'du ba can rnams 'dus pa nyid yin @91a * //
translated: Even so, the compound is the mere collection of its components.

original: yang 'dir 'di rang gi 'du ba can gyi yan lag 'dus so zhes de lta bu'i rang bzhin can tha dad par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: yang 'dir 'di rang gi 'du ba can gyi yan lag 'dus so zhes de lta bu'i rang bzhin can tha dad par rtogs pas so //
translated: But here, the collection of its components is the part that is the compound. Thus, the apprehension of it is of a different nature.

original: don 'di yin te gal te gnyis rang gi ngo bos snang na /
analyzed: don 'di yin te gal te gnyis rang gi ngo bos snang na /
translated: The point is this: if the two appear by their own nature,

original: de'i tshe so sor ma rtogs pa 'du bar rnam par 'jog 'dod ba'i 'du ba'i gtan gang na yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe so sor ma rtogs pa 'du bar rnam par 'jog 'dod ba'i 'du ba'i gtan gang na yod /
translated: then when there is no apprehension of them as distinct, what is the basis for positing the collection as a compound?

original: 'on te tha dad par snang ba med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad par snang ba med pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if they do not appear as distinct,

original: de lta na 'ang 'di la'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'ang 'di la'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be no apprehension of it as “this.”

original: de ltar phyogs gcig gis 'byar ba khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gcig gis 'byar ba khas blangs nas /
translated: Thus, having accepted that they are joined in one part,

original: ldan pa dang 'du ba dag khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan nas 'byar bar yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa dang 'du ba dag khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan nas 'byar bar yang mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Having taught that, he teaches that it is not tenable that they are joined:

original: yan lag med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no partless thing that abides.

original: yan lag med pa gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni ma dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yan lag med pa gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni ma dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is asserted by others to be partless and to have the nature of abiding is observed nowhere, and thus it does not exist.

original: yang na yod du chug pa de lta na yang de ni yan lag dang 'byar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na yod du chug pa de lta na yang de ni yan lag dang 'byar ba ma yin no //
translated: Or, even if it did exist, it would not be joined to parts.

original: yan lag can ni yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir yan lag can dang zhes ni ma gsungs so ;
analyzed: yan lag can ni yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir yan lag can dang zhes ni ma gsungs so ;
translated: Since it is not asserted that the possessor of parts exists, he does not say “the possessor of parts.”

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yan lag dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yan lag dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “parts.”

original: tha dad par rtogs par thal ba ni gnas dang gnas pa can te /
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs par thal ba ni gnas dang gnas pa can te /
translated: The absurd consequence of their being conceived as different is that they are like a place and something that abides in that place,

original: bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no zhes skabs kyis so //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no zhes skabs kyis so //
translated: like a pot and a cloth.

original: brgya la pha rol po tha dad par rtogs par khas len du 'ong ngo zhes dogs pa bsu nas rjes su zhugs pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brgya la pha rol po tha dad par rtogs par khas len du 'ong ngo zhes dogs pa bsu nas rjes su zhugs pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you admit that the other is perceived as different, then you have accepted our position.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni rjes su ma zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni rjes su ma zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The state of enduring, etc. are not included in the substance,

original: rdzas ni gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas ni gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
translated: but the substance is included in all the states.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rtog pa'i dbye ba med na gang zhig gang du 'du ba yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rtog pa'i dbye ba med na gang zhig gang du 'du ba yin /
translated: If there is no difference in the substance in any way, then what is included in what?

original: de lta bu'i tha dad pa ni rtogs kyang tha dad par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha dad pa ni rtogs kyang tha dad par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though the difference is perceived, it is not established as different,

original: yul dang dus dag gi mngon sum gyi rnam pa tha dad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus dag gi mngon sum gyi rnam pa tha dad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no difference in the form of the direct perception of place and time.

original: de 'gog pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'gog pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable to refute that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because of direct perception.

original: gnas pa las gzhan ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that something other than enduring is not observed.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhi las tha dad pa tha mi dad pa gnas par mi 'thad /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhi las tha dad pa tha mi dad pa gnas par mi 'thad /
translated: Because in this way, it is not tenable that the state is different or non-different from the basis.

original: ltan  cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltan  cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the performance of the same action” and so on.

original: de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “even though this is the case” is a remainder.

original: gnas skabs byed pa log na ni gnas skabs de nyid log par zad do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs byed pa log na ni gnas skabs de nyid log par zad do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that if the performance of the state is reversed, then the state itself is reversed.

original: 'on te lus ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te lus ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the body is the cause of appropriation and not the cause of distinction,

original: lus ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lus ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The body . . . ”

original: nye bar len @91b pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len @91b pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no characteristic of appropriation.

original: des na lus de log ba ni rnam par shes pa tsam ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus de log ba ni rnam par shes pa tsam ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reversal of that body is not the reversal of consciousness alone.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa gzhan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin pa gzhan no //
translated: The phrase “if . . . ” and so on is another refutation.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang la'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang la'o //
translated: It is in regard to consciousness and so on.🔽If the state of destruction is not described as unmoving and indestructible,

original: 'jig pa de'i gal te gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba dang mi 'jig pa la brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig pa de'i gal te gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba dang mi 'jig pa la brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that endurance is not🔽motion, then endurance would be permanent, and it would not be destroyed.🔽

original: de la rten gyis ni mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa nyid byed kyi mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni mi byed pa'i phyi ma 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la rten gyis ni mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa nyid byed kyi mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni mi byed pa'i phyi ma 'di ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Here, the support functions as the cause of stability, but not as the cause of non-cessation. How is the latter?

original: brjod pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de nyid na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de nyid na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: We reply: Stability is not present in that which is called “unstable.”

original: 'jig pa yang yod pa dang 'gal pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang yod pa dang 'gal pa yin te /
translated: Cessation is the opposite of existence.

original: 'jig na gnas de yang yod mi srid do //
analyzed: 'jig na gnas de yang yod mi srid do //
translated: When there is cessation, stability is impossible.

original: des na gnas pa ni 'jig pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba rigs so //🔽de la 'ang thal bar mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa de yang dngos po las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: des na gnas pa ni 'jig pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa yin pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba rigs so // de la 'ang thal bar mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa de yang dngos po las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: Therefore, since stability is pervaded by the opposite of cessation, it is logical that the consequence is incurred.🔽Here, the same consequence applies to you.

original: de la 'jig pas ni dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na de'i tshe 'di rang gi rgyu ci ltar skyed pa de kho na 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyu rten gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la 'jig pas ni dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na de'i tshe 'di rang gi rgyu ci ltar skyed pa de kho na 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyu rten gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If cessation is different from the thing, then at the time of the thing, the thing would not cease. If it is not different, then at the time of the thing, the thing would not cease. Therefore, since it is not tenable that cessation is either different or not different from the thing, how could the thing be ceased?

original: ci'i phyir 'jig pa med par thal snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig pa med par thal snyam na /
translated: Why is it that it follows that there is no destruction?

original: gnas par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas par zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “because of abiding.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma la 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Or” and so on introduce the remainder of the commentary.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
translated: Having stated the error in the position of nondifference, he states the error in the position of difference:

original: dngos po las 'jig pa gzhan yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu des dngos po la ci zhig byas nas gang gis de'i 'jig par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po las 'jig pa gzhan yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu des dngos po la ci zhig byas nas gang gis de'i 'jig par byed par 'gyur /
translated: If destruction were different from things, then what would the cause of destruction do to things, by which it would cause their destruction?

original: 'jig pa byas pa des na 'di 'jig pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa byas pa des na 'di 'jig pa byas pa yin no //
translated: Since it causes destruction, it is the cause of destruction.

original: 'jig pa bzhin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa bzhin zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “like destruction.”

original: des na zhes bya bas 'jig bar byed pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya bas 'jig bar byed pas na'o //
translated: “Then” means “because of causing destruction.”

original: cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it does not cause even the slightest thing, therefore🔽it does not cause even the slightest destruction.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig par byed pa cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid mjug sdud pa ni gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig par byed pa cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid mjug sdud pa ni gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the point that it does not cause even the slightest destruction, whether it is different or nondifferent, is stated in the line “What would be the point of a cause of endurance?”

original: 'jig par byed par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig par byed par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: It follows that it would cause destruction.

original: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //
translated: If you assert that it is destroyed by a cause of destruction,

original: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya //
translated: what is the use of a cause of endurance?

original: zhes bya ba 'di la bshad pa gzhan gsungs na yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la bshad pa gzhan gsungs na yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the other alternative.

original: bshad pa gnyi ga gzhan gyi lan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa gnyi ga gzhan gyi lan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The other alternative is the response to the response.

original: gal te zhes 'jig rgyu zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes 'jig rgyu zhes smos so //
translated: If you say, “It is destroyed by a cause of destruction,”🔽the response is, “It is destroyed by the thing itself.”

original: gnas par byed pa des 'jig par byed pa dang phrad kyi bar du gnas par bya ba rnam par gnas par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa des 'jig par byed pa dang phrad kyi bar du gnas par bya ba rnam par gnas par bya ba yin te /
translated: The response is, “It endures as long as it is not contacted by a cause of destruction.”

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'jig byed 'ong ba la mi ltos pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam @92a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'jig byed 'ong ba la mi ltos pa nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam @92a * //
translated: If that were not so, it would not depend on the approach of a cause of destruction and it would be destroyed without a cause.

original: na ; lan du 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //
analyzed: na ; lan du 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //
translated: The response is, “Destruction is the reality of things.”

original: ces bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: gal te gnas par bya ba gnas pa'i don du gnas par byed pa ma yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa'i rgyu med par rang nyid 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gnas par bya ba gnas pa'i don du gnas par byed pa ma yin na de'i tshe 'jig pa'i rgyu med par rang nyid 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: If that which is to be endured does not endure for the sake of endurance, then without a cause of destruction, it would be destroyed by itself.

original: bzlog na ni 'jig ba'i rgyu las 'jig pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //🔽de lta na yang 'jig pa rgyu med par thal ba des na 'jig pa dngos po'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: bzlog na ni 'jig ba'i rgyu las 'jig pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro // de lta na yang 'jig pa rgyu med par thal ba des na 'jig pa dngos po'i chos nyid do //
translated: If it is reversed, then because of destruction from a cause of destruction, that which makes endure would have an effect.🔽In that case, too, because of the consequence that destruction would be without a cause, destruction is the intrinsic reality of things.

original: yod pa'i don la 'jig pa 'di pa gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yod pa'i don la 'jig pa 'di pa gnod pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: For this destruction of an existent object is not impaired.

original: gnas pa'i rgyus ni ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus ni ci zhig bya //
translated: What would the cause of endurance do?

original: zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: re zhig rtsod pa'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni gnas par byed pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig rtsod pa'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni gnas par byed pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the parts of the debate is this: If there is no endurance, then destruction would occur without a cause of destruction.

original: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa med bar 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig byed med par rang nyid 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas par byed pa med bar 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig byed med par rang nyid 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that whatever destruction occurs without endurance would be without a cause of destruction and would occur by itself.

original: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang gnas par byed par byed pa ji ltar nye bar sbyor ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang gnas par byed par byed pa ji ltar nye bar sbyor ba yin snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how could that which makes endure be applied?

original: gnas par byed pa yod na /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa yod na /
translated: If endurance exists, then destruction would not exist.

original: dngos po 'jig gi 'jig pa'i rgyu med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig gi 'jig pa'i rgyu med par ni ma yin no //
translated: not without a cause of cessation.

original: grub pa'i mtha' rnam par grol ba'i don du gsungs pa ni de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rnam par grol ba'i don du gsungs pa ni de lta na yang zhes bya ba ste /

original: gnas par byed pa med na rang nyid 'jig bar khas blangs nas 'o na 'jig ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa med na rang nyid 'jig bar khas blangs nas 'o na 'jig ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
translated: If you admit that there is no cause of endurance, then you must admit that things are destroyed by their very nature.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: The words “this” and “that” refer to destruction.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The words “or” and “if” refer to the other position.

original: lan du 'jig pa'i gegs de yang zhes bya bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du 'jig pa'i gegs de yang zhes bya bya ba'o //
translated: The words “that which is the cause of the cessation of cessation” are the response.

original: 'jig pa'i gegs de yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i gegs de yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: The words “that which is the cause of the cessation of cessation” refer to that which is the impediment to cessation.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The words “or” and “if” refer to the other position.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'jig pa ma yin par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'jig pa ma yin par ro //
translated: The words “in some other way” refer to non-cessation.

original: lan du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is stated in the words, “In that case, . . . ”

original: rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi nus pa dang don med pa'i nyes pas zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi nus pa dang don med pa'i nyes pas zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The words “without a cause” are intended to show the faults of impotence and purposelessness.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste 'jig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste 'jig pa yang ngo //
translated: “And that” means “and also destruction.”

original: des na 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa dngos chos nyid //
translated: Therefore, “destruction is the reality of things.”

original: ces bya ba ma gtogs par lhag ma la bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa na yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ma gtogs par lhag ma la bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa na yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the other explanation is stated, except for that, “or” is used.

original: 'jig par bya ba dang phrad kyi bar du mi 'jig par gnas par byed pa las gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: 'jig par bya ba dang phrad kyi bar du mi 'jig par gnas par byed pa las gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin /

original: de lta yin na mi 'jig par skyes pas zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na mi 'jig par skyes pas zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: If that were the case, the meaning of “arisen without being destroyed” would be this:

original: brtags pa ni skabs kyi rten pa la /
analyzed: brtags pa ni skabs kyi rten pa la /
translated: The context is the basis of imputation.

original: phyin ci log tu rtog ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Erroneous conception” means

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: that the relation of cause and effect is not a relation of support and supported.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag @92b chags kyi mthu las zhes bya ba 'dis bzung ba'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag @92b chags kyi mthu las zhes bya ba 'dis bzung ba'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Due to the power of beginningless latent potentialities” clarifies the meaning of that, and “for that reason” indicates that.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the treatise.

original: yid tsam la brten pa ni yid kyi'o //
analyzed: yid tsam la brten pa ni yid kyi'o //
translated: The mental is based on the mind alone.

original: gnas par byed pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i mthar thug par sus kyang bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i mthar thug par sus kyang bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The final is the end of the activity of endurance, which cannot be stopped by any cause of destruction.

analyzed: des na skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i dus su gnas par byed pa don med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the activity of endurance in the second moment and so on is purposeless.

original: 'on te mi 'jig pa'i phyir med pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'jig pa'i phyir med pa ma yin mod /
translated: But if it is not nonexistent because it does not perish,

analyzed: ltung ba ni ldog tu med pa'i phyir rten la ltos so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then it falls, and it depends on a basis because it cannot be stopped.  This is not so,

analyzed: ltung ba yang rang gi ngo bo las 'pho ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because falling is by nature a transformation from its own state.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But if it is not so, it is the other's.

original: skad cig gnas par yang gnas par byed pa yod par khas blangs te /
analyzed: skad cig gnas par yang gnas par byed pa yod par khas blangs te /
translated: Even if it endures for a moment, it is accepted that endurance exists,

analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnas par bya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: otherwise it would not endure.  This is the thought.

original: lan ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is In that case...

original: de lta yin na gnas par byed pa las so sor mi 'jig pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gnas par byed pa las so sor mi 'jig pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then a different thing that is not destroyed would arise from the action of enduring.

original: de lta na yang gnas pa'i rgyus ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gnas pa'i rgyus ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, what would the cause of endurance do?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar gnas par byed pa gnas pa de bzhin du gnas par bya bar yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽ngag 'dir gnas pa po gzhan dang gzhan khas len rten bcas thams cad gnas dang gnas ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'grel nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir lan dogs par byed pa ni rang gi rgyus byas so zhe na zhes bya ba'o //

translated: Moreover, just as the endurer endures, so too the endured would endure.🔽In this statement, the reply to the objection that the endurer and the endured are different is that all things that are accepted as having a basis are called the endurer and the endured.

original: lan du gnas par bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du gnas par bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the reply is made by its own cause, the reply is that the endured is also like that.

original: de ltar zhes byas pa rgyur byas par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes byas pa rgyur byas par ro //
translated: In that case, the reply is made by its own cause.

original: rten 'gog pa la mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i brjod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rten 'gog pa la mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i brjod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection that the refutation of the basis contradicts direct perception is anticipated and responded to:

original: ci ste yang sa phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang sa phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is a place,

analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis yul du byas pa'o // rnam par rtog pa rgyas kyang zhes bya ba ni ci yod dam /
translated: then it is seen by direct perception.🔽And even if there is a proliferation of conceptualization,

analyzed: de ste med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'o //
translated: that is, if there is the proliferation of conceptualization such as “Is it existent?”🔽or “Is it nonexistent?”

original: rnam par rtog pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i dngos pos byas pa nyid blang bar bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i nyes pa yod par dogs na rang nyid ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i dngos pos byas pa nyid blang bar bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i nyes pa yod par dogs na rang nyid ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Conceptualization is to be accepted as having the nature of inference, but if there is the fault of being contradicted by direct perception, then it is nothing at all.

original: des na de bsgrub pa'am gnod na ni nges pa kho nar skabs yod par ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: des na de bsgrub pa'am gnod na ni nges pa kho nar skabs yod par ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za'o //
translated: Therefore, if it is established or contradicted, then it is certainly not the case that there is an opportunity.

original: don dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Object” means

original: gsog tu gyur to zhes bya ba 'thad do //
analyzed: gsog tu gyur to zhes bya ba 'thad do //
translated: it is tenable to say that it is empty.

original: @93a * // 'di la mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @93a * // 'di la mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ In this case, it is similar”

original: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
translated: means that existence and nonexistence are without a basis.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation, such as “because they are without a basis.”

analyzed: gal te re zhig rten dang brten pa'i tha snyad 'di ni yod pa kho na yin la de la yul nges pa can yin pas rgyu mtshan med par yang ma yin no //
translated: If the convention of support and supported exists, then it is not without a reason, since it is restricted to a domain.

analyzed: des na 'di la rgyu mtshan ci yin snyam na / dngos rnams zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, what is the reason for this?🔽The root text states, “Things arise from their causes.”

original: dngos po rnams skad cig sor 'jog pa yin par rigs pa las 'ongs pa yin pa na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig sor 'jog pa yin par rigs pa las 'ongs pa yin pa na /
translated: Since it is reasonable to posit that things are momentary,

original: dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de ltar te nye bar len pa'i yul yongs su ma spangs par skye ba de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rten yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de ltar te nye bar len pa'i yul yongs su ma spangs par skye ba de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na rten yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: it is said that the cause of a thing is its support because it is the cause of the arising of a thing that has not relinquished its appropriated object.

original: des na gnas par byed pa ni skyed byed kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na gnas par byed pa ni skyed byed kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which causes endurance is the producer alone.

original: gzhan las grub na gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las grub na gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If something is established from another, it does not endure.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi 'thad do //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would be untenable.

original: brten pa la ni gnas par byed pa las cir yang 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: brten pa la ni gnas par byed pa las cir yang 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: There is no difference at all between the supported and the supported that endures.

original: mi brtan pa la yang bskyed pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba med pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: mi brtan pa la yang bskyed pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba med pa la ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that there is no function of the heavy other than generation,

original: phan 'dogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it does not assist.

original: yang na 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ni rdzas lci ba rnams la rten yong du chug kyang /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ni rdzas lci ba rnams la rten yong du chug kyang /
translated: Or, let it be that the heavy substances are supports because they obstruct movement,

original: blo la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /🔽bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brten pa ni /🔽'bo ba yis ni gegs byed phyir //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa la ni ma yin te / bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brten pa ni / 'bo ba yis ni gegs byed phyir //
translated: but not the mind, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is:🔽Because of obstructing movement.🔽Water, etc.

original: chu la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni khad kyis 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni khad kyis 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: is gradually explained.

original: mthong ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: “It is not seen” is not established.

original: mthong ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di phyin ci log tu bstan pa'i don du ji skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di phyin ci log tu bstan pa'i don du ji skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: “Because it is contrary to seeing” is taught as the opposite meaning of what is stated.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If” is the other’s.

original: ma mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “It is not seen” is the reply.

original: dngos po gnyis kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis kyi rang bzhin las gzhan ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yang dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do //
translated: Apart from the nature of the two entities, there is no other entity that is the basis of the relation of support and supported, which is an object of perception.

original: de nyid ston pa ni bya ba'i rten gang yin pa de ni byed pa po dang las dag gis 'dzin pa las yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni bya ba'i rten gang yin pa de ni byed pa po dang las dag gis 'dzin pa las yin no //
translated: To demonstrate just this, he says, “The basis of the action is grasped by the agent and the object.”

original: bya ba ni byed pa po'am las la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ni byed pa po'am las la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The action is based on the agent or the object,

original: las la sogs pa brten pa dang bral bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la sogs pa brten pa dang bral bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for the object, etc. to be without a basis.

original: des na byed pa po dang las kyis 'dzin pa nyid las bya pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba ni lugs yin te rgol ba thams cad kyis 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byed pa po dang las kyis 'dzin pa nyid las bya pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba ni lugs yin te rgol ba thams cad kyis 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the basis of the action is the agent and the object, which are grasped by the relation of support and supported, according to the accepted order of the opponent.

original: lugs 'di ni rnam par dpyad na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: lugs 'di ni rnam par dpyad na med pa nyid do //
translated: But this order is not tenable when subjected to critical examination.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Because of the relation of support.”

original: gang 'dzin pa de myur bar ma dmigs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'dzin pa de myur bar ma dmigs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If the relation of support is not perceived, why is it not perceived?

original: ltung ba dang mi ltung bdag ces gsungs so//
analyzed: ltung ba dang mi ltung bdag ces gsungs so//
translated: He says, “Because of falling and not falling.”

original: @93b rigs pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya ste mngon sum nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gcig tu byas nas gzung bas na /
analyzed: @93b rigs pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya ste mngon sum nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gcig tu byas nas gzung bas na /
translated: What is the use of these reasonings? Because direct perception itself apprehends the prior and subsequent natures as identical.
