original: ltung ba gang yin pa de nyid ma ltung ba'i chos can yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba gang yin pa de nyid ma ltung ba'i chos can yin no zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that that which falls is the very thing that has the property of not falling.

original: mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “by direct perception.”

original: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs gnyis tha dad mod gnas skabs can gyi rdzas ni gcig yin no snyam na ltung ba dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs gnyis tha dad mod gnas skabs can gyi rdzas ni gcig yin no snyam na ltung ba dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that although the two states of being understood as different are different, the substance that has the states is one, he says “that which falls.”

original: dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is perceived is certainly not the mutual penetration of natures.

original: de lta na yang gnas skabs can mi 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gnas skabs can mi 'dzin ce na /
translated: Even so, you might ask, “Is not the substance that has the states apprehended?”

original: de lta yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “even so.”

original: gal te da dung yod do zhes bya bar rtogs pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da dung yod do zhes bya bar rtogs pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you think that there is still the apprehension of existence, he says “existence.”

original: yod pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no //
translated: It is true that it exists, but it is only a conceptualization.

original: 'dis brtags pa dus su ma khyab par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can ni mngon sum byed pa yin par mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis brtags pa dus su ma khyab par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin can ni mngon sum byed pa yin par mi brjod do //
translated: This is not called a direct perception that apprehends a nature that is not all-pervasive in time.

original: de med phyir na rdzas su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam blang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de med phyir na rdzas su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam blang bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, a conceptual consciousness that apprehends a substance is not something to be accepted at all.

original: gal te de lta na yang dus gzhan khyab ba dang bral ba'i mngon sum gyis skad cig gcig nyid la gnas skabs 'dzin pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang dus gzhan khyab ba dang bral ba'i mngon sum gyis skad cig gcig nyid la gnas skabs 'dzin pa ma yin mod /
translated: Even if that is so, a direct perception that is not all-pervasive in time does not apprehend a state in a single moment, but it does apprehend it gradually.

original: rim gyis 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa bsu ba ni rim gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa bsu ba ni rim gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To anticipate the response, he says, “If it is gradual . . .”

original: sun 'byin pa ni rim gyi don ci yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni rim gyi don ci yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is, “What is the meaning of gradual?”

original: de nyid spyod pa ni dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid spyod pa ni dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is, “It is a thing . . .”

original: yod pa 'ba' zhig bzung na ni rim gnas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yod pa 'ba' zhig bzung na ni rim gnas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: If only existence is apprehended, there is no gradual abiding.

original: 'on kyang rang ngam 'brel pa can gyi yod pa dang med pa srid na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang ngam 'brel pa can gyi yod pa dang med pa srid na yin no //
translated: However, if existence and nonexistence are possible either in the thing itself or in its relation to something else, then there is gradual abiding.

original: rim gyi tha snyad de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dus tha dad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rim gyi tha snyad de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dus tha dad pa dag yin no //
translated: The term “successively” means that the entity and the non-entity are different in time.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de yang gzung ba'am 'dzin pa yin zhes brtags nas sun 'byin pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa de yang gzung ba'am 'dzin pa yin zhes brtags nas sun 'byin pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The entity and the non-entity are either the apprehended object or the apprehending subject. The refutation of this is easily understood.

original: gzung ba yang der zhes bya ba ni rim pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba yang der zhes bya ba ni rim pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the apprehended object is also like that” means that it is endowed with a sequence.

original: rim pa can ma yin pa las rim pa mi 'byung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa can ma yin pa las rim pa mi 'byung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that a sequence does not occur without a sequence.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa rim pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa rim pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because the apprehending subject is endowed with a sequence.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul rim pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rim pa 'dzin pa'i tha snyad ni rnam par rtog par sgro btags pa kho nar zad kyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul rim pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rim pa 'dzin pa'i tha snyad ni rnam par rtog par sgro btags pa kho nar zad kyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “the domain of conceptual differentiation is a sequence” means that the convention of apprehending a sequence is merely a superimposition of conceptual differentiation; it is not the domain of direct perception.

original: gang gis bya ba ni rim pa mngon sum du gyur pas so //
analyzed: gang gis bya ba ni rim pa mngon sum du gyur pas so //
translated: “By whom” means by one for whom the sequence is manifest.

original: yang mngon sum gang gis dmigs pa'i zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang mngon sum gang gis dmigs pa'i zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “By which direct perception” should be supplied.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya med pa la zhugs pa'i rnam 'grel gyi cha nyid tshad ma med pa la @94a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya med pa la zhugs pa'i rnam 'grel gyi cha nyid tshad ma med pa la @94a * //
translated: Therefore, the portion of the Pramānﬁ avārtika that is devoted to the nonexistence of objects is applied to the nonexistence of valid cognition.

original: yongs su sbyar ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyar ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'di ltar yod med dag la brten phyir zhes bya ba rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dgag pa la sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod med dag la brten phyir zhes bya ba rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dgag pa la sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because they depend on existence and nonexistence, the refutation of the relation of support and supported is applied.

original: de lta na ni mngon sum gyis gnod pas rtsod pa la ma ltos nas /
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon sum gyis gnod pas rtsod pa la ma ltos nas /
translated: In that case, since this is contradicted by perception, without regard to the dispute,

original: yul rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pas yul can nyams su myong bar brten par dgongs pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni mthong ba med pa kho na'o zhes sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pas yul can nyams su myong bar brten par dgongs pa'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni mthong ba med pa kho na'o zhes sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: the relation of support and supported does not exist. Therefore, since the experience of the object is supported, the relation of support and supported is not seen at all.

original: des na 'bras bus bzlas nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bus bzlas nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the argument is repeated with the result.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de mthong ba med par ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po de mthong ba med par ro //
translated: The relation of support and supported is not seen.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni bya rog gi lan no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni bya rog gi lan no //
translated: “ In that case” is the crow’s reply.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba yang yin te nang gi ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba yang yin te nang gi ni /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is also seeing, because it is said:

original: bslang ba las byung gang yin te //
analyzed: bslang ba las byung gang yin te //
translated: That which arises from instigation,🔽and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de la yang thal ba mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de la yang thal ba mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par bshad nas /
translated: Here, the consequence is the same, as has been explained.

original: lhag ma 'chad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma 'chad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remainder is explained in the line beginning with “Moreover,” and so on.

original: gal te de lta na yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'phel na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'phel na /
translated: Even if this is so, if the relationship of support and supported increases,

original: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i khyad par nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i khyad par nyid do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: this is the difference between cause and effect. This is the summarized meaning.

original: de lta min na rigs ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta min na rigs ma yin // zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is not reasonable.🔽This is explained in the line beginning with “the former and the latter.”

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu sgro btags pa la ni skabs kyis brten pa la'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu sgro btags pa la ni skabs kyis brten pa la'o //
translated: The former and the latter are imputed as one. This is in the context of the supported.

original: phyin ci log tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la rten dang brten ba'i dngos po gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la rten dang brten ba'i dngos po gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The phrase “erroneous conception” means that the relation between cause and effect is not a relation of support and something supported.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu las zhes bya ba 'dis gzung ba'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu las zhes bya ba 'dis gzung ba'i don nyid gsal 'debs pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “due to the power of beginningless predispositions” means that the object of apprehension is itself the cause of the appearance.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in this way” introduces the text.

original: yid tsam la brten pa ni yid kyi'o //
analyzed: yid tsam la brten pa ni yid kyi'o //
translated: The phrase “based on mind alone” means based on the mental faculty.

original: gal te de lta na dmigs ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid chos can yin la gtan tshigs kyang dmigs pa med ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / khyad par med par 'gyur ro snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dmigs ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid chos can yin la gtan tshigs kyang dmigs pa med ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / khyad par med par 'gyur ro snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the subject is a conception that lacks an object and the reason is also the lack of an object, then the predicate and the reason would be the same.

original: dper na gong bu rva can 'di rva can nyid phyir rta ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs sa lan 'debs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na gong bu rva can 'di rva can nyid phyir rta ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs sa lan 'debs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not the case, because it is like the following example: In the context of the statement “This horned glob is not a horse because it is horned,” the predicate and the reason are not the same.

original: 'di la sbyor ba ni gang dmigs pa med pa de ni rnam par shes pa snga ma las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba ni gang dmigs pa med pa de ni rnam par shes pa snga ma las byung ba yin te /
translated: The argument here is: that which is without an object arises from a previous consciousness,

original: dper na smig rgyu la chur rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la chur rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: like the idea of water in a mirage.

original: rten dang brten ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: The idea of the supported and the support is also without an object.

original: ma grub pa'i lan bshad zin pa nyid lhag @94b ma brjod pa'i don dran par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i lan bshad zin pa nyid lhag @94b ma brjod pa'i don dran par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the expression “recalling the point of the explanation of the nonestablishment of the reason” is as follows.

original: gzhan gyi lan lhag ma brjod pa ni dngos po du ma nyid las shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan lhag ma brjod pa ni dngos po du ma nyid las shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder of the opponent’s explanation is “because of the multiplicity of things.”

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i 'bras bu nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i 'bras bu nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not seen to be the effect of a previous consciousness.

original: snga ma phyi mar skye ba can phyin ci log gi shes pa can 'di ni /
analyzed: snga ma phyi mar skye ba can phyin ci log gi shes pa can 'di ni /
translated: This consciousness that arises later from a previous one, which is erroneous,

original: 'di las gcig tu rtogs pa 'di skyes so zhes bya ba ni rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di las gcig tu rtogs pa 'di skyes so zhes bya ba ni rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: cannot be known as “this arises from that.”

original: des ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gnyis ka mthong ba de nyid las gcig pa nyid kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gnyis ka mthong ba de nyid las gcig pa nyid kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of identity is due to the perception of both the prior and subsequent entities.

original: mthong ba spangs nas ma mthong ba bzod pa ni bzod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba spangs nas ma mthong ba bzod pa ni bzod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement, “Acceptance is the forbearance of the nonperception of the object after the perception of the object has been abandoned” is this.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: smig rgyu la chur rtog pa yang smig rgyu tsam gyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur rtog pa yang smig rgyu tsam gyi rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: The conception of water in a mirage is the consequence of the mere mirage,

original: de tsam mthong ba'i phyir dang chu mthong ba na gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam mthong ba'i phyir dang chu mthong ba na gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees only that much, and because one does not see water when one sees the mirage.

original: 'on te smig rgyu rtog pa nyid 'thad kyi chur rtog par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te smig rgyu rtog pa nyid 'thad kyi chur rtog par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if the conception of a mirage is tenable, how can the conception of water be tenable?

original: de lta na ni 'o na dngos pos du ma la du mar zhen pa nyid 'thad kyi gcig nyid du ci ltar rtog ces bya ba 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dngos pos du ma la du mar zhen pa nyid 'thad kyi gcig nyid du ci ltar rtog ces bya ba 'di mtshungs so //
translated: If that is so, then the conception of many things as one is tenable, but how can the conception of one thing as many be tenable?

original: de'i phyir rigs gang las grub pa de zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'di'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gzhan las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs gang las grub pa de zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis 'di'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gzhan las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason that the effect is not different from the other is in the manner of “whatever is established from a type.”

original: chur rtog pa chu mthong ba las byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: chur rtog pa chu mthong ba las byung ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the conception of water arises from seeing water,

original: gcig nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang gcig tu mthong pa can du 'gro ba can yin mod /
analyzed: gcig nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang gcig tu mthong pa can du 'gro ba can yin mod /
translated: the conception of unity arises from seeing unity.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan ma yin pa nyid thog tu bab po zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan ma yin pa nyid thog tu bab po zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the nondifference of object is established.

original: 'o na dpe dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na dpe dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The example and the property of the position are similar.

original: dpe la ni brtags bzhin pa nyid sngon du nyams su myong ba yin no snyam na de ni mi 'thad te /
analyzed: dpe la ni brtags bzhin pa nyid sngon du nyams su myong ba yin no snyam na de ni mi 'thad te /
translated: If you think that the example is first experienced as it is imagined, that is not tenable.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no example that is similar to the property of the position in all ways.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ni shes pa snga ma dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig bstan bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa ni shes pa snga ma dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba de tsam zhig bstan bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conception of error is related to prior cognition.

original: sgro btags bzhin pa'i yul gyi don can gyi shes pa snga ma ni don gyi dmigs pa yin no zhe na don med pa can snga ma yang sgro btags bzhin pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yin te /
analyzed: sgro btags bzhin pa'i yul gyi don can gyi shes pa snga ma ni don gyi dmigs pa yin no zhe na don med pa can snga ma yang sgro btags bzhin pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yin te /
translated: But the prior one that does not have an object is also the subjective referent of the superimposed object.

original: 'on kyang dpe la ni snga ma dngos po'i yul can gyi myong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dpe la ni snga ma dngos po'i yul can gyi myong ba yin la /
translated: But in the example, the prior experience has an object,

original: don la ni rnam par rtog pa tsam yin pa ni zhes bya ba 'di khyad par 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: don la ni rnam par rtog pa tsam yin pa ni zhes bya ba 'di khyad par 'dis ci bya /
translated: but in reality it is mere conception. What is the point of this distinction?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang snga ma snga ma ni bag chags 'jog pa tsam la nye bar 'jog pa yin no //🔽de la dpe don nyams su @95a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang snga ma snga ma ni bag chags 'jog pa tsam la nye bar 'jog pa yin no // de la dpe don nyams su @95a * //
translated: In both cases, the prior one is posited as merely depositing a latent imprint.🔽In that example, the experience of the object deposits the seed that generates the conception of that object.

original: myong ba rnam par rtog ba de skyed pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du don med pa'i rnam par rtog pas kyang gal te rigs mthun pa skye ba'i sa bon 'jog mod nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: myong ba rnam par rtog ba de skyed pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du don med pa'i rnam par rtog pas kyang gal te rigs mthun pa skye ba'i sa bon 'jog mod nyes pa ci yod /
translated: In the same way, if a conception that does not have an object deposits the seed of a similar type, what is wrong with that?

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon ni 'jog par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon ni 'jog par mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable that it deposits the seed of a conception of a dissimilar type.

original: don nyams su myong ba las byung ba la ni de yang cha shas kyis yod pa yin no //
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba las byung ba la ni de yang cha shas kyis yod pa yin no //
translated: But when it arises from the experience of the object, it exists partially.🔽And there is no doubt that mere conceptualization produces the latent impressions of mere conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bag chags skyed pa la ni dogs pa yang med do zhes bsams nas des na skye ba gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi bag chags skyed pa la ni dogs pa yang med do zhes bsams nas des na skye ba gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, “even in another birth.”

original: de ltar blo snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul las gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ltung ba'i chos can ni rten las mi ltung ba la brten par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar blo snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul las gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ltung ba'i chos can ni rten las mi ltung ba la brten par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: Thus, because the object of the former and latter cognitions is not the same, the falling thing does not depend on the support, since it is not a falling thing.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: And there is no contradiction with perception.

original: de ltar gcig nyid med par bdag la sogs pa yang med pa'i phyir de'i rnam par rtog pa yang thog ma tha ma med pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar gcig nyid med par bdag la sogs pa yang med pa'i phyir de'i rnam par rtog pa yang thog ma tha ma med pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, because the self and so on do not exist, since they are not the same, the conceptualization of them is also without beginning or end.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, “in the same way.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni spyi la sogs pa sdud pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni spyi la sogs pa sdud pa'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes universals and so on.

original: ji ltar gcig tu 'dzin pa de dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du bdag lus la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig tu 'dzin pa de dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du bdag lus la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Just as the apprehension of unity is without an objective referent, so also is the apprehension of the self, the body, etc.

original: chos tsam de dang ldan pa'i chos can blo la /
analyzed: chos tsam de dang ldan pa'i chos can blo la /
translated: The subject, which is endowed with that mere idea,

original: thog ma 'gog pa ni rgyun thog ma med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma 'gog pa ni rgyun thog ma med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cessation of the beginning is called the beginninglessness of the continuum.

original: phyis kyang mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan skye bas tha ma 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan skye bas tha ma 'gog pa'o //
translated: The non-cessation of the end is called the non-cessation of the end, because of the arising of one thing after another.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod kyang skabs su bab pa la ni ma yin no zhes ston pas sngar dris pa'i rnam 'grel nyid bshad pa'i don du yi ge 'dri ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yod kyang skabs su bab pa la ni ma yin no zhes ston pas sngar dris pa'i rnam 'grel nyid bshad pa'i don du yi ge 'dri ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although in some cases there is a relation of support and supported, it is not in the present case. In order to demonstrate this, the author writes the following verse, which is a commentary on the question asked earlier.

original: de ltar yon tan la sogs pa la rten med mod ;
analyzed: de ltar yon tan la sogs pa la rten med mod ;
translated: Thus, although there is no support for the qualities, etc.,

original: sems ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ci ltar rten med pa yin zhe na sems pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ci ltar rten med pa yin zhe na sems pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: how is it that the mind is without a support, since it is the opposite of those? The mind is said to be that which thinks.

original: lus ni sems so zhes bya ba spyi dang / lus kyi yon tan ni blo zhes brjod pa'i phyir yon tan dang / yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las yin nam /
analyzed: lus ni sems so zhes bya ba spyi dang / lus kyi yon tan ni blo zhes brjod pa'i phyir yon tan dang / yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las yin nam /
translated: The body is the mind, in general; it is the quality of the body, because the qualities of the body are called the mind; it is the action, because it has the nature of the realization of objects.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba khyad par te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba khyad par te /
translated: The word “also” is a qualifier.

original: sems yin gyi sems ma yin pa ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems yin gyi sems ma yin pa ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mind, not the non-mind, because it is the cause of the cognition of the difference, “This is the mind, not the non-mind.”

original: yang na nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na nges pa med pa ste /
translated: Or, it is not definite.

original: sems pa ni de lta bu nyid gzhan du yang brtag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa ni de lta bu nyid gzhan du yang brtag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not to be considered otherwise, i.e., as the non-mind.

original: des na de las bzlog pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir rnam pa gcig @95b tu ltung ba'i dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de las bzlog pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir rnam pa gcig @95b tu ltung ba'i dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the opposite of that, and thus there is no danger of its falling into one extreme.

original: 'du ba'i sgo nas lan thebs par bsams nas gzhan rtsod par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du ba'i sgo nas lan thebs par bsams nas gzhan rtsod par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that the question is to be answered by way of the collection, another raises the question, “If you say that the mind is the body, then the mind is not one, because the body is not one.”

original: don ni 'di yin te gang zhig gang du 'du ba de ni de med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gang zhig gang du 'du ba de ni de med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The meaning is this: That which is collected in something does not occur without that something.

original: dper na 'du ba can gyi rgyu med na de dang 'dus pa'i yon tan med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'du ba can gyi rgyu med na de dang 'dus pa'i yon tan med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, if there is no cause of collection, there is no quality of being collected.

original: sems kyang lus la 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyang lus la 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the mind is collected in the body.

original: sun 'byin pa'i 'gro ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i 'gro ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The going, etc., of the refutation are the “etc.”

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin yang 'du bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin yang 'du bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is collection even though there is no relation of support and supported,

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Even though there is a relation of support and supported.”

original: 'di ga las snyam na gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba las te /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba las te /
translated: Where is this? “For another reason.”

original: gang gi phyir ma grub pa la sogs pa brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma grub pa la sogs pa brjod la /
translated: Because the unestablished, etc., are mentioned.

original: brjod pa de'i phyir na rten dang brten pa med par 'du ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa de'i phyir na rten dang brten pa med par 'du ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the mention of that, there is no collection without a relation of support and supported.

original: 'du ba med pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'du ba med pa 'di nyid do //
translated: This is the absence of collection.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po bsal ba 'dis ni gal te rten dang brten pa'i dngos po bsal bas 'du ba la sogs pa rnams bsal bar gyur mod /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po bsal ba 'dis ni gal te rten dang brten pa'i dngos po bsal bas 'du ba la sogs pa rnams bsal bar gyur mod /
translated: By this refutation of the relation of support and supported, if collection, etc., are refuted,

original: de bzlog pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de bzlog pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that avoided?

original: rten med phyir na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rten med phyir na zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “because there is no basis.”

original: bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis mi 'thad snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis mi 'thad snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable in the manner already explained.

original: 'dis ni gang zhig gang du 'du ba de zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zhig gang du 'du ba de zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason, “whatever is an assembly of those,” is not established.🔽The explanation of the Pramānﬁ avārtika has not yet been completed.

original: rnam 'grel gyi bshad pa ma byas par re zhig ma byas pa nyid brjod pa ni rigs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi bshad pa ma byas par re zhig ma byas pa nyid brjod pa ni rigs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, “The reason is not established,” is the opponent’s position.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The statement, “If . . . ,” is the opponent’s position.

original: de ni mi rtag par 'gyur ba gang zhig gang du 'du ba zhes khyad par du byed pa'i ma nges pa nyid ma yin no snyam pa'i /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag par 'gyur ba gang zhig gang du 'du ba zhes khyad par du byed pa'i ma nges pa nyid ma yin no snyam pa'i /
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that the reason, “whatever is an assembly of those,” is not established.

original: sems kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: sems kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The statement, “The mind . . . ,” is the response.

original: rgyu gzhan gyi sngar gyi sems gang yin pa de nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyi sngar gyi sems gang yin pa de nyid dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mind that is the previous cause is related to it.

original: dper na 'du ba nyid yin pa rtag pa'i phyir rten med kyang med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu gzhan dang rjes su 'brel ba yang rgyu ma yin pa zhig kyang rgyun chad pa ma yin pas khyad par med do //
analyzed: dper na 'du ba nyid yin pa rtag pa'i phyir rten med kyang med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu gzhan dang rjes su 'brel ba yang rgyu ma yin pa zhig kyang rgyun chad pa ma yin pas khyad par med do //
translated: For example, just as a collection is not nonexistent because it is permanent and without a basis, in the same way, a continuum is not severed because it is not a cause even though it is related to other causes.

original: des na ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not definite.

original: 'on te rgyu tsam med pas rgyun chad par ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rten pas so snyam na rten dang brten pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu tsam med pas rgyun chad par ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rten pas so snyam na rten dang brten pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: But if you think that a continuum is not said to be severed because of the mere absence of a cause, but rather because of a basis, then the root text states, “The basis and the based . . .”

original: rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been extensively refuted.

original: ni'i sgra ni ma nges pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni ma nges pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The word “even” in the verse completes the discussion of the indefinite.

original: rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel 'chad pa'o //
translated: The commentary on the root text states, “The basis and the based . . .”

original: 'dis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba spangs pa yin la zhes @96a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba spangs pa yin la zhes @96a * //
translated: This is connected to the phrase “the avoidance of the contact of the collection.”

original: sbyar ro // rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nyid bsal ba ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: sbyar ro // rten dang brten pa'i dngos po nyid bsal ba ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is the nature of the basis and the based refuted?

original: spangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spangs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, “Because of the avoidance . . .”

original: 'di ni rten med phyir zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten med phyir zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: This is a commentary on the phrase “because it is without a basis.”

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'dod pa de kho na nyid du rgyu'am rgyu ma yin pa nyid gcig yin de las phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba des na 'du ba
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'dod pa de kho na nyid du rgyu'am rgyu ma yin pa nyid gcig yin de las phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba des na 'du ba
translated: The cause of that which is suitable to meet is called the cause of that which meets. In reality, it is either a cause or not a cause.

original: med pa'i phyir 'du ba can gyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir 'du ba can gyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: With regard to the first position, he says, “If it is a cause of that which meets, then it is not suitable to meet.” The thought is: since it does not meet, how could it be the cause of that which meets?

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //🔽khyab par byed pa rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir ci ltar khyab par bya ba'i gdung bar bya ba can gyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o // khyab par byed pa rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir ci ltar khyab par bya ba'i gdung bar bya ba can gyi rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba dag ste /
translated: With regard to the second position, he says, “If it is a cause of that which meets, then it is not suitable to be a cause of that which meets.”🔽Since it is not a cause that pervades, how could it be the cause of that which is pervaded?

original: rigs la sogs pa gang gi don rgyu ma yin pa de la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa gang gi don rgyu ma yin pa de la brjod pa ni /
translated: With regard to the meaning of the reason, etc., he says, “If the reason, etc., are not causes, then it is not tenable that they are the cause of that which meets.”

original: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason, etc., are the reason, etc., of that which meets.

original: rang gi rten 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin yang dngos po'i chos nyid du rnam par gnas par brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rten 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin yang dngos po'i chos nyid du rnam par gnas par brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Even though the basis of those, the self, is not the cause of that which meets, it is said to be the intrinsic nature of things.

original: rigs ni tshig gi don gsum pa yod pa dang / rdul phra rab tshad chung ngu dang / bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa tshad chen po dang / rtag pa'i rdzas rnams la yod pa'i khyad par dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: rigs ni tshig gi don gsum pa yod pa dang / rdul phra rab tshad chung ngu dang / bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa tshad chen po dang / rtag pa'i rdzas rnams la yod pa'i khyad par dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo ste /
translated: and the special qualities of permanent substances, as in the case of the power of God.

original: de dag kyang spangs pa yin te de dag gi rnam par gnas pa dngos po'i chos nyid kyis med par dogs pa rten gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag kyang spangs pa yin te de dag gi rnam par gnas pa dngos po'i chos nyid kyis med par dogs pa rten gzhan med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But these are also rejected, for how can they exist without support, since their existence is impossible by the nature of things?

original: gal te brjod na zhes 'don par ni /
analyzed: gal te brjod na zhes 'don par ni /
translated: If one says “if it is expressed,”

original: gal te de ltar brjod na tshul 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar brjod na tshul 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: then it should be applied in this way.

original: skabs dang sbyar ba'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs dang sbyar ba'i tshig 'di'i bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other explanation of the words “if it is expressed” is given in the words “alternatively.”

original: rten de nyid de'i 'dus pa spangs pa ni ba kag pa ste /
analyzed: rten de nyid de'i 'dus pa spangs pa ni ba kag pa ste /
translated: The rejection of that very support as its collection is the absence of that.

original: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “absence” is non-existence.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni rigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni rigs ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the words “nature” and so on.

original: 'dir sogs pa smos pa'i bshad pa ni yal bar dor ba yin no sems ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sogs pa smos pa'i bshad pa ni yal bar dor ba yin no sems ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no snyam na ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the mind is not like that, you are wrong.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyi sgras ni snga na med pa'i gsal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyi sgras ni snga na med pa'i gsal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “other” in “another manifestation” is intended to refer to a manifestation that did not exist previously.

original: skye ba bzhin ba'i gsal ba rnams la yang sngar nyid nas 'du ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba bzhin ba'i gsal ba rnams la yang sngar nyid nas 'du ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And manifestations that are produced do not exist previously as a collection.

original: 'on te thams cad thams cad du song ba'i phyogs la gnas na sngar yod pa yin na yod mong gong bu de dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad thams cad du song ba'i phyogs la gnas na sngar yod pa yin na yod mong gong bu de dang 'brel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you maintain that it is in a place that is pervaded by everything, then it is already existent, and it does not come into contact with that collection.

original: skad cig ma dang po la ni yon tan la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pa'i rdzas nyid skye bo zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la ni yon tan la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pa'i rdzas nyid skye bo zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is an established tenet that the substance itself, which is devoid of qualities, etc., is produced in the first moment.

original: de bas na ji ltar spyi gsal ba snga ma @96b zhig pa na /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar spyi gsal ba snga ma @96b zhig pa na /
translated: Therefore, how can a universal be destroyed when a manifestation is destroyed?

original: rjes su ma song ba gsal ba gsal ba gzhan pa la rjes su 'gro ba de bzhin du sems kyang lus gzhan la yin no //
analyzed: rjes su ma song ba gsal ba gsal ba gzhan pa la rjes su 'gro ba de bzhin du sems kyang lus gzhan la yin no //
translated: Just as the clarity of one thing does not follow another, so also the mind does not follow another body.

original: 'on te spyi ni yod pa nyid rten gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te spyi ni yod pa nyid rten gzhan la rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Or, if you say that a universal does exist and that it follows another substratum,

original: sems ni tha dad pa kho na skye ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni tha dad pa kho na skye ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then the mind is born as something different.

original: ma 'brel ba las 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba las 'brel pa'i rang bzhin mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it is not tenable that a nature that is not related to something else is related to it.

original: spyi yang gcig nyid du sgro btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: spyi yang gcig nyid du sgro btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: And a universal is just an imputation as one.

original: sgro btags nas ni sems de nyid 'pho ba yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sgro btags nas ni sems de nyid 'pho ba yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: And it is not contradictory to say that the mind itself is transferred after it is imputed.

original: des na gzhan ni sgrub par byed pa ni da dung yang ma nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan ni sgrub par byed pa ni da dung yang ma nges pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the proof of another is still indefinite.

original: yang gal te tshu rol mdzes pa la spyi dang 'du ba la sogs pa'i tshul lugs med pa de lta na yang brgya la 'di ltar khas len du 'ong bas na bkod pas yin no //
analyzed: yang gal te tshu rol mdzes pa la spyi dang 'du ba la sogs pa'i tshul lugs med pa de lta na yang brgya la 'di ltar khas len du 'ong bas na bkod pas yin no //
translated: But even if the theory of universal and conjunction and so on is not beautiful in the present, it is set forth because it might be accepted in this way.

original: gal te de ltar khas len na spyi bzhin du rten gzhan la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin na de kho na ni spyi zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar khas len na spyi bzhin du rten gzhan la rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin na de kho na ni spyi zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: But since that which is called a universal does not exist,

original: rten gcig med na blo gzhan la mtshams sbyor ba la dpe ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rten gcig med na blo gzhan la mtshams sbyor ba la dpe ci yod ce na /
translated: what is the example of a connection to another mind when there is no single support?

original: lus gcig med kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus gcig med kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, “Even if there is no single body.”

original: gal te rnam pa dang don bya ba la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nye ba 'ga' zhig gis gzhan la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'i blor 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dang don bya ba la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nye ba 'ga' zhig gis gzhan la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba'i blor 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the cognition of an ox, for example, in another is due to some similarity that is the same in aspect and function,

original: mi'i lus spangs na dud 'gro la sogs pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i dus na ni nye ba ci 'dra ba zhig yod /
analyzed: mi'i lus spangs na dud 'gro la sogs pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i dus na ni nye ba ci 'dra ba zhig yod /
translated: then what kind of similarity is there when one abandons the body of a human and fully takes up the body of an animal and so on?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar blo snga ma las rjes su 'gro ba'i blo gzhan kho na skye ba de bzhin du lus gzhan la yang kho na skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar blo snga ma las rjes su 'gro ba'i blo gzhan kho na skye ba de bzhin du lus gzhan la yang kho na skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the assertion of others is just as you have stated.

original: des na 'phro bar 'du bar ma yin no snyam na 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: des na 'phro bar 'du bar ma yin no snyam na 'di la brjod pa /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: re zhig lus gzhan rnam pa la sogs pa mi 'dra yang rgyun de la las 'jig pa nyid nye bar yin no //
analyzed: re zhig lus gzhan rnam pa la sogs pa mi 'dra yang rgyun de la las 'jig pa nyid nye bar yin no //
translated: Even though the bodies are different, the continuum is the same.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ni 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa 'dod pa kho na'o //🔽'phro bar smra ba ni rgyun gcig pas gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa ni 'chi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa 'dod pa kho na'o // 'phro bar smra ba ni rgyun gcig pas gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their characteristics is accepted, such as the existence of death and birth.🔽The assertion of a continuum is due to the attachment to a single entity because of a single continuum.

original: rgyun gcig pa nyid kyang nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gcig pa nyid kyang nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The single continuum is due to the persistence of the appropriated aggregates.

original: de yang sngon gyi 'du byed rjes su 'jug pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sngon gyi 'du byed rjes su 'jug pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That persistence is due to the establishment of the prior formative forces.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i blo skye ba ni zhes bya bar ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir sngon nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba la sogs pa'i myong bas gzhan pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa la de nyid 'di yin no snyam du rjes su 'gro ba'i @97a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i blo skye ba ni zhes bya bar ro // de nyid kyi phyir sngon nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba la sogs pa'i myong bas gzhan pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa la de nyid 'di yin no snyam du rjes su 'gro ba'i @97a * //
translated: The statement “the cognition of that sort arises” is the same as “the cognition of that sort arises.”

original: blo dpe nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: blo dpe nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the example of the cognition that occurs in regard to the object of prior experience, etc., is stated in the example of the cognition that occurs in regard to the object of prior experience, etc., is stated in the passage “that is, in regard to the object of prior experience, etc.,🔽the cognition that occurs in the form ‘this is that.’”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtan  sun 'byin pa mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtan  sun 'byin pa mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase “for this reason” concludes the refutation of the argument.

original: mang du smras pas ci dogs te /
analyzed: mang du smras pas ci dogs te /
translated: What need is there to say much?

original: re zhig 'jig pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de gzhan la ltos pa'am mi ltos pa yin /🔽phyogs dang po la ni dngos po de la gnas pa'i rgyu den med de /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de gzhan la ltos pa'am mi ltos pa yin / phyogs dang po la ni dngos po de la gnas pa'i rgyu den med de /
translated: First, whatever is a thing that is destroyed either depends on another or does not depend on another.

original: 'jig par byed pa mi gnas pa ni rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa mi gnas pa ni rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the first case, there is no cause for the endurance of that thing, because that which causes destruction does not endure, since it is itself destroyed.

original: gnyis pa la yang nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: In the second case, it is also not possible.

original: rnams zhes bya ba ni gsal ba brjod par 'dod pas mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: rnams zhes bya ba ni gsal ba brjod par 'dod pas mang po'i tshig go //
translated: The word “them” is a plural term, because the desire to speak of many things is clear.

original: gal te rang nga ma gzhan las rten gyis 'jig pa'i gnas byed na de'i tshe gang skye ba can yin pa de thams cad rten gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang nga ma gzhan las rten gyis 'jig pa'i gnas byed na de'i tshe gang skye ba can yin pa de thams cad rten gnas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: If the abiding were to cause the abiding of the self, then everything that is produced would abide, because of the presence of the abiding.

original: lhag ma ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: gzhan yang gnas par bya ba rang nyid 'jig pa'am mi 'jig pa zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas par bya ba rang nyid 'jig pa'am mi 'jig pa zhig yin /
translated: Moreover, the object of abiding either perishes or does not perish by itself.

original: 'dir yang rim ba bzhin mi nus pa dang / mi dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang rim ba bzhin mi nus pa dang / mi dgos pa nyid do //
translated: Here, too, the two faults are respectively the impossibility and the uselessness.

original: sngar ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'jig pa'i phyogs nyid la rnam par pa rtags nas skyon gnyis bskal pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: sngar ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'jig pa'i phyogs nyid la rnam par pa rtags nas skyon gnyis bskal pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Previously, the two faults were stated in the context of the opponent's thesis of destruction. This is the difference.

original: bsdu ba ni lhag dang bcas par brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: bsdu ba ni lhag dang bcas par brjod par 'dod do //
translated: The summary is stated with the remainder.

original: brjod pa dang don gyis 'phangs pa sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa dang don gyis 'phangs pa sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The summary verses are the collection of the expressed and the implied.

original: don dam par ni yul la gnas pa yul dang phrad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni yul la gnas pa yul dang phrad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In reality, the mind does not abide in the object, nor does it contact the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the mind.

original: de'i ni yul gyi'o ;
analyzed: de'i ni yul gyi'o ;
translated: It is the object of that.

original: / mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba nyid sems dpa' yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba nyid sems dpa' yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that connects is the sentient being.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang yul dang phrad pa'i rnam pa tsam las gzhan ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang yul dang phrad pa'i rnam pa tsam las gzhan ni med do zhe na /
translated: If you think that even without conceptualization, there is nothing other than the mere aspect of contact with the object,

original: bden te rnam par rtog ba med pa la ni phrad par rnam par gzhag pa rjes su mthun pa yin te ;
analyzed: bden te rnam par rtog ba med pa la ni phrad par rnam par gzhag pa rjes su mthun pa yin te ;
translated: it is true that in the absence of conceptualization, the presentation of contact is appropriate,

original: yul der gsal ba'i rnam par myong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul der gsal ba'i rnam par myong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the experience of clarity in that object.

original: rnam par rtog pa la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that in conceptualization,

original: yul dang rnam pa dag gi chas rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang rnam pa dag gi chas rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in the aspect of the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par ni zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par ni zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be ultimately.

original: sgron ma de nyams pa dang / 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: sgron ma de nyams pa dang / 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa ste /
translated: It is the nature of the lamp to have the characteristics of decline and increase.

original: de dag gi dngos po gang dag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po gang dag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the entities of those two.

original: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba 'do dang sgron ma dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba 'do dang sgron ma dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The appropriator and that which arises from the appropriator are the entities of the support and the supported.

original: ci ltar de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid 'di nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid skyon med pa yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ltar de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid 'di nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid skyon med pa yin pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: How is that? The faultless characteristic of the appropriator is just that. That has already been explained.

original: yang bzlas @97b pa ni khyad par brjed pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: yang bzlas @97b pa ni khyad par brjed pa'i don du yin no //
translated: The repetition is for the purpose of remembering the distinction.

original: gal te blo 'ga' dang yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te blo 'ga' dang yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
translated: If the mind is not the entity of the support and the supported,

original: de ste lus kho na dang ma yin snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: de ste lus kho na dang ma yin snyam du dogs na /
translated: then it is not the body.

original: blo la brten pa nyid nges par bya ba'i don du 'ol spyi tsam brjod pa na /
analyzed: blo la brten pa nyid nges par bya ba'i don du 'ol spyi tsam brjod pa na /
translated: In order to ascertain that the mind is the support, a mere general statement is made.

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, the mind is the support.

original: blo dang shes rab la sogs pa nyid rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: blo dang shes rab la sogs pa nyid rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The mind, wisdom, and so on are the entities of the support and the supported.

original: rtogs pas na blo la goms pa'i bdag nyid can sngar byung ba'i shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i khyad par rnams brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pas na blo la goms pa'i bdag nyid can sngar byung ba'i shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i khyad par rnams brten pa yin no //
translated: The special realizations of wisdom, love, etc., which have arisen previously and which are of the nature of mental cultivation, are the support.

original: 'di ga las snyam pa las /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam pa las /
translated: From what is this known?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “because of the increase and decrease of the mental operations.”

original: blo'i byed pa ni goms pa yin la de'i khyad par ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: blo'i byed pa ni goms pa yin la de'i khyad par ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The mental operations are the cultivations, and their increase and decrease are characterized by growth and decline.

original: des ni shes rab la sogs pa phul byung dang / 'grib pa dag tu 'ang 'gyur pa yin te gnyi ga ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
analyzed: des ni shes rab la sogs pa phul byung dang / 'grib pa dag tu 'ang 'gyur pa yin te gnyi ga ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
translated: Therefore, wisdom, etc., are sometimes excellent and sometimes not, and not only are they not always so.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ste /
translated: “ This” refers to the mental operations that do not follow increase and decrease,

original: lus dang sems la sogs pa'i lta bu'o ;
analyzed: lus dang sems la sogs pa'i lta bu'o ;
translated: like the body, mind, etc.

original: / mar me'i 'od la sogs pa gang dag yin pa nor bu'i 'od la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / mar me'i 'od la sogs pa gang dag yin pa nor bu'i 'od la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “ Like the light of a lamp, etc.” refers to the light of a jewel, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ces brten pa nyid ni rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed pas khyab pa la de med pa'i phyir na lus dang / shes rab la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ces brten pa nyid ni rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su byed pas khyab pa la de med pa'i phyir na lus dang / shes rab la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the support is pervaded by the fact that it follows the increase and decrease of the supported, but that the body and wisdom, etc. are not.

original: gal te lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba mthong ba kho na yin nam /
analyzed: gal te lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba mthong ba kho na yin nam /
translated: If it is seen that there is a difference even from the increase and decrease of the body,

original: de ci ltar lus rten ma yin na /
analyzed: de ci ltar lus rten ma yin na /
translated: how is it that the body is not the support?

original: de las kyang zhes gsungs pa ste lus las so //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes gsungs pa ste lus las so //
translated: The word even means from the body.

original: blo snga ma nyid ces bya ba ni goms pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: blo snga ma nyid ces bya ba ni goms pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The word former refers to the one that is the nature of cultivation.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi'o ;
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang brtse ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi'o ;
translated: The word mind refers to the one that is the nature of wisdom, compassion, etc.

original: / des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir blo lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pa /
analyzed: / des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir blo lus 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su mi byed pa /
translated: Therefore, because the mind does not follow the increase and decrease of the body,

original: des na mar me'i 'od ni dpe ma yin te /
analyzed: des na mar me'i 'od ni dpe ma yin te /
translated: the light of a lamp is not a suitable example,

original: sgron ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grub pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgron ma'i 'phel ba dang 'grub pa'i rjes su mi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the increase and decrease of the lamp is not not followed.

original: des na dper na sgron ma'i 'od sgron ma zhig na 'jig pa bzhin no zhes ci ste brjod //
analyzed: des na dper na sgron ma'i 'od sgron ma zhig na 'jig pa bzhin no zhes ci ste brjod //
translated: Why do you say that, for example, the light of a lamp is destroyed when the lamp is destroyed?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent’s response

original: gal te blo ni blo'i byed pa'i khyad par nyid kyis byas mod de lta na lus la ni brten pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te blo ni blo'i byed pa'i khyad par nyid kyis byas mod de lta na lus la ni brten pa kho na ste /
translated: If you say that the mind is produced by the special activity of the mind itself, then the body is also supported.

original: dper na mar me rnam par 'gyur pa med kyang /🔽mar ma dang nye bar gnas ba tsam du gyur pa'i sbrul la sogs pa dag gis mar me'i 'od rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin yang mar me @98a * //
analyzed: dper na mar me rnam par 'gyur pa med kyang / mar ma dang nye bar gnas ba tsam du gyur pa'i sbrul la sogs pa dag gis mar me'i 'od rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin yang mar me @98a * //
translated: For example, a lamp does not change,

original: la brten pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: la brten pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but the light of the lamp is not supported by the lamp, even though it is merely present near the lamp, because the light of the lamp does not change when the lamp is moved or destroyed by snakes, mice, and so on.

original: des na rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med kyang rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang bcas pa mthong ba'i phyir ci ltar na brten pa la de'i rjes su 'brangs par khyab ce na /
analyzed: des na rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med kyang rten 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang bcas pa mthong ba'i phyir ci ltar na brten pa la de'i rjes su 'brangs par khyab ce na /
translated: Therefore, even though the support does not increase or decrease, since the supported is seen to increase and decrease, how can the supported be pervaded by the support?

original: grub pa'i mtha' ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a tenet.

original: mar me nyid rnam par 'gyur gyi lus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me nyid rnam par 'gyur gyi lus ni ma yin no //
translated: The lamp changes, but the body does not.

original: sbrul la sogs pa nye bar byas pa de ni'o //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa nye bar byas pa de ni'o //
translated: The snake, etc., is the proximate cause.

original: dpal zhan pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ma dangs chung ba'o //
analyzed: dpal zhan pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ma dangs chung ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of being weak is the smallness of the light.

original: mar khu la sogs pa rang gi tshogs pa las mar me'i ma dangs gsal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang sbrul la sogs pa nye ba tsam gyis chung bar 'gyur bar mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mar khu la sogs pa rang gi tshogs pa las mar me'i ma dangs gsal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang sbrul la sogs pa nye ba tsam gyis chung bar 'gyur bar mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Even though the light of the lamp has the aspect of clarity, it is seen to become small merely through the proximity of the snake, etc.

original: 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is meant here?

original: sbrul la sogs pa nye bas kyang mar me'i tshogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa nye bas kyang mar me'i tshogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the transformation of the collection of the lamp through the proximity of the snake, etc., is not perceived,

original: ci ltar mar me'i rnam par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mar me'i rnam par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: it is only to be said that the light is transformed.

original: 'di la yang brjod pa ni gal te tshogs ba de'i rnam par 'gyur pa mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin pa de lta na sgron ma 'gyur bar mthong ba las de rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod pa ni gal te tshogs ba de'i rnam par 'gyur pa mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin pa de lta na sgron ma 'gyur bar mthong ba las de rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: Here, too, it is said: If the transformation of that collection is not ascertained by perception, then what is the contradiction in inferring it from the seeing of the transformation of the lamp?

original: rgyu rnam par ma 'gyur bar ni 'bras bu rnam par 'gyur ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam par ma 'gyur bar ni 'bras bu rnam par 'gyur ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the transformation of the effect is not seen without the transformation of the cause.

original: skabs su bab pa rnam par 'gyur ba can gyi 'od skyed par byed pa mar me'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma 'khrul ba'i mngon sum gyis nges par bzung pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa rnam par 'gyur ba can gyi 'od skyed par byed pa mar me'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma 'khrul ba'i mngon sum gyis nges par bzung pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of the flame of a lamp, which is the present example, is ascertained by nonerroneous perception.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni mar me'i rnam par 'gyur ba dbal zhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mar me'i rnam par 'gyur ba dbal zhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: “ Therefore” means because the transformation of the flame of a lamp has the characteristic of a weak light.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: “ In another way” means in a way that is not clear.

original: gal te lus rnam par 'gyur bas kyang sems rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lus rnam par 'gyur bas kyang sems rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is transformed by the transformation of the body,

original: des na mar me'i 'od dper mi 'gal lo snyam na /
analyzed: des na mar me'i 'od dper mi 'gal lo snyam na /
translated: then it is not contradictory to use the light of a lamp as an example.

original: blo'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blo'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ The mind” is stated.

original: dper na mar me'i 'od rnam par 'gyur ba'i dus na rgyu rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas sprul la sogs pas mar me'i rnam par 'gyur bar byas par mthong pa de bzhin du blo'i byed pa goms pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i blo de dag tha dad pa de'i dus na ni lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba med do //
analyzed: dper na mar me'i 'od rnam par 'gyur ba'i dus na rgyu rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas sprul la sogs pas mar me'i rnam par 'gyur bar byas par mthong pa de bzhin du blo'i byed pa goms pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i blo de dag tha dad pa de'i dus na ni lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba med do //
translated: For example, when the light of a lamp is changing, one sees that the lamp is changed by the change of its cause, by the change of the wick, etc. In the same way, when the characteristics of the mind’s activity are cultivated, and when the mind, such as wisdom, etc., is different, one does not see a change in the body.

original: des na mar me'i 'od dper ci ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽de las kyang 'di zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na mar me'i 'od dper ci ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o // de las kyang 'di zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir gal te zhes smos so //
translated: So what is the example of the light of the lamp?🔽In order to explain this, he says, “If you say that the body is the cause of the mind’s change, etc.”

original: des na lus zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ltar yang don gcig kho na'o snyam du @98b bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na lus zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ltar yang don gcig kho na'o snyam du @98b bsams pa'o //
translated: So he thinks that the word “body” has the same meaning in both cases.

original: 'di ltar gzhan tsam ni rten du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan tsam ni rten du mi 'dod de /
translated: But he does not accept mere otherness as a basis,

original: gzhi'i lus gcig zhig na lus gzhan gyi gzhi dang 'grel pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi'i lus gcig zhig na lus gzhan gyi gzhi dang 'grel pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not contradictory for another body to be the basis of the same commentary when one body is destroyed.

original: chos can gyi dngos por brtags pa tsam ni rten nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gyi dngos por brtags pa tsam ni rten nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The mere designation of a thing as a subject is not accepted as a basis,

original: lus las tha dad pa'i blo'i spyod yul yin pas blo ni chos tsam gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus las tha dad pa'i blo'i spyod yul yin pas blo ni chos tsam gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is the domain of a cognition that is different from the body, and because the mind is empty of mere phenomena.

original: des na nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid la rten du 'dod pas na don tha mi dad do //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid la rten du 'dod pas na don tha mi dad do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is not different, since the mind is accepted as the basis of the cause of appropriation.

original: shes rab la sogs pa der yang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa der yang ngo //
translated: It is also the cause of wisdom and so on.

original: sems la phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems la phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the body’s transformation through its beneficial influence on the mind.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las she na gang du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las she na gang du zhes gsungs so //
translated: Where is this taught?

original: bcud kyis len la sogs pa'i rgyus lus rgyas pas so //
analyzed: bcud kyis len la sogs pa'i rgyus lus rgyas pas so //
translated: It is taught in the statement, “wherever there is the growth of the body through the cause of elixirs and so on.”

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni thams cad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni thams cad ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Some” means not all.

original: 'ga' zhig du zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang bzo la sogs pa 'ga' zhig du yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig du zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang bzo la sogs pa 'ga' zhig du yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Some” means in some treatises, crafts, and so on, but not in all.

original: 'di yang ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ci ltar yin te /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang gi phyir bcud kyis len la sogs pa zos pa las bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa nyid skye ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcud kyis len la sogs pa zos pa las bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa nyid skye ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the knowledge of treatises and so on arises from eating elixirs and so on,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, “That is not so.”

original: gal te ci ltar 'dus byas pa la sogs par 'gyur ba sad pa las shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin gyis /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar 'dus byas pa la sogs par 'gyur ba sad pa las shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin gyis /
translated: If it were not so, then just as the knowledge of treatises and so on arises from eating elixirs and so on, the difference in wisdom and so on would arise from sleep.

original: 'on kyang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa kho na skye ba yin no /
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa kho na skye ba yin no /
translated: But the knowledge of treatises and so on arises only anew.

original: de'i tshe bcud kyis len zos par 'dra ba'i phyir skyes bu thams cad bstan bcos dang bzo la sogs pa thams cad la shes rab mtshungs par thal lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcud kyis len zos par 'dra ba'i phyir skyes bu thams cad bstan bcos dang bzo la sogs pa thams cad la shes rab mtshungs par thal lo //
translated: In that case, it follows that all persons would have equal wisdom in all treatises and crafts and so on because they are similar in having eaten elixirs and so on.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: des na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par ni 'dus byas pas ji ltar gyur pa sad pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: des na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par ni 'dus byas pas ji ltar gyur pa sad pa nyid las yin no //
translated: Therefore the difference in wisdom and so on is due to the transformation of the conditioned, that is, sleep.

original: des na sems las phan gdags pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems las phan gdags pa nyid kyi sgo nas lus rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body is transformed by the benefit that is done to the mind.

original: 'di nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug par byas nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug par byas nas ston pa ni /
translated: Having made this the ultimate distinction, he teaches

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, etc.

original: de log ces bya ba ni bkres pa log pa na'o //
analyzed: de log ces bya ba ni bkres pa log pa na'o //
translated: When that is removed, when hunger is removed.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bkres pas gnod par gyur ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bkres pas gnod par gyur ba'i'o //
translated: That, the one previously harmed by hunger.

original: 'di ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one doubts this, why is it so?

original: bshad ma thag pa'i thal ba nyid brjod pa ni bcud kyis len dang / des byas pa'i 'brangs pa yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i thal ba nyid brjod pa ni bcud kyis len dang / des byas pa'i 'brangs pa yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence just mentioned is stated again because the elixir and its effect are similar.

original: gal te bstan bcos la sogs pa goms pa ji lta ba bzhin dran par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi 'on kyang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa nyid 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la sogs pa goms pa ji lta ba bzhin dran par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi 'on kyang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa snga na med pa nyid 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If one does not remember the treatise, etc., just as one has become accustomed to it, but rather, the prior cognition of the treatise, etc., does not occur,
then,

original: tshe bcud kyis len de las bstan bcos sam skyes bu thams cad 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
analyzed: tshe bcud kyis len de las bstan bcos sam skyes bu thams cad 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thal ba'o //
translated: The treatise or all persons are explained by that elixir of life. This is the reductio.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad la bshad pa'i nus pa med pa'i gtan tshigs des na nges so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad la bshad pa'i nus pa med pa'i gtan tshigs des na nges so zhes 'brel to //
translated: Since there is no reason for the ability to explain everything, therefore it is certain. This is the connection.

original: ni'i sgra yan chod ni nges pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra yan chod ni nges pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The word “ni” is the form of certainty.

original: ni'i sgra ni gsal ba'i don te nges par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gsal ba'i don te nges par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of clarity. It is definitely clear.

original: 'dis ni 'bad mi dgos par 'jig rten pha rol grub par gyur to zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bad mi dgos par 'jig rten pha rol grub par gyur to zhes ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the establishment of the next world is accomplished without effort.

original: gang zhig la thams cad la skye ba gzhan du goms pa yod pa de ni bcud kyis len la sogs pa zos par khyad par med par shes rab thams cad la 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig la thams cad la skye ba gzhan du goms pa yod pa de ni bcud kyis len la sogs pa zos par khyad par med par shes rab thams cad la 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This shows that for one who has familiarity with everything in another life, there is no difference in the elixir of life and so on, and there is transformation in all wisdom. “ For one who” is stated.
