original: thams cad la goms pa dang ldan pa de'i shes rab ni thams cad la khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad la goms pa dang ldan pa de'i shes rab ni thams cad la khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The wisdom of one who possesses familiarity with everything becomes undifferentiated in everything.

original: 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ol spyi ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ol spyi ston pa'o //
translated: This is the indication of the omniscience which is the desired goal.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin bzlog pa skyon brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin bzlog pa skyon brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the reversal of the previous argument is stated as the fault:🔽Otherwise, if the omniscience of the Buddha were not established by the power of his own mind, then the omniscience of the Buddha would not be established by the power of his own mind.

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba'o thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba'o thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rnam pa ma lus pa rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all things is the knowledge of all aspects of things.

original: skabs su bab pa tsam thams cad rig pa las sngon goms pa nyid nges pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa tsam thams cad rig pa las sngon goms pa nyid nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that the knowledge of just what is relevant is due to previous habituation.

original: des na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par ni lus kyis rgyu can ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: des na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par ni lus kyis rgyu can ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the distinction of wisdom and so on is not due to the body.

original: gal te shes rab la sogs pa'i blo'i khyad par yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: gal te shes rab la sogs pa'i blo'i khyad par yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it said that the distinction of wisdom and so on is due to the mind?”

original: 'di ltar blo ni de dag las tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo ni de dag las tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the mind is distinct from them.

original: de dag lus kyi rgyu can yin pa bkag kyang goms pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo sngon du 'gro ba can du ma grub pa'i phyir sngon gyi nges par byed pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa zhe la bsdogs nas /
analyzed: de dag lus kyi rgyu can yin pa bkag kyang goms pa'i mtshan nyid kyi blo sngon du 'gro ba can du ma grub pa'i phyir sngon gyi nges par byed pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dogs pa zhe la bsdogs nas /
translated: Although it is denied that they are the cause of the body, they are not established as preceded by the cognition of the characteristic of habit, so how can they be the cause of the prior determination?🔽In order to remove this doubt,

original: re zhig shes rab la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir na bshad pa ni mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig shes rab la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir na bshad pa ni mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says: “Perception, etc.”, in order to show that wisdom, etc. are the nature of cognition.

original: 'di ni rtog med kyi shes pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog med kyi shes pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam mo //
translated: This is merely an illustration of non-conceptual cognition.

original: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa mtha' dag ni dran pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa mtha' dag ni dran pa yin te /
translated: All other cognitions are memory,

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they apprehend what has been apprehended.

original: de ldan na phung po gnyis so //
analyzed: de ldan na phung po gnyis so //
translated: When it exists, there are two aggregates.

original: mngon sum dang dran pa gnyis kho na blo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang dran pa gnyis kho na blo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that only perception and memory are cognition.

original: de lta na yang shes rab la sogs pa ci ltar blo'i rang bzhin nyid snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang shes rab la sogs pa ci ltar blo'i rang bzhin nyid snyam na /
translated: Even so, how are wisdom, etc. the nature of cognition?

original: shes rab yid gzhungs la sogs kyi //
analyzed: shes rab yid gzhungs la sogs kyi //
translated: Wisdom, intelligence, etc.

original: dbye ba dran pa rab rtogs las //
analyzed: dbye ba dran pa rab rtogs las //
translated: The divisions are the recollections.🔽🔽

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The divisions of mindfulness are understood from the sutra.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de las gzhan yod pa ma @99b yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de las gzhan yod pa ma @99b yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The mindfulness that is well understood is not different from that.

original: dran pa ni shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa ni shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that mindfulness is just the specific of wisdom, intelligence, etc.

original: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa rnams dran pa'i rang bzhin yin mod /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa rnams dran pa'i rang bzhin yin mod /
translated: If loving kindness, etc. are the nature of mindfulness,

original: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa gnyis go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa gnyis go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: what is the difference between wisdom and intelligence?

original: ci bzhin dran pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci bzhin dran pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that mindfulness is just as it is.

original: shes rab 'chal pa yang shes rab kyi skabs su bstan pa ni de yang goms pa'i rgyu can kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa yang shes rab kyi skabs su bstan pa ni de yang goms pa'i rgyu can kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is said that the lack of wisdom is taught in the section on wisdom, and it is taught that that also has the cause of habituation.

original: 'o na 'di gnyis ji ltar 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di gnyis ji ltar 'thad snyam na /
translated: If that is so, how are these two established?

original: de la zhes gsungs te shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs te shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la'o //
translated: It is said that it is in wisdom and intelligence.

original: dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the divisions?

original: sngon gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is from the past.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed tsam las zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i 'bad pa la mi ltos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed tsam las zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i 'bad pa la mi ltos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From mere previous dispositions means without depending on the effort of the present.

original: 'dis ni skye ba 'di la ma goms pa'i gzhal bya rang nyid dpyod pa ni shes rab yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye ba 'di la ma goms pa'i gzhal bya rang nyid dpyod pa ni shes rab yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the wisdom of the present life is the analysis of the object that is not familiar.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi 'bad pa la sogs pas snga na med pa'i gzhal bya nges pa 'gog pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de rnams rten nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //

original: 'dir yang lus dang chos mthun pa ma yin par brjod pa ni lus ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /

original: nang gi don gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: nang gi don gyi mtshan nyid can no //

original: gzhan gyi rten gyis dngos por brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rten gyis dngos por brjod par bya ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //

original: de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par kho na'i rten du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i khyad par kho na'i rten du 'gyur gyi /

original: bde ba la sogs pa thams cad las ltos nas ni ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa thams cad las ltos nas ni ma yin par 'gyur na /

original: bde ba la sogs pa thams cad la ltos pa kho nas ni 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa thams cad la ltos pa kho nas ni 'dod pa yang yin no //

original: de lta ma yin na lus log na bde ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i phyir blo ldog ba ci ltar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na lus log na bde ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i phyir blo ldog ba ci ltar grub par 'gyur /

original: yang de ltar brten pa nyid ci ste ma grub ce na ;
analyzed: yang de ltar brten pa nyid ci ste ma grub ce na ;

original: de med kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de med kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Even without that,”

original: nang gi don gyi mtshan nyid can bde ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i lus med kyang ngo //
analyzed: nang gi don gyi mtshan nyid can bde ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i lus med kyang ngo //

original: sdug pa'i bu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don nye bar gnas pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: sdug pa'i bu la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don nye bar gnas pa las kyang ngo //
translated: and even without external objects such as a beautiful son that are present.

original: des na lus ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rten ma yin na /🔽gang gis brgyud nas 'dod @103a * //
analyzed: des na lus ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rten ma yin na / gang gis brgyud nas 'dod @103a * //
translated: Therefore, the body is not the support of pleasure, etc.

original: chags la sogs pa'i rten du 'gyur /
analyzed: chags la sogs pa'i rten du 'gyur /
translated: By what means is it the support of desire, etc. indirectly?

original: des na mig la sogs pa ltar lus ni she sar ba la sogs ba'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: des na mig la sogs pa ltar lus ni she sar ba la sogs ba'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: Therefore, like the eye, etc., the body is not the support of pleasure, etc. This is established.

original: des na shes rab la sogs pa ltar dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa lus la brten pa ma yin no //🔽gang gis skye ba dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa 'dus pa la sogs pas bskyed pa'i dran pa nyams pa de ltar rtogs pa /
analyzed: des na shes rab la sogs pa ltar dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa lus la brten pa ma yin no // gang gis skye ba dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa 'dus pa la sogs pas bskyed pa'i dran pa nyams pa de ltar rtogs pa /
translated: Therefore, like wisdom and so on, the degeneration of memory and so on are not based on the body.🔽If you think that the degeneration of memory and so on is produced by the assembly of causes that produce it,

original: dmigs pa dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par 'ga' zhig tu mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par 'ga' zhig tu mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: and that you see that such a cause is sometimes the cause of the degeneration of memory and so on,🔽and sometimes the cause of the non-degeneration of memory and so on,

original: dran pa nyams pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the degeneration of memory is also like that.

original: rgyu khyad par can ni sngar ba'i khyad par tsam mo //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par can ni sngar ba'i khyad par tsam mo //
translated: The special cause is merely the special cause of the previous.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon par ro //
translated: In other cases means in the case of suppression.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Like that means applying to the meaning.

original: nyes pa las zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni skyes pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa las zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni skyes pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From faults means from the explanation of this, from arising.

original: yang na dmigs pa nye ba gang yin pa de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa nye ba gang yin pa de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, because that which is near the object is produced.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa las dran pa sad pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa las dran pa sad pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words “etc.” include the arousal of memory by means of alchemy, etc.

original: mjug sdud pa'i lus ni blo'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa'i lus ni blo'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The concluding summary is “the body is not the support of mind.”

original: gal te lus bde ba la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te lus bde ba la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the body is the support of pleasure, etc.,

original: blo yang brgyud nas lus la brten pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo yang brgyud nas lus la brten pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that the mind is also indirectly supported by the body?

original: des na lus log na blo ldog pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: des na lus log na blo ldog pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na /
translated: If so, what is the contradiction in the cessation of the mind when the body ceases?

original: lus ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, “The body is not the support of the mind.”

original: des de dag kyang zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa yang ste /
analyzed: des de dag kyang zhes bya ba bde ba la sogs pa yang ste /
translated: The words “those” in the root text refer to pleasure, etc.

original: blo tsam ni ma zad do //
analyzed: blo tsam ni ma zad do //
translated: The mind alone does not cease.

original: dmigs pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol la'o //
translated: The words “in relation to another object” mean in relation to an external object.

original: 'di'i gtsor bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di'i gtsor bya ba ni /
translated: The root text states, “The body is the principal object.”

original: dper na nang gi yul la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na nang gi yul la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with “For example, in relation to an internal object.”

original: 'o na sems rten med par thal lo snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sems rten med par thal lo snyam na /
translated: If this is so, then it follows that the mind has no support.

original: de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, “Therefore . . . ”

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dang / yul dang lus ni blo'i rten ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dang / yul dang lus ni blo'i rten ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sense faculties, objects, and body are not the basis of cognition.

original: dgongs pa ni gal te gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pa de lta na yang nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos por gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyun kho na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gal te gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pa de lta na yang nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa las byung ba'i dngos por gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyun kho na rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The idea is that even if the relationship of support and the supported, imagined by others, does not exist, still, the stream of consciousness, which is the appropriator and the entity that arises from the appropriator, is the support and the supported.

original: yang sems lus kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las nges snyam na /
analyzed: yang sems lus kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las nges snyam na /
translated: But how is it known that the mind does not follow the formative forces of the body?

original: lus ni rten nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni rten nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The body is the support.

original: 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid rten gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rten gyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid rten gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rten gyi sgras brjod do //
translated: The mind is said to be the support because the cause of the support is the conformity with the formative forces.

original: lus kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes @103b su mi 'jug pa yang lus kyi phul byung 'grib med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zid to //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes @103b su mi 'jug pa yang lus kyi phul byung 'grib med par zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zid to //
translated: The mind does not follow the formative forces of the body because it is said that the mind is not diminished when the body is diminished.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni chos mi mtshungs par brjod pa ni sems gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni chos mi mtshungs par brjod pa ni sems gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The condition as direct antecedent is a mind that is different, as stated in the verse.

original: 'di ni gzhal ba la sogs pas mi gsal ba la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhal ba la sogs pas mi gsal ba la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //

analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i //

translated: “It would be directed elsewhere” is explained in the line “when, etc.

original: rjes su mi mthun pa skyed pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir de ltar 'du byed pa'i khyad par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mi mthun pa skyed pa'o // gang gi phyir de ltar 'du byed pa'i khyad par skyed pa'o //
translated: It does not generate a cognition that is in accordance with its object” means that it does not generate at all, or it generates what is not in accordance.🔽Because of that, the mind becomes different due to the difference in the motivating dispositions.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyi sems tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyi sems tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the mind becomes different due to the difference in the motivating dispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Consciousness does not occur if the previous consciousness does not exist.”

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i nye bar len pa can nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i nye bar len pa can nyid do //
translated: It is the appropriator of the former consciousness.

original: sems nyid ldog na sems ldog gi lus ldog na ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid ldog na sems ldog gi lus ldog na ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the mind is reversed, the mind is reversed, but if the body is reversed, it is not.

original: sems ni rnam pa thams cad bzlog par mi nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa thams cad bzlog par mi nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba'o //

original: lus nyid las zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i bdag nyid can las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus nyid las zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i bdag nyid can las zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dbang po las rnam par shes pa skye bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las rnam par shes pa skye bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that consciousness arises from the sense faculties.

original: gal te de ltar rten yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rten yin mod /
translated: If that is so, it is a support,

original: de ltar na yang rang log na ldog par byed pa go ci ltar snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rang log na ldog par byed pa go ci ltar snyam na /

analyzed: brgyud pas zhes gsungs so //

original: me brgyud pas rgyu yin yang zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: me brgyud pas rgyu yin yang zhes 'brel to //

analyzed: du ba'i rjes la skyes pa'i ni bskyed bya'i du ba la ltos nas skyed byed du 'gyur ba'i du ba'i rjes su las so //
translated: That which arises after smoke is the producer in dependence on the smoke to be produced, and it follows after the smoke.

original: das bskyed pa'i zlog par byed pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: das bskyed pa'i zlog par byed pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the reversal is not produced by that.

original: 'on kyang rang log pas zlog par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang log pas zlog par byed pa kho na yin te /

translated: Because even without a causal continuum, that is not established, and because the weak appropriation is reversed by itself, without being grasped by what is already established.

original: 'di ni skye ba phyi ma med pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba phyi ma med pa'i dpe yin no //

analyzed: snga na med pa'i sems can skye ba la yang brjod pa ni me gzhan yang zhes bya'o //

original: skabs la nye bar sbyor ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs la nye bar sbyor ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application to the present case is in the same way.

analyzed: snga na med pa lus las skye bas zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten snga na med pa bstan to // 'jig @104a * //

analyzed: rten phyi ma med par ston pa ni rgyun chad pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: du ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i yang dpe'o //

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The conclusion is, “No. ”

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog ba rnams dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na gang gis de log na ldog pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog ba rnams dbang po la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro // des na gang gis de log na ldog pa'am /
translated: Because the conceptual thoughts of intrinsic nature, purusha, Ishvara, etc. do not depend on the sense faculties.

original: snga na med pa'i sems can skye bar 'gyur ba lus ni brgyud pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i sems can skye bar 'gyur ba lus ni brgyud pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the body is not the cause of the continuum, because when that is reversed, it is reversed, or because a sentient being would be born without a prior cause.

original: zur gyis bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: zur gyis bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma la brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent’s position, which is stated indirectly, is,

original: du ba me las ji 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du ba me las ji 'dra ba zhes bya'o //

original: 'dir ni sngar bshad zin pa nyid skabs kyis yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni sngar bshad zin pa nyid skabs kyis yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: Here, what was previously explained is again explained because of the context.

analyzed: khyad par yang brjod pa ni thams cad la khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la khyab ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la khyab ba'o //
translated: It pervades the mental continua of all sentient beings.

original: skye ba dang po la sogs pa yang zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: skye ba dang po la sogs pa yang zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: The words “in the first birth, etc.” are drawn out from within the verse.

original: rang bzhin mtshungs pa nyid yin pa zhes sbyar ro //🔽de ltar du ba'i dpes 'jig rten snga na med par ma grub po zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin mtshungs pa nyid yin pa zhes sbyar ro // de ltar du ba'i dpes 'jig rten snga na med par ma grub po zhes bstan nas /

analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma med par yang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i don du du ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, having shown that the world is not established as non-existent prior to the cause, in order to show that the world is not established as non-existent after the cause, he says, “The smoke,” etc.

original: des na du ba'i rgyun ni me'i khyad par log na rnam par chad bar rigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na du ba'i rgyun ni me'i khyad par log na rnam par chad bar rigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the stream of smoke is reasonable to be interrupted when the special fire is stopped.

original: yid kyi blo ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: yid kyi blo ni de lta ma yin no zhes bshad pa na /
translated: When it is said that the mental cognition is not like that,

original: shes rab la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, “Wisdom, etc.”

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes rab la sogs pa nyid kyi lus las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyang shes rab la sogs pa nyid kyi lus las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the characteristic of mental consciousness is not in the body of wisdom and so on.

original: de ni phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir du ba bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa dus phyis 'chad par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni phyis kyang yod pa'i phyir du ba bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa dus phyis 'chad par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Since it exists later, how could wisdom and so on be explained later, like smoke?

original: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod gyur na //
analyzed: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod gyur na //
translated: What is the impelling force?

original: phyis kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid //🔽ces bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid // ces bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Later, it is just like that.

original: des na zhes khong nas de dag lus kyis gnas par byas pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na zhes khong nas de dag lus kyis gnas par byas pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since that is the system, therefore, it is not that they are made to abide in the body.

original: des na lus log na ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na lus log na ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it does not cease when the body ceases,

original: 'jig rten pha rol mi srid pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol mi srid pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: it is not that the world beyond is impossible.

original: dbang po la ma ltos par bsgrubs pas rtsod pa dang po spangs pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: dbang po la ma ltos par bsgrubs pas rtsod pa dang po spangs pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: The first objection is refuted by establishing that it does not depend on the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i nus pa rnam par rtog pa la zhog ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i nus pa rnam par rtog pa la zhog ste /
translated: The capacity of the sense faculties is imagined.

original: shes pa snga ma la ma ltos par ni rang gi shes pa la yang nus pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa snga ma la ma ltos par ni rang gi shes pa la yang nus pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not capable of itself, without depending on a prior cognition.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by “furthermore.”

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid la ltos nas skye ba yin pa de'i tshe du ba @104b dper ci ltar srid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid la ltos nas skye ba yin pa de'i tshe du ba @104b dper ci ltar srid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it is born in dependence on a prior cognition, then how is it possible, as in the case of smoke?

original: sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ma ltos pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ma ltos pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from not depending on prior dispositions.

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ltos pas kho na las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ltos pas kho na las yin te /
translated: But it is only from depending on prior dispositions.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa las sngon gyi rnam par shes pa la ltos par brjod pa de nyid 'grel par sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ltos par brjod pa ni ;
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa las sngon gyi rnam par shes pa la ltos par brjod pa de nyid 'grel par sngon gyi 'du byed pa la ltos par brjod pa ni ;
translated: In the Kārikā it is said that it depends on a prior cognition, and in the commentary it is said that it depends on prior dispositions.

original: 'du byed pa ci lta ba bzhin du shes pa snga ma yang /
analyzed: 'du byed pa ci lta ba bzhin du shes pa snga ma yang /
translated: Dispositions are like a prior cognition.

original: dbang po'i shes pa snga ma nyid du bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa snga ma nyid du bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement in the Kārikā is that it is a prior cognition of a sense faculty.

original: sngon gyi rnam par shes pa la ltos pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi rnam par shes pa la ltos pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that it depends on a prior cognition🔽means that it depends on prior dispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma g-yos na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma g-yos na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If the previous consciousness were to move” means if the previous consciousness were to move to the next moment.

original: mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because it would not arise” means

original: dbang po'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'o //
translated: the sense consciousness.

original: gzhan dag mi skye ba mi bzod nas gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag mi skye ba mi bzod nas gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Others would not arise” means that if the previous consciousness were to move to the next moment, the next moment would not arise.

original: des pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because there would be no certainty”

original: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi ga dang 'brel to /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi ga dang 'brel to /
translated: connects both the previous and the next.

original: des na nges pa med phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na nges pa med phyir zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Therefore, anticipating the qualm, “If there is no certainty, then there is no consciousness,”🔽it is said, “All consciousnesses that realize nonexistence should be accepted as being uncertain.”

original: med pa zhes bya ba med par rtogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyi rig pa nyid nges pa med nyid las khas long shig / gang gi phyir nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni thams cad la yang brjod par nus pa yin
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba med par rtogs pa gang yin pa de thams cad kyi rig pa nyid nges pa med nyid las khas long shig / gang gi phyir nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni thams cad la yang brjod par nus pa yin
translated: The reason, “because there is no certainty,” can be applied to everything.

original: no // de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: no // de lta yin na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: gal te nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If there is no certainty” means

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lta yin na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ltar 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lta yin na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ltar 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: “Well then,” he says, “it is not the case that the other world does not exist, just as in the case of the sense consciousnesses.”

original: ci'i phyir ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not the case?

original: thams cad du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Because of the absence of certainty everywhere.”

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: The other world, etc., are also like that.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But,” he says, “in the case of the other’s cognition, etc.,”

original: nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: the absence of certainty is not a reason.

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba'o //
translated: But rather, the cause is incomplete.

original: nges pa med pa las ni tha snyad ldog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa med pa las ni tha snyad ldog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the absence of certainty is merely the cessation of the conventional.

original: gang du nges pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes so zhes tha snyad du byed pa der ni rig pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du nges pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes so zhes tha snyad du byed pa der ni rig pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the conventional expression “not arisen,” because of the absence of certainty, the cause of knowledge is the sense faculty, etc.

original: des na nus pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na nus pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the cause of the capacity exists,

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la ni tshul 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la ni tshul 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the other world, etc., do not have this mode.

original: des na dngos po med pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Therefore, it is only a nonentity.

original: gang du yang rig pa med pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang du yang rig pa med pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: But how can it be said that there is no awareness anywhere?

original: grub pa'i mthar ni rnam pa 'di ma bkag pa kho nar rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang skabs 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni rnam pa 'di ma bkag pa kho nar rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang skabs 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: In the philosophical system, this aspect is not refuted, but it is established by another aspect.

original: 'o na nges pa'i rgyu yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na nges pa'i rgyu yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Well then, what is the cause of ascertainment?”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “ Or” refers to another.

original: nyams su myong ngo cog la ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ngo cog la ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: In all experiences, conceptualization does not arise,

original: @105a * // 'on kyang gsal ba la ltos pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: @105a * // 'on kyang gsal ba la ltos pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //

analyzed: rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o // rnam par rtog pa skyed pa la nyams su myong ba bzhin du /
translated: “ Awareness” refers to the philosophical system.🔽It cannot be said that, in the production of conceptualization, the experience is the cause,

original: nyams su myong pa bskyed pa la yang de'i rgyu mi gsal bar mtshungs so zhes ni brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong pa bskyed pa la yang de'i rgyu mi gsal bar mtshungs so zhes ni brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
translated: but in the production of experience, its cause is not clear.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: “ Or” and so on means the following.

original: de'i rang gi rgyud ces bya ba ni dbang po dang yul nye ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i rang gi rgyud ces bya ba ni dbang po dang yul nye ba yin la /
translated: “Its own continuum” means that the sense faculty and object are proximate.

analyzed: de dag nyams pa med pa'i dus na ni gsal pa yang gnas pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When they are not impaired, then the clarity is also just stability.

original: skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “That which produces” is a tenet.🔽“This” refers to the consciousness that was previously mentioned.

analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi shes pa nyid las nges par gzung ba'i don dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba'o //

analyzed: phyis nas rang rig pa'i mngon sum bshad pa'i skabs su bab pa ni bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: des na shes pa snga ma dang lhang cig pa'i dngos po kho na skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it is only the object that is simultaneous with the prior consciousness that is produced.🔽It is not anything else.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “Happiness” and so on are explained.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang gzhan pa'i sems mtha' dag go //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang gzhan pa'i sems mtha' dag go //
translated: It is the entirety of the sense consciousnesses and all other minds.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs la brten nas kyang sems ni sems kyi rgyu can yin gyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs la brten nas kyang sems ni sems kyi rgyu can yin gyi /
translated: In dependence on the system of the Yogacaras, he shows that mind has mind as its cause,

original: be mas po'i rang bzhin dbang po'i rgyu can ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: be mas po'i rang bzhin dbang po'i rgyu can ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //

original: dbang po shes pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: dbang po shes pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
translated: Because of the nature of the sense consciousnesses,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

analyzed: dbang po'i shes ba lta bu'i rang bzhin de snang ba gang la yod pa'o //
translated: that which has the nature of the sense consciousnesses.

original: dbang po'i shes par 'dod pa dang rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes par 'dod pa dang rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to the nature of the sense consciousnesses,🔽it is similar to the sense consciousnesses.

original: mtshungs par snang ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs par snang ba de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that which appears similarly?

original: mdun na gnas par gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid des /
analyzed: mdun na gnas par gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid des /
translated: It is the very appearance that is clear in front.🔽Because of that reason,

analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te gsal ba'i shes pa ni dbang po nyid las yin par dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: means that is the meaning.🔽If the clear consciousness is not observed to arise from the sense faculty itself,

analyzed: de ci ltar dbang po'i stobs las byung bar dam 'cha' zhes mthong ba dang 'gal bar dogs pa la /

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “If” and so on.

original: de'i tsho zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tsho zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: “At that time” is supplied from the commentary.

original: dbang po med par zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po med par zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Without a sense faculty” and so on.

analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o // gsal ba tsam ni 'khrul bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “But” is the opponent’s view.

original: gsal ba khyad par can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba khyad par can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bsam pa'o //
translated: “The mere clarity would be mistaken” means that the clarity would be mistaken, but the specific clarity would not be mistaken.

analyzed: gal te 'di ltar 'chel na de'i tshe dbang po'i shes pa nyid 'ga' yang med do zhes ston pa @105b ni de ni med de zhes bya ba'o //

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If there is no sense consciousness,

analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'ga' zhig tu slu ba dang / gzhan du de lta ma yin par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how is it that sometimes it is deceptive and sometimes it is not?

original: don yod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don yod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “Because the object exists.”

original: mdun na gnas par gsal ba'i rnam pa can du khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: mdun na gnas par gsal ba'i rnam pa can du khyad par med kyang /
translated: Although there is no difference in the aspect of clarity that appears in front of us,

original: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: slu ba dang cig shos ni ci rigs par te yod pa dang med pa las rnam par gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: dbang pos bskyed pa dang ma bskyed pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni de'i rnam pa can gyi zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: mdun na gnas par gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi'o //
translated: It has the aspect of the clear appearance of what is present in front.

analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed phyi ma la 'jug par byed pa'o // de'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni yod pa'am med pa yang ste /

analyzed: zhen par byed pa'i gzhal bya gang dang gang yin pa de lta bu'i rnam pa 'di la yod ba'o zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi tshul yin no //

analyzed: gzugs med pa na yang nga'o zhes bya ba'i rnam pa srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na mdun na gnas par gsal bar snang ba 'di yang shes pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'i rnam pa can nyid de yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can nyid de yang ngo //

analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po de de'i rnam pa can nyid de'i rgyu ma yin no //

original: 'on ci ltar 'ga' zhig la mi slu ba srid ce na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar 'ga' zhig la mi slu ba srid ce na /
translated: Well, how is it possible that it is not deceptive?

original: mi slu ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi slu ba ni zhes gsungs so //

original: don yod pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: don yod pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Having an object” is as before.

original: gal te de lta na yang dbang pos byas par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang dbang pos byas par 'gyur ro snyam na /

original: gzhan ni zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes gsungs so ;
translated: “Another” is stated.

analyzed: / gzhan ni zhes bya ba dbang po ni ji skad bshad pa'i don gzhan gyi 'bras bu la'o //

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o /
translated: “Or” is with regard to another.

analyzed: 'dis ni dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba'i gtan tshigs khyab pa med par dogs pa bsu ba yin no //

analyzed: de lta na yang skabs nyams pa med do zhes bya bar gzigs nas grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa na /
translated: Nevertheless, seeing that there is no degeneration in this context, he stated the tenets.

original: de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: And he said, “That also.🔽” “

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: Sense faculty” is the subject.🔽“

original: sad pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi khyad par ro //🔽goms pa las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: sad pa'i zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi khyad par ro // goms pa las skye ba yin te /
translated: Of one who is awake” is a distinction of the subject.🔽“

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Arises from habituation” is what is to be proven.🔽“
